199001.name: Rotation
199001.description:
A challenging maze game that combines elements of a maze and connect four.

Each player gets 9 chips. Insert your chips in the maze wheel. Turn the wheel to strategically move your chips through the maze wheel. Maneuver the maze wheel to get your chips in the slots. Get three chips in a row to win the game.

199002.name: Acolyte of the Dragonfly
199002.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all potentially the Acolyte of the Dragonfly. They are sharing the process of identifying which one should become the next Acolyte. The process allows each character to gain narrative focus during the game. Other characters attempt to interpret dream images; those who correctly identify the images gain a token. At the end of the game, the character who has accumulated the most tokens is recognizes as the next Acolyte.

199003.name: Followed by Dragonflies
199003.description:
User summary:

The game is a minimal and rules-light implementation of the Apocalypse World Engine. Game play requires players be familiar with those rules. The game consists of a series of print-and-play Dragonfly Cards, each representing a "Dragonfly" character. Players select or are dealt a card for play. The game's simplicity is intended to allow the entire product to be contained in the space of a typical pack of playing cards, and to be playable while traveling.

199004.description:
A push-your-luck dexterity game with cards.
As a chef at TOSS pancake house, you flip pancakes in front of the customers whilst entertaining them with your frying pan skills. Get enough positive feedback and you could win the coveted 'Employee of the Month' trophy.

Each pancake has a different action/skill to perform. The more cards you decide to draw, the more actions you'll have to perform at the same time, but the greater the reward should you succeed in tossing the stack.

The cards feature frying pans, pancakes with different toppings, score tracker and trophy.
You'll also need 2 to 4 small cubes or similar (1 colour per player) to track scores.

TOSS was voted Best Dexterity Game in the 2016 9 Card Nanogame PnP Design Contest
199004.name: TOSS: a flippin' tasty nanogame

199005.name: Dragonship
199005.description:
The Dragonship is a ship that travels through time. Its crew finds themselves more or less adrift. They can move through the currents of space-time and inject themselves into various histories…However, they have lost track of the meaning of any of the events they witness. Are they changing history, or is history changing them?

The Dragonship skims endlessly through history, dipping into events here and there. Some crew perish, some new folk are taken on; however, the ship cannot stay too long in the same space-time locale, as stillness takes hold of it and threatens to pin it down forever.

boardgameintegration.154560: Adventure Time Card Wars: BMO vs. Lady Rainicorn

199007.description:
Adventure Time Card Wars: Doubles Tournament takes the familiar format of Adventure Time Card Wars and doubles up on everything as players compete against one another in teams of two. Play as Jake (Cornfield/NiceLands) and Charlie (Blue Plains/NiceLands) vs. Grand Prix (SandyLands/IcyLands) and Moniker (Useless Swamps/IcyLands) with new cards that excel in a team environment, although you can also swap these cards into other Adventure Time Card Wars titles.

In this game, each player has their own deck and sits across from their partner between two opponents. Two of your landscapes point left, the other two right. Each team has 40 hit points, and to win you need to bring the opponents down to zero. Gameplay is identical to the 1v1 version of Adventure Time Card Wars, but now you need to guard against attack from two opponents while trying to help out your partner when needed.

One special addition to this set is Teamwork cards, which don't occupy a lane. Each player can control one, and these cards give you and your partner a benefit turn after turn...if you play your cards right.
199007.name: Adventure Time Card Wars: Doubles Tournament

199008.name: Escape From Dreamland
199008.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by Traits. Traits have a rating from one to five; they are purchased from a small points pool at creation. Traits function "on dream-logic", so they are somewhat variable in performance. A Trait's rating determines the size of the dice pool associated with the trait.

During play, characters accumulate Lightning Points (vaguely like experience points). Once sufficient Lightning Points are accumulated, the characters can use them to Escape From Dreamland. Escape must be performed with the entire party.

199009.description: Nine new sets of promotional cards for use within the Millennium Blades Card Board Game. These cards feature characters from other Level 99 Games Products. Each promo set contains 6 cards, for a total of 54 cards.
199009.name: Millennium Blades: Crossover (Promo Pack #1)

199010.description:
Nine additional sets of promotional cards for use within the Millennium Blades Card Board Game.

These promo sets were Sponsored by friends in the gaming industry who have offered to let us print some of their characters on promotional Millennium Blades cards! These cards will be hard to find outside the project.

Includes:
Mage Wars Promo Set
UFS Red Horizon Promo Set
Terrene Odyssey Promo Set
Neuroshima Hex Promo Set
Heroes Wanted Promo Set
Frame Wars: Mechs Promo Set
Frame Wars: Pilots Promo Set
Resistor_Extra Core Cards
Dragon Punch Extra Core Cards
199010.name: Millennium Blades: Sponsors (Promo Pack #2)

199011.name: The Exodus Of Israel
199011.description:
A quick historical family game for all ages.

The Exodus Of Israel is one of the most well known and preserved events of ancient times, being found in many sources, including the Old Testament writings acknowledged by the Islamic, Judaic, and Christian faiths. It follows the story of the tribes of Jacob, having relocated to Egypt during a severe famine. Initially welcomed due to the favor earned by Jacob's son Joseph, generations later forced into slavery by a Pharaoh who no longer remembered or cared for the growing nation of outsiders. The God of Jacob (re-named Israel before his death) hears the plight of the nation, and delivers them out of the hand of Pharaoh through a series of plagues which break down the hardened will of Pharaoh as well as show His power in the eyes of the region. Led by the prophet Moses, the Israelites are granted their freedom, and immediately make their migration (Exodus) back to the land promised them by God. The journey was not a pleasant one. Being in the desert with stressed resources, it often led to complaining, and sometimes outright rebellion against Moses and God Himself despite leading and providing for them.

This game is for 2-4 players, and at essence is a roll-and move game suitable for children. However there are also several elements of choice involved, and anyone with an interest in the Exodus story would enjoy following the path of the Israelites and being re-acquainted with the joys and pitfalls experienced along the way. The game can accommodate non-readers and readers alike, and has been designed to be playable independent of direct parental supervision. The winner of the game manages to make the journey from Egypt to the Promised Land with the most amount of points.

199012.description: They are savage, dangerous and covered in blood, but if you give them their money, you are on the safe side. Mercenaries are totally unique new cards that are different from the watchmen. Mercenaries can help you economically, they can harm your opponent and they activate global events! This expansion brings you a different strategic element and it offers new options. It also spices up and dramatizes a 2-player game. (Artwork is not suitable for kids and those who don't have stomach for it.)
199012.name: Watchmen of Destiny: Bloody Mercenaries Expansion

199013.name: You're Fired: Interns
199013.description:
They’re pretty useless on their own, but when combined with other cards, they can actually be pretty useful! Who knew?

An Intern may copy any one ability from any card in your hand. This can be a standard ability or a reactive ability and would be played as if it were written on the Intern card.

199014.name: You're Fired: Corporate Zombies
199014.description:
The search for brains has backfired! Employees are dropping like flies and taking their co-workers with them. Beware.

A Corporate Zombie has no ability, and can be played to the break room with no effect. If a Corporate Zombie is fired, it takes two more employees to the Unemployment Line with it.

199015.name: You're Fired: Bonus Pack
199015.description: 5 Kickstarter stretch goal cards for You're Fired. Includes 2 alternate Bosses, 2 additional Consultants, and a very special Company President card that comes in and fires everyone in sight.

199016.name: Get Well Soon
199016.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are relatives of a dying person. They gather to remember stories about the nearly deceased individual. A rules-light card flip mechanic determines which stories are based in consensus and which are remembered differently by different characters. At some point in the game, the dying person dies (determines by a specific card play).

199017.name: Back Home
199017.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are attempting to keep a deployed team safe from hazards and get them home in good health. The game is atypical inasmuch as the focus of play remains on the non-player characters, controlled by the game master, while the player characters are essentially a sedentary "think tank" that suggests actions. The characters are not particularly defined in the game, though the non-player characters are.

This construction is an interesting twist on tabletop gaming, essentially setting the dominant paradigm upside down.

199018.name: Over-Agitation
199018.description:
User summary:

The game is extremely rules-light; players self-enroll in the game from the public at large, by listening to a series of podcasts ("role-casts") that form the game to date and then creating their own addition to the narrative as a brief podcast. The game should focus on modern "media frenzy" topics (e.g., over-agitation), though confusingly the play examples seem to be dreamlike or fantasy scenes.

199019.name: The Sacrilegious Sage
199019.description:
Publisher blurb:

A Tweak & Toss adventure seed where the PCs are asked to delve deep underground to prove a sage's theory on the origin of life.

User summary:

This "generic" adventure is compatible with any "old school" fantasy game system. The adventure does not present statistics but only narrative encounters and maps. Prior to use, the game master would need to "tweak" the module by deriving statistics, etc., for whatever rules system is being used.

199020.name: Divine Conflict
199020.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are humans with special abilities. They have been selected by a newly emerging goddess to interact with the old, existing gods. Characters attempt to project thoughts and images into the gods' minds, healing them of their madness and directing them into new, positive pathways. The game uses a fairly simple mechanic of grouping aspects, trials, and ideas into a triad. A dice roll determines success. A pack of cards can optionally be used during play to foster random events.

199021.description: Given out at Convention Booths. After you play this card, give it to another player. She must play it in her next word or discard it and automatically fail her sanity check.
199021.name: Unspeakable Words: "K is for Exploding Kithulhu" Promo Card

199022.name: Timberman
199022.description:
User Summary

Your lumberjack cuts either from the left or right, trying to avoid branches to avoid being hit on the head.

199023.name: Epistory

videogamehonor.35950: 2016 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee

199023.description:
Epistory - Typing Chronicles is a beautiful atmospheric 3D action/adventure typing game that tells the story of a writer lacking inspiration who asks her muse to help write her latest book.

It features a visually stunning papercraft art style and blends light RPG elements with exploration and unique combat mechanics solely using the keyboard.

Source: The Game Website.

199025.name: OrgoglioNerd: Area Stampa
199025.description:
An italian party card game, where you impersonate a journalist who wants to make a career to become the new head chief of the redaction OrgolioNerd ("NerdProud") and overthrows the current evil director Rinoceronte ("Rhino").

You can accumulate ego points in three different ways: with good manners, bad manners or appealing to your nerd culture.
You can write news articles, or steal that from your opponents, each method is permissible for the win!

From the back of the box (Italian):

Grazie ad OrgoglioNerd: Area Stampa potrete vivere l'ebrezza di far parte della redazione nerdescha più nota d'Italia!

Quali redattori di OrgoglioNerd avrete 3 modi per chiudere i vostri articoli prima che vengano caricati su uno dei portali di nerdinformazione più cliccati di sempre: con le Buone, con le Cattive oppure semplicemente facendo appello alla vostra profonda cultura da fanboy di fumetti & co. Nessuno dei 3 modi di fare può definirsi migliore degli altri, bisogna sapersi adattare per soddisfare i capricci dell'incontentabile caporedattore, il Rinoceronte. Riuscire a soddisfarlo non sarà per niente facile e pezzo dopo pezzo accumulerete un Ego tale da farvi pensare che sia possibile scalzarlo dalla sua ingombrante posizione per reclamarne il posto... Ci riuscirete? Beh, in bocca al Rinoceronte!

OrgoglioNerd: Area Stampa è un gioco di carte in cui vestirete i panni di uno dei redattori del portale. Ciascuno di voi sarà caratterizzato da un potere unico legato alla vostra particolare personalità da nerd che durante il gioco potrete sfruttare per interagire con i vostri avversari. Per vincere dovrete riuscire a conquistare 3 punti Ego, ottenuti chiudendo gli articoli che il mazzo di carte al centro del tavolo vi proporrà di volta in volta, oppure fregando il pezzo ai vostri avversari. Entrambi i metodi sono più che leciti, starà a voi risolverli con le Buone, con le Cattive o a Modo vostro. Una volta raggiunto il terzo Ego otterrete il titolo di Rinoceronte, ma per vincere la partita dovrete dimostrare di esserne degni sfidando i vostri avversari e abbattendoli uno ad uno a colpi di mood. Il nuovo Rinoceronte sarà colui che riuscirà a dimostrarsi degno del titolo di predatore ultimo e di leader indiscusso della redazione!

Prodotto realizzato in collaborazione con la redazione di OrgoglioNerd.

Elementi del gioco:
55 carte
6 segnalini Ego
1 regolamento

199026.description:
Neko-In is a game for 3-6 players lasting about 15-20 minutes, in which we will try to find lovely and gummy colored kittens (“neko” in Japanese) hidden in the remote corners of a typical house of Japan.
The first player who will dug out the little animals from their possible hideouts will be the winner.
You need a bit of strategy and a speedy hand.

First players receive a room each. On the room boards there are 5 empty spaces for the "Hideouts".
Players receive randomly 5 hideout counters each and place them “covered” in front of them.
Finally all kittens are placed in the garden which is in the center of the table.

The goal of the game is to get rid of all the hideout counters before your opponents. Each counter should be placed on its appropriate slot, according to the shape and color of the room.
How to do it? Each turn a player move his own cat (the one corresponding to the color of his room’s frame) and according to the his counters he chooses the room where hiding the cat. If he chooses his own room then he can place the cat on any slot of his choice. But if he chooses to move his cat to a room controlled by an opponent, it’s up to the owner to choose where to place it.

When your cat is placed on a slot that corresponds to one of your hideout counters (according to the shape and color of the room), discover it and place it on the corresponding position; but remember, each room cannot host more than one cat because they are not willing to share a territory. If you place your cat on a board occupied by another cat, the brawl starts.

After this phase starts the “Housekeeper moment“.
The current player rolls a die. All players compete to grab the matching colored kitten, wherever it is. The fastest hand moves the caught kitten to the garden and pass one of his remained counters, of his choice, to the player with less counters. If there are 2 or more opponents with the same number of counters left, he can choose the target. However he can never pass his last counter, which must necessarily be placed on the appropriate slot.

The first player that remains with no hideout counters is the winner.
199026.name: Neko-in

199027.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately. This set contains the Hurricane I, which was used in the Battle of Britain.
199027.name: Table Air Combat: Hurricane Mk.I

199028.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately. This set contains the He-111, which was used in the Battle of Britain and the remainder of World War II.
199028.name: Table Air Combat: He-111

199029.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Ki-43 Hayabusa. Known as "Oscar" to the allies, the Ki-43 was used extensively by the Imperial Japanese Army. This extremly lightweight fighter was even more agile than the famous Zero, but was more fragile and was undergunned.
199029.name: Table Air Combat: Ki-43 Oscar

199030.name: Sauve Moutons
199030.description:
In Sauve Moutons you help the shepherd guiding his herd to the house on top of the 3D threeleveled (and divided in quarters) mountain. But beware the really hungry wolf!

Each side (the wolf and the sheep) has a different deck. The cards of the wolf are face down in a stack while every sheep card is displayed on the table. In turns each player chooses one card for the herd and applies the movement depicted in it (from one to three arrows in every direction but downhill) trying to take the majority of the herd into the uphill sheepfold. After that he reveals a wolf card and must apply its movement, which may result in the wolf capturing one of the sheep.

Players share the victory if at least 6 sheep (out of 10) arrive safe to the top.

199032.description:
Clash of Corsairs is an expansion for Aether Captains and not a standalone game. This expansion includes new components for the Navy Commander and the Empire as well. Clash of Corsairs adds 2 new ships for the Navy Commander as well as new Action Cards but also different and new Objectives for the protector of Arkady that increase the replayability of the game.

The main focus in this expansion is to give to the Commander alternative missions, alternative game endings as well a variety of new ships and Action cards that introduce to the base game new effects and abilities. At the same time the Land of Arkady is expanded since the new hex tiles grow the whole Empire adding new locations and revealing new powers! Lastly you will be able to discover new Crew Member with unique abilites that will help you during the game!
199032.name: Aether Captains: Clash of Corsairs

199033.description:
Fleet of Doom is the 2nd expansion of Aether Captains and is not a standalone game. This expansion includes new components for the War-Captains. It adds the triple dice-ships for the War-Captains along with new rules and strategies. The triple dice-ships are quite similar to the Navy Commander’s ones but are also equipped with new abilties and Action cards. The War-Captains fleet will be enpowered however there is a flow. These ships are part of more than one dice therefore a War-Captain can choose just one of those ships.

At the same time you will discover the new powers of the Action cards as well as the new Crew Members. Additionally new Objectives will turn the game into a challenge for those who join the enemy’s forces. The new Objectives offer different missions and targets for the War-Captains.
199033.name: Aether Captains: Fleet of Doom

199035.name: Fire Team Airsoft: Out
199035.description:
Fire Team Airsoft: Out is a Sub-Tactical Wargame (with a Hexagonal grid) that simulates the Airsoft. The Counters represent some Characters, that are more or less controlled by you, while assigning them the Actions that are going to do during the Game Turn, at the time of identical Scenario to those used in the game of real Airsoft. You will be able to represent yourselves by a Character in the Game, by his Dress and in particular his REPLICAS.(Replica of weapons in the scale 1:1 And being able to fire biodegradable harmless 6 mm balls).

From the publisher (French):
Le Jeu fait partie de la Série "FIRE TEAM", dont le premier est "FIRE TEAM VIETNAM", qui utilise la même base de règles concernant les Ordres d Action et les mêmes échelles de jeu.

OUT, est un Wargame Sub-Tactique qui simule l'Airsoft. Les pions représentent des Personnages, que vous contrôlez( plus ou moins), en leur attribuant des Actions qui vont effectuer au cours des Tours de Jeu, lors de Scénarios identiques à ceux utilisés dans les Parties d'Airsoft réelles. Vous pourrez également vous représenter par un Personnage dans le Jeu, par sa Tenue et ses équipements en particulier ses REPLIQUES. (Répliques d'armes à l'échelle 1:1, pouvant tirer des billes de 6 mm inoffensives et biodégradables)

199036.name: Abandoned Shop
199036.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 300th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small, recently abandoned or maybe not yet completely furnished shop.

The map is 14 x 10 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 2 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x1440 pixels in size at 144dpi.

199038.name: Villainous Achievement Feats
199038.description:
From publisher blurb:

Achieve New Feats of Villainy!

Being a villain isn’t about the powers you have, or the equipment you possess. Being a villain is about all of the horrible, terrible, and ultimately vile things that you do. The ability to cast fireball doesn’t make you villainous, but casting fireball on an orphanage run by nuns will change your alignment to evil real quick. This book presents 21 new achievement feats for villainous characters: feats whose prerequisites require you to complete heinous and nefarious deeds in order for you to be able to take them, providing the players of evil characters with encouragement and tangible rewards for being as evil as possible, and even giving them evil goals to strive to.

In this book, you will find…

Cannibalistic Consumption, a feat that provides combat bonuses for eating the flesh of members of your own race.
Dark Possession, a feat that lets you overtax the bodies of creatures you possess, enhancing them while you control them and weakening them after you discard their shells.
Ritual Mutilation, a feat that allows you to mutilate corpses before turning them into undead in order to make them more powerful.
…and much, much more!

199039.name: Carnage at Keldor Keep
199039.description:
From publisher blurb:

This week’s Filbar offering is a mid-level adventure with the party headed out towards the frontier. As they move towards high adventure, adventure finds them first! Keldor Keep is the last bastion of civilization on the frontier but has recently come under attack. With its defenders scattered it falls to the party to save the fortress and protect the border! A hit at Who’s Yer Con 2016, this adventure is more than enough challenge for a group of 4-6 level characters!

Set under the 5th edition ruleset this adventure makes for a good addition to a campaign or a useful “one-shot” adventure. This challenge takes place near a frontier but is easily adaptable to any campaign or setting.

199040.name: OneDice Supers
199040.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and easy supers role-playing rules

OneDice Supers an easy, quick and flexible role-playing game system for running Superhero games.

Whether you want to play Supers of your own design, recreate the adventures of your comic book heroes, or play in a world prepared for you, OneDice Supers has been developed to be easily adaptable for your games. Complete with a set of ready-made Supers and an adventure to get you started, everything you need to play is in this book!

199041.name: Moomin's Card Game: Nyoro Nyoro Biri-Biri
199041.description:
This is a Japanese press-your-luck game based on characters created by Finnish children's author, Tove Jansson. Each player is trying to collect the most Hattifatteners, mysterious, ghost-like creatures who grow out of the ground and are attracted to electricity.

The deck in the middle of the play area represents the mountain the Hattifatteners congregate toward, drawn by the lightning at the top. Each player begins with three plastic Hattifatteners. On their turn, each player will draw cards until they meet one of three conditions:

1) Collect 12 Hattifatteners represented on Nyoro Nyoro cards.
2) Draw a Biri-Biri card, causing them to discard all cards in their play area.
3) Choose to stop drawing, and pass to the next player.

Some cards allow you to take Hattifatteners from the field, or from other players; some cards cause you to lose Hattifatteners to the field. When the draw deck is exhausted, the player with the most Hattifatteners wins.

215820.name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Ally: Seamus Finnigan

boardgamehonor.40227: 2016 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee

199042.description:
Description from the publisher:

The forces of evil are threatening to overrun Hogwarts castle in Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle, a cooperative deck-building game, and it's up to four students to ensure the safety of the school by defeating villains and consolidating their defenses. In the game, players take on the role of a Hogwarts student: Harry, Ron, Hermione or Neville, each with their own personal deck of cards that's used to acquire resources.

By gaining influence, players add more cards to their deck in the form of iconic characters, spells, and magical items. Other cards allow them to regain health or fight against villains, keeping them from gaining power. The villains set back players with their attacks and Dark Arts. Only by working together will players be able to defeat all of the villains, securing the castle from the forces of evil.
199042.name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle

199044.name: Ride For Your Wife
199044.description:
From the introduction:

Leaper-of-Chasms, the dashing young Impala rider, spends a night of passion with his true love, Singing-Sweetly, who is betrothed to Rends-like-a-Hyena. Swooping-Falcon, Singing-Sweetly's mother and Queen of the clan, find out and says that Singing-Sweetly will only marry someone who can prove his manhood by capturing a Herd-Mother Table. The heroes hear of this the next morning, and set off to find their own Table.

This episode was written as a module to be played at conventions. It is intended for four to six pre-generated players and should take three to four hours to play.

User summary:

The document includes several page sizes, the largest of which is A4.

199045.name: The Peace Process
199045.description:
From the introduction:
Until twenty years ago, the neighboring Singing Rock and Hiord clans got on tolerably well; well enough for the young Singing Rock woman, Estave, to marry Sarotar, her true love, and leave her birth clan to join him in the Hiord clan. Soon after that, relations between the two clans began to break down and the usual cycle of cattle raids became more vicious on both sides. Eventually, a feud was declared and the fyrds skirmished. In that first battle, Brol the farmer was killed. Dorasa, his wife, managed to have him resurrected but he had the Relife sickness. Brol turned to Humakt and became Mortality, Champion of the Singing Rock clan.

This episode was written to be played at conventions. It is intended for five or six pre-generated players and should take three to four hours to play.

199046.name: Campaign Options: The Feat Reference Document
199046.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Everything You Don't Already Have!!

The Feat Resource Document has over 700 feats from the publisher of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook! It's the ultimate compilation of feats that aren't in the online Resource Document, taken from more than 100 adventures, companions and campaign sourcebooks.

All are in as close to their original format as possible with only those flavor changes required to make them 100% Open Game Content. Additionally, every feat has any word changes highlighted, so it's easy to determine if a feat has been modified in any way from the original published version, and all the needed rules sub-sets are included (so if you take Dragoncrafting, or Deific Obedience, all the rules needed to use those feats are in the Appendix).

So stop flipping through scores of splatbooks looking for exactly what you need to make a villain memorable, tie a hero to his homeland, or properly use a dwarven chain-flail. Instead, get everything you need in The Feat Reference Document! It's the ultimate Pathfinder-compatible companion rulebook.

199047.description:
Cobras are overrunning the village, so the authorities have put out a bounty on them. Seizing the opportunity, you have secretly begun breeding cobras for the extra income. However, your scheme won't go unnoticed forever, and when the authorities cancel the program, any cobras you're left with will bite you.

Cobras is a trick-taking game that is played over a series of rounds. The players who do not win a trick divide up the cobras shown on the cards that were played; the player who won the trick turns in their cobra tokens for points.

If you have any cobras in your basket when the round ends, you lose 1 point per cobra.

Add up your points from round to round. When a round ends with one or more players at 100 points or more, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.
199047.name: Cobras

199049.name: Simple Class Templates for Monsters
199049.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

These Monsters Have Class!

It Just Got Easier to Make an Encounter Harder!

Whether it’s the shaman of a pack of lizardmen, a group of gnoll mystics from the blasted deserts of Ankhara, or a succubus temptress one step more dangerous than her sisters, sometimes you just need to spice up a monster! Just slapping the advanced template on a creature often isn’t very interesting, but actually adding levels of core and base classes to monster stat blocks is time consuming and math-intensive. The simple class templates in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Monster Codex provided a fast and easy way to add the abilities of the core heroic classes to monsters, which is great when what you need is a monster with druid or rogue abilities, but that still leaves no quick way to create monstrous alchemists, antipaladins, oracles, samurai, and warpriests. Now, with the Genius Guide to Simple Class Templates for Monsters, we've add simple class templates for the 21 alternate, base, and hybrid classes the original system left out. Each comes with fast and simple rules for adding class abilities to a monster, and a fully-written out, fully- illustrated example of what an antipaladin mohrg is like. Or a ninja rakshasa. Or a warpriest frost giant. Because when you need a nalfeshnee arcanist, you don’t have time to write it up from scratch.

199050.name: Anachronistic Adventures
199050.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Prepare for Pulp Adventure!

Want two-fisted action? Dapper heroes with ESP, strong-jawed adventurers who run in, guns blazing, and sophisticated great detectives? Love the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, but you're looking for pulp adventure stories from the late 1700s to the 1940s? Then you want Anachronistic Adventures!

This pulp genre toolbox works seamlessly with the existing Pathfinder Roleplaying Game rules, and presents:

Six new 20-level classes (Cogitator, Daredevil, Enforcer, Luminary, Sensitive, and Tough) representing iconic pulp heroes concepts!
More than a score of archetypes that let you fine-tune unique modern age characters!
Rules for modern firearms, heroes without armor, low-magic campaigns, and everything else you need to run anachronistic adventures or create your own anachronistic campaign!

199051.name: Sovereign Stone Campaign Setting Core Rulebook
199051.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The epic fantasy world and tales of Sovereign Stone return in this new edition designed for the popular Pathfinder® game system! Rediscover the wondrous landscapes, creatures, and denizens conceived by renowned master of fantasy art, Larry Elmore, and popularized by Margaret Weis & Tracy Hickman in the bestselling Sovereign Stone Trilogy from HarperCollins.

This is a complete campaign setting for Pathfinder® RPG. Everything uniquely Sovereign Stone has been revised and expanded. The distinctive races—from seafaring orks, nomadic dwarves, feudal Japan-like elves, and peaceful pecwae to a half-dozen standout human cultures—are further highlighted with information compiled from previous sourcebooks. New interpretations of character classes introduce exciting options, complemented with new feats and abilities. Also featured is an innovative Hero Points system that combines rewards for roleplaying with high drama, while enabling players to influence and affect a game campaign in significant ways!

Sovereign Stone Campaign Core Rulebook is a clear, concise portal to fantastic adventures in the land of Loerem. Discover what many loyal fans who made Sovereign Stone a top game setting already know: a rich world vibrating with novelty and excitement at every turn!

199052.name: Bestiary of Loerem (Pathfinder)
199052.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bestiary of Loerem presents more than 90 new such menaces for characters to outfight, outrun, and outwit. From the grunting animan to the lash-horned whipstag, each creature is fully statted for the Pathfinder® RPG, all with description and some include options such as a player-character race. An appendix categorizing the creatures by type, CR, terrain and racial reference is also available for the GM to quickly and easily insert monstrous encounters appropriate to characters’ levels and their current whereabouts.

Open this book to an array of new friends and foes!

199053.name: Codex Mysterium (Pathfinder)
199053.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Spellcasters enter into battle in full armor, wielding spells that can fell cities. Wizards pool their energies and efforts together to unleash magic of unbelievable might and power. Mages cast spells from memory without the need to restudy them. Arcane scholars research and create their own unique spells.

The Codex Mysterium introduces alternate rules for magic and spellcasting, as well as a system for players to create new spells, all for use with the Pathfinder® RPG. Designed for the world of Loerem and the Sovereign Stone campaign setting, everything in this tome can be adapted for your Pathfinder® game.

Within these pages, you will find new spells for Elemental and Void mages, new prestige classes, rules for spell creation, plus expanded information on the practitioners of magic in the Sovereign Stone setting, including the diverse Orders within the Temple of the Magi, the enigmatic and powerful elven Wyred, the mage-guilds of Dunkarga, the rampaging Dwarven Firemages, and much more.

Open the tome to uncover the mysteries of magic!

199054.name: The Taan: Scions of the Void (Pathfinder)
199054.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Adventurers on Loerem have been astonished and dismayed to encounter a new race of creatures never before seen on this continent. Subjects of the evil demigod, Dagnarus, the Taan are a race of warriors whose focus in life is to die in battle and to take as many of their enemies with them as they can. Worshippers of the destructive Void magic, the Taan are powerful humanoids who intend to conquer and enslave all races of Loerem.

In the pages of this sourcebook, the GM will find all information necessary to add the Taan to a Sovereign Stone or Pathfinder campaign, including a history of the taan, their religious beliefs, lore and legends, their unique Void magic practices, weapons, leadership, important societal details, and their reverence for Dagnarus, the man they consider a god. The book also features rules for Taan player-characters.

This volume will provide excitement and challenges to players and GMs alike!

199055.name: The Elves: Winds of Intrigue (Pathfinder)
199055.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Maglyd cast her sword into the darkness, where it became the sun. Her cloak formed the mantle of the sky; Taglyd’s robe, the green forests. They lay together across the face of Loerem, and where they touched, life began. Their gentle words of love became the whispering of the winds. Still, Maglyd the All-Wise wept. She knew the Void had not been vanquished; it lurked yet, hidden beyond the darkness of the night. Maglyd’s tears became all the water in the world: rain, rivers, lakes, and oceans. Taglyd the strong comforted her. “We have done all we can,” he said, exhausted. “The rest remains to our children.”

Wind of Intrigue unravels the mystery that is the elves. From the Divine Parents and the Glydym to the Nine Sacred Cities and Glymrae, from the Great Houses to the Accursed outcast, this sourcebook unlocks the secrets of the Land of the Tromek previously whispered only among the elves. Featuring detailed, valuable glimpses into the elves’ highly intricate society, customs, beliefs, and daily life, Wind of Intrigue is the comprehensive guide to navigate the complex elven web of politics and understand Loerem’s “Oldest Race.”

199056.description:
Achieve political dominance of known space!
Discover planets, aim the rockets, send envoys, protect trade routes, and meet political objectives in this medium weight strategy game.

Gain influence among the galaxy’s races

Discover planets and visit them to build relations with the natives. Rivals might travel to distant planets with you, but only dominant factions increase reputation.
First impressions matter, but rival factions can steal a planet’s allegiance.
Patrol planets’ shipping routes to gain even more respect.
React to changing goals. As political climates change, respond with flexibility to ensure your prestige among the peoples of the galaxy.




Key features

A blend of worker placement, tile placement, and area majority
Changing goals and special actions keep game play fresh
Unique worker deployment mechanism
Scales well from 2-6 players
Moderate player interaction
199056.name: Interstellar Envoys

199057.name: Super Hazard Quest: New Bosses
199057.description: Our New Bosses expansion features 5 new Dungeon Cards to expand the game board further. New Mini Bosses means a new way to win and a boss prize that can give players another advantage. This expansion also features an completely new Underwater level with artwork not seen in any of the original dungeon cards.

199058.name: The Voyage of the Dragonfly
199058.description:
User summary:

This was was declared the World Champion of the Game Chef 2015 competition. It originally was submitted to the French-language competition. The game uses a custom deck of cards and a tracking sheet - both provided as print-and-play components in the document. The game's setting is adapted from the French-language radio program l'explorateur du futur (through time and space with the Professor) and play involves creating a "new" episode of the series (the game recommends the play session audio be recorded).

199059.name: Law & Order & the Otherworld
199059.description:
From the introduction:

The idea of bringing back the souls of the dead to serve as witnesses in their own murder trials has been around for as long as people have claimed the ability to talk to the dead, but juries (not to mention the legal code) have always been reluctant to accept the testimony of mediums. After all, there’s really no way to distinguish between a genuine channeler of the dead and a good actor lying in order to influence the trial. Dr. Osiris Shade attempted to increase the credibility of the dead by placing their bodies into various sorts of mechanical constructs, but there was still a question as to whether the golem’s words were really those of the dead person or simply part of an elaborate hoax. When Shade found a way to place the recovered souls into the bodies of the recently deceased, things started to change.

199060.name: Kaidankai no Akitsushima
199060.description:
User summary:

The game has peculiar requirements for the physical space of play, which will require more setup than typically is associated with a tabletop game. Play involves the use of a pack of French playing cards, with played cards compared to an action table to derive an assortment of story elements. These elements subsequently are arranged into a collaborative narrative. While the game is derived from a Japanese parlor game it incorporates only elements of the Japanese culture and is fully accessible to contemporary players.

199061.description:
The greatest warriors of history have been assembled for the ultimate battle to determine their legacy.

Warrior Clash is a capture and elimination strategy game that pits greatest warriors in history against each other. Players will draft teams of warriors, defend their land, collect resources with the goal of conquering their enemies. These battles are played atop modular gameboards which create hundreds of possible areas.

Each warrior has a different arrangement of trait scores between the categories of Grit, Agility, Ingenuity and Strength. As warriors are moved throughout the gameboard, the players will attempt to rely on relative strengths and exploit weaknesses of their enemies. When matching sides of two opponent warriors are aligned, they can do battle. The trait scores determine the handicap of the fight, but rolls of the dice determine the victor.

Will your team be the last one standing?
199061.name: Warrior Clash

199062.name: Generic Village 01
199062.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map package includes a generic village that you can use in your adventures. Maybe you need a place where the adventurers can rest, or they are on a mission to steel some artefact that is hidden somewher in the village.

It is for you to decide

The map is meant to be shown to the players during play and it works just as well for online and offline sessions.

The pdf is in letter format and consists of two different versions of the map, two coloured and two black and white. Both versions comes with and without a grid attached to it.

You also get a page where the GM can add in notes and number the different houses.

199063.name: Generic Village 02
199063.description:
From publisher blurb:

This map package includes a generic village that you can use in your adventures. Maybe you need a place where the adventurers can rest, or they are on a mission to steel some artefact that is hidden somewher in the village.

It is for you to decide

The map is meant to be shown to the players during play and it works just as well for online and offline sessions.

The pdf is in letter format and consists of two different versions of the map, two coloured and two black and white. Both versions comes with and without a grid attached to it.

You also get a page where the GM can add in notes and numbers for the different houses.

199064.name: Generic World Map 02
199064.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every adventure needs a world map and this is your chance to get one. This is the second generic world map I'm releasing here on RPGNOW. So if you have a great idea for a campaign or a couple of interlinked adventures but you don't want to spend the time creating a world map. This is your chance to get a fine crafted world map that hopefully will fill all your needs without needing to spend time making the map.

The pdf is in letter format and consists of two different versions of the map, one coloured and one black and white. The resolution of this pdf is higher (300 dpi) than my usual pdfs so that all the details in the map can be clearly viewed. This also means that the file seize is a bit larger.

199065.name: The Mountain Pass
199065.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every adventure needs a world map and this is your chance to get one. This is the third generic world map I'm releasing here on RPGNOW. This map however is a bit different from the other world maps. This is a map of a mountain pass with some locations placed out, like a ruined fort, a village etc. It's the perfect map if you want a more localized map of an area where some chain of events, adventures will take place. You can also use this map in combination with other maps that either I or others have made, or maps you have done yourself.

I have deliberately left out all names so that you can make the map work in any world or campaign.

The map is in a panorama size but the length of the map is the same size as a standing letter format. After printing it you have to cut away the white parts of the paper.

The map comes in both a metric and miles version, both in colour and black and white.

199066.name: Farjavad Village
199066.description:
From publisher blurb:

After a bit more than a day’s journey I reached the small town Farjvad. It is a bit small for being called a town, closer to the coast we’d probably just call it a village, but here in the middle of the large forest it is as large as a town will get.

Sometimes you just need a map of a village, something to use while your players travel. Or maybe a place from where they can start out on their adventures.

This is a map of a small village called Farjvad. You will get one map of just the village with numbers placed on different buildings, and also a player handout with a short story describing what the different numbers are. So let the adventure begin…….

199067.name: Generic Local Map 01
199067.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a local area map of two farms and a church/temple situated next to a lake/sea and a forest, a perfect map to use for your adventure if the players stroll off in a direction you didn’t plan. Or you can just use it as a starting point for an evenings gaming session.

The pdf is in letter format and consists of two different versions of the map, one coloured and one black and white. You also get the map in JPG format in a higher resolution then you have in the pdf file, for those of you who want to print the map.

199068.name: The Abandoned Temple and Catacombs
199068.description:
From publisher blurb:

There in the middle of the forest it still laid, overgrown and broken, but you could feel the evil that once had happened inside those walls. It was like it had taken over the air, made it sticky and hard to breathe…..

This is a map of an abandoned temple and its catacombs below. Catacombs that has a secrete hideout for whatever kind of demonic sect you prefer. The map is made to work with my free map of the village Farjvad. It will give you the perfect setting if your players decide to investigate what secretes the old temple in that village hides.

Or you can just use the map in whatever adventure or setting you prefer. It is all up to you now.

This map package consists of two maps, one of the temple over ground and one of the catacombs below. Both maps comes in various versions, both coloured and black and white. The over ground map comes in ten different versions and the black and white in six versions.

199069.name: Generic Cave 01
199069.description:
From publisher blurb:

The cave looked dark and grim and they could hear a deep growling from inside. They had heard of a large saber toothed tiger roaming the woods but had all taken that for just a wild tale, but maybe there were more to this rumor then just talk…..

This map package includes a generic cave that you can use in your adventures. So what is living inside? Is it a saber toothed tiger, a troll or a robbers nest?

It is for you to decide

The map is meant to be shown to the players during play and it works just as well for online and offline sessions.

The pdf is in letter format and consists of two different versions of the map, two coloured and two black and white. Both versions comes with and without a grid attached to it.

199070.name: The Old Temple Ruin
199070.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the forest the ruins of the old Temple still stretches higher than the surrounding forest. They say it has been abandoned for centuries but rumors say that it recently got some new residents.

This map pack includes two different version of a ruined Temple. One where it is abandoned and only the dead resides in the crypt. In the other a band of robbers have moved in and taken it as their hideout. You decide which one fits best for your adventure.

The map is meant to be shown to the players during play and it works just as well for online and offline sessions.

The pdf is in letter format and consists of two different versions of each version of the map, two coloured and two black and white. Both versions comes with and without a grid attached to it.

The map pack also includes a GM version of the map.

199071.name: Common Places #16
199071.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure located in fantasy urban environment. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Common places #016' consists of maps and handouts of The Big Scale - the most important building for merchants. The Big Scale is used for weighing and measuring large amounts of lead and copper from dwarven mines.

The set consists of:

Riverside map (district map);
ground floor plan;
1st floor plan;
2nd floor plan
a perspective drawing of The Big Scale.

199072.name: Merchants #1
199072.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places - Merchants provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure located in fantasy urban environment. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Common places Merchants #01' consists of maps and handouts of antique shop which can be located in any fantasy town.

The set consists of:

top down view of antique shop;
ground floor map;
1st floor map;
2nd floor map;
a facade drawing of antique shop




Now it is up to You what is sold at antique shop.

199073.name: Merchants #2
199073.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places - Merchants provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure located in fantasy urban environment. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Common places Merchants #02' consists of maps and handouts of armorer workshop which can be located in any fantasy town.

The set consists of:

top down view of armorer workshop;
ground floor map;
1st floor map;
2nd floor map;
a facade drawing of armorer workshop




Now it is up to You what is sold at armorer workshop.

199074.name: Merchants #3
199074.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places - Merchants provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure located in fantasy urban environment. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Common places Merchants #03' consists of maps and handouts of Herald's magic store which can be located in any fantasy town.

The set consists of:

top down view of magic store;
ground floor map;
1st floor map;
2nd floor map;
a facade drawing of magic store




Now it is up to You what is sold at magic store.

199076.description:
THIS IS HOW WAR BEGINS.

Forged in the fires of conflict, the Iron Kingdoms is a fantastic realm where the combined power of magic and technology thunders across a landscape shaped by war.

In Warmachine, the very earth shakes during fierce confrontations as six-ton constructs of iron and steel slam into each other with cataclysmic force, lead-spewing cannons chew through armor plating as easily as flesh, and bold heroes set the battlefield ablaze with a tempest of arcane might to forge the fates of their unyielding nations.

Warmachine is a fast-paced and aggressive 32mm tabletop skirmish miniatures game for two or more players set in the steam-powered fantasy world of the Iron Kingdoms. Players take on the role of elite soldier-sorcerers known as warcasters. Though warcasters are formidable, their true strength lies in the their magical ability to control warjacks - massive automatons that are the pinnacle of military might. Players collect, assemble, and paint fantastically detailed models representing the various warriors, machines, and creatures in their armies.
199076.name: Warmachine Prime Mk III

199078.name: The Glimpsers
199078.description:
User summary:

This live-action game is a codification of concepts typically encountered in the parlor game of "charades". Game play is relatively free-form, with each tableau involving multiple players and a variety of props. The tableau is presented to The Glimpser in "freeze action".

The cards required for play are available in three formats - the basic document includes standard resolution cards for print-and-play.

Note that the author has occasionally referred to this game as Dream Glimpsers.

199079.name: The Glimpsers: Cards
199079.description:
User summary:

The game requires the use of custom cards for play. A standard set of print-and-play cards is provided with the game core rules document.

They also are available as separate downloads in two different formats, noted here. These include:


ZIP Archive of 33 high-resolution JPG images (one image per card, suitable for print-and-play)
Text List of 33 card descriptions, without graphics (make your own cards)

199081.name: JellyBeanstalk
199081.description:
Together players grow the JellyBeanstalk and help Jack climb it, collecting their favourite flavour of Jelly Bean along the way. Be careful not to upset Jack's balance however, or he, and the beanstalk, will come tumbling down. And then there's the problem of that Giant.

The beanstalk is built using illustrated cards and cubes/dice. A player who causes the beanstalk to tumble is out of the game. Once the JellyBeanstalk is fully grown, the player who has collected the most Jelly Beans of their chosen flavour wins.

The game also has team co-op and solo play variants. The rules have been produced as a single sheet as well as a card-sized story book version.

JellyBeanstalk was placed 1st in the Most Innovative Mechanic category in the
2016 One Page PnP Contest.

199082.name: More Aberrations & Fiends (Plus Celestials, Elementals, & Fey)
199082.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creature statistic cards for more Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, and Fiend creatures of the 5th edition of the world's most popular Fantasy RPG. This deck features creatures not in the official monster book, but up-converted from prior editions of the game.

The cards are a deck of 58 cards (54 creature cards, one cover/checklist card and three license card). Note that three creatures span two cards each because these creatures have many abilities/traits/etc. so the deck has 51 creatures.

The document is a PDF of cards set up to be printed at 2.75"x3.75" and trimmed to 2.5"x3.5". Also included is a second PDF with all the cards on 8.5"x11" pages, 4 cards per page.

The text on the cards is generally a 9pt font, but some cards have 7pt to 8pt font if the text wouldn't otherwise fit on the card even after shortening the text. (All meaning/game information was preserved.)

199083.name: The Dragon's Hoard: Rings, Rods, and Staves
199083.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, adventurer, to the Dragon’s Hoard. Within you will find an assortment of magic items lovingly crafted by over two dozen designers, including both budding and established writers. Perhaps not every dragon would have each of these items, but a good dragon should!

This PDF contains 30+ bookmarked magic rings, rods, and (you guessed it) staves!

Need to contact the cleric but cell phones won't be invented for another few centuries? Pick up a few hive rings for you and your friends, and let your cleric on the other side of the dungeon know that the rogue activated another party killing trap!

Just assassinated someone, but their body is producing a foul odor? We've all been there. Don't worry, though! Pick up the rod of corpse eating at your local magic shop, and let your insect pals gobble up that inert flesh in 6 seconds flat!

Are you that cleric that always has to save the party from the the fireball-crazed sorcerer? Isn't it just the worst when you run up to heal your allies, and then YOU get caught in the fire? Don't worry, you can cast your cure moderate wounds outside of the explosion zone with the staff of inspired support!

This PDF is brought to you by the feats Forge Rings, Craft Rod, and Craft Staff.

199084.description: The Superbox is the ultimate storage solution for the discerning SUPERFIGHT collector. With space for over 1800 cards, you’ll be able to fit all of our current decks plus four expansions that don’t exist yet! The Superbox also comes with twenty exclusive “Super Cards” to spice up your game, twenty double-sided score keeping chits for when you’re feeling competitive, and six blank deck boxes to stop your cards from sliding around like peasants.
199084.name: Superfight Superbox

199086.name: Festival of Thousand Cats
199086.description:
Cats around the world are always busy feasting! Their favorite delicacies for the feast are delicious fish — and of course you can't forget about the booze. As long as they have delicious fish and enough booze, they are all very happy!

In 万猫の豊明かり (Festival of Thousand Cats), you try to gather plenty of fish and just the right amount of booze to enjoy the feast!

199087.name: Knee Deep
199087.description:
When a washed-up actor hangs himself on location, a spotlight is cast on the backwater Florida town of Cypress Knee. Your screen becomes a stage on which you investigate this mysterious suicide as three distinct characters: cheeky blogger Romana Teague, down-and-out local reporter Jack Bellet, and cynical private investigator K.C. Gaddis.

Source: The Game Website.

199088.name: All Hail Bugtopia!
199088.description:
User summary:

The game finds the players assuming the roles of insects ("race" of insect is significant). A murder has occurred. Some of the players stand accused. Other players serve as the judge-jury-exterminator. Play involves using a distinctive and intriguing method of determining guilt or innocence. The presentation assumes fairly tongue-in-cheek play.

199089.name: Giana Sisters: Dream Runners
199089.description:
Race to the finish in Giana Sisters: Dream Runners, a fast-paced, head-to-head platformer for up to four players.

Run and jump, dash and smash, daze and teleport, morph and cannon… oh you get the idea: mess with your opponents!

The game pits up to four players (or AI opponents) against each other in local and online competition, speed-running for the finish in an effort to push each other off the screen with the help of boosters and power-ups.

Switch the level layout on the fly as you rush through dreamgates. Collect gems to fill your speed booster and use your power-ups to knock out the other players and claim victory!

Source: The Developer Website.

199090.name: Dreams in Stasis
199090.description:
User summary:

This solitaire game requires the player to have a cell-phone with a memo function (or similar tool). The game is unusual for a solitaire game in the amount of structure that it presents during play. The game is played over the course of a week, and much of the play involves being in public spaces.

Note the document gives credits for a cover image, but the image is not included in the document distribution.

199091.name: Odonata
199091.description:
Users summary:

This game has a distinctly creepy feel to the setting; characters are all young girls without much experience. The game revolves around attempts to subvert them psychologically - a trope sometimes found in "dark, Faustian 'magical girl' anime."

Characters have Skills (Flee, Endure, Appeal, Outwit) with ten dice distributed among them at creation. In addition characters have a few narrative traits.

199092.name: Meeple Maker
199092.description:
Meeple Maker is a 2-4 player light strategy game that plays in about 30-60 minutes.

Your goal is to get the most fans. To get fans interested, you'll produce games tailored to their demands. To meet those demands, you'll develop content with help from the internet.

Players take turns and either gain or spend content.

To gain content, they choose which website to move to from one of the next three clockwise websites (skipping over other players) and develop the content shown there (resources). Since each player's token never leaves the board and movement is limited, each move impacts the choices of others.

Players spend that content to grow their company, produce games, recruit people and get fans. All of these aspects are represented together on the cards in their hand or in the common market. These cards and their position determine the type and number of content that needs to be spent, as well as the skills (resource-gathering) and fans (score) the cards offer.

Those cards join their tableau, growing your company and helping players develop immersive worlds (theme), deep mechanics (strategy), valuable components, and wondrous artwork (the four types of content).

As players grow their companies to new sizes, they'll choose and flip tokens on the board. This changes how much resources are available and also acts as the game clock. When the last (eighth) token changes, the final round is played out. During final scoring, players gain resources based on who they recruited, and then spend them to acquire the cards in their hand. The end-game conditions are checked to see who has the most theme, strategy, component and artwork skills in their company and who gets the bonus points. The player with the highest score, i.e. most fans, wins.

The setup is highly variable, with resources being randomly placed on the board, different values for the end game conditions, and a constantly evolving, sliding market. There are also several creators to choose from, an evolving board and many ways to manipulate the game - so each game is a new challenge to face.

199093.name: Being Freud
199093.description:
User summary:

Being Freud combines a fairly straightforward card game with storytelling elements to provide a type of parlor game. The game requires custom card decks, provided as print-and-play components in the document. Play involves rotation of an "active patient" role, with the player in the spotlight playing dream element cards and then explaining a dream. Other players then "psychoanalyze" the dream and play appropriate cards. The game anticipates a fairly satirical (even nonsensical) psychoanalytical response.

rpgseries.35378: A Time to Harvest: A Cult of Chaos Organized Play Campaign

199094.name: A Time to Harvest (Organized Play Edition) Episode 2
199094.description:
User summary:

Second installment of organized-play campaign, released 15 May 2016.

rpgseries.35378: A Time to Harvest: A Cult of Chaos Organized Play Campaign

199095.name: A Time to Harvest (Organized Play Edition) Episode 3
199095.description:
User summary:

Third installment of organized-play campaign, released 15 June 2016.

rpgseries.35378: A Time to Harvest: A Cult of Chaos Organized Play Campaign

199096.name: A Time to Harvest (Organized Play Edition) Episode 4
199096.description:
User summary:

Fourth installment of organized-play campaign, released 15 July 2016.

rpgseries.35378: A Time to Harvest: A Cult of Chaos Organized Play Campaign

199097.name: A Time to Harvest (Organized Play Edition) Episode 5
199097.description:
User summary:

Fifth installment of organized-play campaign, released 15 August 2016.

rpgseries.35378: A Time to Harvest: A Cult of Chaos Organized Play Campaign

199098.name: A Time to Harvest (Organized Play Edition) Episode 6
199098.description:
User summary:

Sixth and final installment of organized-play campaign, released 15 September 2016.

199100.name: Folie à Deux
199100.description:
From the introduction:

Whoever holds the dragonfly vocalises their thoughts. Be immersed in the character you are portraying but be quiet when the other person is talking. Wait for them to pass you the dragonfly. Feel free to show your reaction via your facial expressions.

User summary:

The free-form game uses a structured approach to modulating the two character discussion.

199101.name: Exuviae
199101.description:
From the introduction:

Exuviae is a horror-noir tabletop roleplaying game for one to four players and a games master.
...
Exuviae uses a single pack of playing cards to simulate uncovering a conspiracy: taking something hidden & shining a light on it for a different, greater, audience. Each player assumes the role of an investigator, though these needn’t be professional detectives.

User summary:

This intriguing game requires a stripped pack of French playing cards. The game played with the cards is complex. The game document includes several action tables to be used with the card game.

199103.name: Drifted
199103.description:
User summary:

Drifted is a difficult game to categorize; the player is assumed to live in an alternate reality while the character lives in reality. The only Attribute in the game is Quiet and the player attempts to manipulate the value of the Attribute by performing various tasks noted in the game document. The exact relationship between player and character is fuzzy; the various specified activities have only a superficial relationship to the suggested setting of reality.

199104.name: Short Days Ago
199104.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The second in a trilogy (possibly of more than three books, as is traditional), Short Days Ago is part of an extended campaign in the exotic West African region (as well as the Bight of Benin) and deals with one of the more important conflicts that resulted from the growing tensions between the three major power Blocs prior to the actual outbreak of the Three Way War.

The adventures are not for the faint of heart – the adventures take place in what can only be described as the Third World – and at least one of the nations you’ll adventure in is easily what can be called a ‘third world ****hole’ … exotic, in other words. Commando Raids. A mission to blow two major Bridges. Supply Interdiction. A genuine treasure hunt … all the sorts of things that can put the PCs in deep trouble with the locals …

Fortunately, your mission is backed by the Western Alliance (mainly the US, and through the auspices of the CIA) – so the PCs will not have to worry too much about these things. They’ll just have to remember that the playbook the other side(s) are using are very different from what they might expect in more established parts of the world.

The thrust of the book is the early months of the secessionist rebellion by the Republic of Biafra, the south eastern part of Nigeria around the oil rich Niger river delta. The Federal government has been booted out of the Delta by the rebels … but the terrorists of Boko Haram took the opportunity to stage their own rebellion and have seized the north, founding an Islamic Republic (aka ‘fanatical religious dictatorship’). But they aren’t satisfied … they want the whole of the country.

The PCs are part of the struggle to make sure that they fail …

199105.name: Last Light
199105.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What was the world like in the long and bitter run-up to the Three Way War?

This book provides a glimmering of an answer in two parts – Getting Involved and The Big City. The first of these deals with how the PCs personally got involved in the ongoing nastiness, while the second provides for an extended campaign in a major Western Alliance city in the face of a growing terrorist threat and the increasing levels of lawlessness that this creates.

The adventures are not for the faint of heart – especially those that are terrorism related. Two of the three major opponents of the Western Alliance, the Japanese Imperium (allies of the Russian Federation) and the Caliphate, are steeped in both imperial ambitions and out of control fanaticism. Neither sees much of a line between ‘civilian’ and ‘soldier’ – the Caliphate glories in the deaths of all infidels, seeing none of them as worthy of consideration and the twisted version of Bushido promoted by those manipulating the Japanese military is only marginally better.

There are around 50 adventure scenarios included – from multi-page monsters to &frac;14; or &frac;12; page ‘Vignettes’ … and there is considerable scope to use the additional Cast of Thousands and the background information from the book to create your own stand alone or linked scenarios to them!

Also covered inside are much expanded Cardboard Character lists and some changed or improved rules regarding their usage … providing the Civilian side of things that was not really covered in Modern Encounters.

The book also includes basic information of all of the weapons used by NPCs (friend or enemy) inside, some limited information on any vehicles that are present, and some added Police and Security rated equipment … so it is possible to play through the adventures without possessing the D10 System Gear Book (though the game will be much more enjoyable if you possess it).

199106.name: 200% Mixed Juice!
199106.description:
At certain points in time and space, many fun worlds exist. Each world was created by a smart little fairy named Navi for the sake of the sleeping princess with nothing to do.

A world where you're able to experience a lively school life.
A world where you can see the skies crowded with airplanes.
A world that has fallen to ruin from endless wars...

It's time for the sleeping princess to wake up and start her adventures in those worlds.

Source: The Publisher Website.

199107.name: Serious Sam (Xbox)
199107.description:
"The Xbox edition of Serious Sam had notable differences including the model of Sam being changed from the model of The First Encounter to form a more cartoon style Sam, removing the shades to make him look less like Duke Nukem and more like he does today. The Xbox version includes all of the levels from both of the PC games. As a result, weapons from The Second Encounter were added to the levels that were part of The First Encounter on PC. The levels were made smaller by removing the areas outside of the playing area. Unlike the PC version, Sam can't exit too far out of the playing area. This is due to the smaller amount of memory available in the Xbox. The gameplay was given a more arcade touch. A life system was implemented into the single-player game making use of the score. Every 100,000 points grants the player a new life, which allows respawning at the place of death rather than at a save point. Combo points were added for killing multiple enemies at the same time, which allows the player to increase his/her score at a fast pace. Further changes to the game include the addition of treasure and the tweaking of save points. Save points are designated by a red phone booth. Auto-aiming was also added to the Xbox version to compensate for the degree of control usually offered by a keyboard and mouse setup."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serious_Sam Serious Sam]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199108.name: Picross e5
199108.description:
The 5th game in the Picross e series! Includes all three modes, "Micross", "Mega Picross", and "20×15 Picross".


The 5th game in the Picross e series, with a Navigation Feature!

Featuring Micross, Mega Picross and 20×15 Picross, all three modes from the previous game.

Also includes more than 150 satisfying, all-new puzzles to solve.

Tutorials and rule options let newcomers to the series start playing with ease.

Picross is a "Picture Crossword Puzzle Game" where numbers act as hints to complete images.

The rules are simple and easy to grasp. Anyone can do it!

Source: The Publisher Website.

199109.name: Picross e6
199109.description:
The 6th game in the Picross e series! Packed with over 300 puzzles!

The 6th game in the Picross e series, with a Navigation Feature!

New to this title, each puzzle can be played in either Picross or Mega Picross mode!
Enjoy over 300 puzzles, including special puzzles.
You can also choose the fill animation for the puzzle screen.
Picross is a "Picture Crossword Puzzle Game" where numbers act as hints to complete images.

The rules are simple and easy to grasp. Anyone can do it!

Source: The Publisher Website.

199110.name: Trap Them
199110.description:
User Summary

This game combines puzzle (trying to access crystals) with puzzles (avoiding robots and killing them with falling blocks). The graphics are crudely retro but the strategy to solve the puzzles are varied and there are multiple solutions.

199111.name: Trap Them:  Sniper Edition
199111.description:
User Summary

A separate game from Trap Them, this combines the previous puzzles of gathering crystals with shooting blocks to help the crystal collector move around.

199112.name: The Seven Parchments of Kandos
199112.description:
User Summary

A fantasy text adventure which was released on a Sinclair User magazine cover tape (Mega Tape 18).

Developer - Martin Page.

199113.name: Iron Soldier (1989)
199113.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling shooter developed by Players Premier and The Shaw Brothers and released on a Sinclair User magazine cover tape (Megatape 16).

199114.name: Landkartenset
199114.description:
This is a collection of ingame and outgame maps of Aventuria in a sturdy box with room for additonal cards. It includes:

Detailled map of Aventuria, A1
Poster map of Aventuria, A3
B/W map of Aventuria, A3
InGame map of Aventuria, A2
InGame map of Dere, A3
Regional overview of Aventuria, A3
Political map of Aventuria, A2

199115.name: Qarx
199115.description:
From the inlay

Mr Blyte, the mild-mannered chemistry teacher turned mad-scientist, has planted nuclear bombs through various times in Earth's history with the aid of his time machine. It's up to you to destroy them!

Qarx was developed by Greg Jackson for Your Sinclair magazine (cover tape for issue 36).

199117.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 176 - Mar/Apr 2016)
199117.description: Issue 176 of the periodical Aventurischer Bote, the ingame magazine for "Das Schwarze Auge".

199118.name: Yendorian Tales Book I: Chapter 2
199118.description:
"Yendorian Tales Book I: Chapter 2 is a role-playing video game written for MS-DOS in 1996. Beginning with a seemingly insignificant quest, the hero was led to the mysterious Lost Isles of Yendor. Following the trail of a group of evil mages, the hero encountered civilisations of Gnomes, Elves, and Halflings."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yendorian_Tales_Book_I%3A_Chapter_2 Yendorian Tales Book I: Chapter 2]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199119.name: Yendorian Tales: The Tyrants of Thaine
199119.description:
"Yendorian Tales: The Tyrants of Thaine is a role-playing video game written for MS-DOS in 1997.

Following on from the story of Yendorian Tales Book I and Yendorian Tales Book I: Chapter 2, the seal on the wizard Paltivar has been broken and his return to the lands of Yendor is imminent. However, as dire as the threat from the great wizard is, the kingdoms in the land of Thaine are on the brink of war themselves and must be pacified if the wizard's threat is to be averted."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yendorian_Tales%3A_The_Tyrants_of_Thaine Yendorian Tales: The Tyrants of Thaine]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199120.name: Sniper X with Jason Statham
199120.description:
User Summary

It's a first person shooter where you identify, target and snipe various threats, preferably going for headshots. Across various levels and campaigns you eliminate threats for the military, whilst under the guidance of action star Jason Statham. You can also visit a training range, as well as purchase and upgrade new weapons. Each mission you are fixed to the spot, but are able to look around and zoom in and out with your sniper rifle's scope.

199121.name: Fight Fever
199121.description:
"Fight Fever, known in Korea as Wang Jung Wang (왕중왕, lit. "The King of Kings"), is a 1994 2D fighting video game for the Neo-Geo MVS System. It is the first and only Korean Neo Geo title ever officially released, as well as the first game developed and released by Korean publisher of SNK games, Viccom (빅콤).

The game plays similarly to other 2D versus fighting games, especially both SNK's Fatal Fury 2 and Art of Fighting. In fact, it shapes itself after Fatal Fury 2 while it uses Art of Fighting's game engine.
