There are 8 characters to select from and two boss characters (the first boss character is only playable in two player mode)."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fight_Fever Fight Fever]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199122.name: Jackie Chan Stuntmaster
199122.description:
"Jackie Chan Stuntmaster is a PlayStation game based on the actor and martial artist Jackie Chan.
Made by Radical Entertainment, the game sees the player in the shoes of Jackie Chan who must fight his way past numerous villains in different locations across the city of New York.
Jackie's grandfather (Fredrick) has been kidnapped and Jackie needs to get him back. This means fighting his way through New York to get to him. Jackie also faces a number of different challenges in which the player must use a combination of moves to succeed. The game boasts 15 fully 3D levels with different environmental obstacles to cross.
While making the game, Radical Entertainment consulted Jackie at every point so as to give the game the feeling of a Jackie Chan film. This included using Jackie for motion capture so that the character in the game was performing the same moves as the man himself. Jackie also provided his voice for game."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jackie_Chan_Stuntmaster Jackie Chan Stuntmaster]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpgitemversion.319692: A Goblin More or Less PDF version

199123.name: Ein Goblin mehr oder weniger
199123.description:
publisher blurb

Festum, Hauptstadt des Bornlands, bekannt für seine wohlhabenden Händler und Heimat für über dreißigtausend Menschen. Doch in Festum leben nicht nur Menschen. Seit vielen Jahren ist die Stadt auch Heimat der Goblins, die ein eigenes Viertel bewohnen und die nach der Bekämpfung einer schwerwiegenden Rattenplage als Bürger betrachtet werden. Die Rotpelze arbeiten als Tagelöhner, Hafenarbeiter und Rattenfänger und gehen ihren Aufgaben voller Stolz nach, obwohl die menschlichen Bewohner Festums von diesen Tätigkeiten angewidert sind. Als einer der Goblins ermordet wird und die Stadtgarde durch die zahlreichen anderen Verbrechen in Festum nicht in der Lage ist, sich auch noch um diese Angelegenheit zu kümmern, kommen die Helden ins Spiel. Für die Bürger mag es egal sein, ob es einen Goblin mehr oder gibt, doch auch ein Rotpelz hat Familie, die sich um ihn sorgt. Im Auftrag eines rechtschaffenen, aber überforderten Weibels nehmen die Abenteurer die Ermittlung im Goblinfall auf und stoßen dabei auf einen Serienmörder, der das Festumer Ghetto in Atem hält.


Festum, the prosperous merchant city and capital of the Bornland, is home to more than 30,000 humans. For many years, the city has also been home to a growing population of goblins. Called “red pelts” in other parts of Aventuria, goblins were granted citizenship in Festum a number of years ago when they saved the city from a serious plague of rats. Festum goblins now work as day laborers, street sweepers, and rat catchers, and perform their jobs with pride even if many human residents find these occupations disgusting.

To some, a goblin more or less makes little difference, but even red pelts have families who worry about them. When a goblin is found murdered and the City Guard fails to find any leads, an upstanding but overworked sergeant recruits the heroes to help with the investigation. Soon, more bodies turn up, and the heroes find themselves racing against time to save Festum’s goblins from a fiendish serial killer!

199124.name: Die gehäutete Schlange
199124.description:
publisher blurb

Geweihtenmord im Horasreich! Zwei Jahre lang sorgte ein charismatischer Hesindegeweihter aus dem hohen Norden für allerlei Gesprächsstoff im Lieblichen Feld: Er forderte nicht nur eine Öffnung der Wissenshorte für Jedermann, sondern versammelte auch eine wachsende Gemeinschaft um sich, die sich dem gegenseitigen Lernen und Lehren verschrieben hat. Nun fand er den Tod – durch die Hand eines seiner Jünger.
Was hat den jungen Mann bewogen, sich gegen seinen Mentor zu wenden? Die Spur des flüchtigen Geweihtenmörders führt nach Vinsalt, die Stadt der hundert Türme. Doch die schillernde Metropole ist nicht nur die Hauptstadt des Horasreichs, sondern auch die Kapitale der Verschwörer und Verbrecher. Im Schatten uralter Monumente, mechanischer Wunderwerke und prachtvoller Tempel und Paläste ist nichts, wie es scheint. Zwischen den zwielichtigen Gassen Alt-Bosparans und den Zentren politischer wie kirchlicher Macht beginnt ein Verwirrspiel, das für die Unvorsichtigen ein gefährliches Ende nehmen kann. Doch wer das Spiel beherrscht, wird nicht nur sein eigenes Schicksal beeinflussen.
Aufstieg und Niedergang liegen in der Kaiserstadt nahe beieinander. Und der frevlerische Mord ist erst der Anfang eines Abenteuers, das das verborgene Machtgeflecht des Horasreichs nachhaltig verändern wird.


A Blessed One has been murdered! Two years ago, a charismatic priest from the north caused a great stir in the Horasian Empire. He became famous for demanding that knowledge be made available to everybody and gathering a growing community of followers devoted to mutual enlightenment. Now the Blessed One is dead—murdered by one of his own disciples.

What caused his young student to turn against him? The killer’s trail leads to Vinsalt, “City of a Hundred Towers.” But the Imperial capital is much more than a colorful metropolis. It is also a den of conspirators and criminals, where nothing is as it appears. A dangerous plot unfurls against a backdrop of ancient monuments, mechanical wonders, and glorious temples, threatening everyone from the dirtiest alleys of Old Bosparan to the gleaming heights of political and clerical power.

Success and failure are two faces of the same coin in the city of Vinsalt, and a blasphemous murder is only the first in a string of events with far-reaching consequences for the Horasian Empire.

199125.name: Firebugs
199125.description:
"Firebugs is a futuristic racing video game for the PlayStation. The game was developed by Attention to Detail and only European release in 2002.
The game modes include 1 player mode where the player can race on 25 tracks in 5 distinct worlds. There is 2 player mode which consists of the same basics as in one player mode. Weapons and defences are used to help the player win races. There are Five Pilots to choose from with each having a different background from one another."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firebugs_%28video_game%29 Firebugs (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199126.name: Kibakadabra
199126.description:
publisher blurb

Hinter den Weiten des Südmeers erstreckt sich der legendäre Südkontinent Uthuria. Tief verborgen in seinen Dschungeln, die kaum ein aventurischer Wanderer je betreten oder wieder verlassen hat, lebt das Volk der Jucumaqh.
In den Jagdgründen der Powhiri-Sippe liegt der Schlangenkopffels und darunter ein altes Höhlensystem. Als Stätte eines Gottes werden die unerforschten Kavernen gleichermaßen verehrt wie gefürchtet. Denn die finstere Kraft, die tief unter der Erde zu schlummern scheint, wirkt ihren Einfluss auf die Welt über Tage aus. Als die Helden in die Fänge des machtgierigen Schamanen Tikangu geraten, will er die Fremden für seine Zwecke nutzen und opfern lassen. Doch er ist nicht der Einzige, der eigene Ziele verfolgt. Die junge Powhiri-Schönheit Hokioi bittet die Gruppe um Hilfe für ihren Liebsten, den Krieger Whakamiharo.
Um ihren Wunsch zu erfüllen, müssen sich die Abenteurer dem Schlangenkopffels stellen.
Halb versunken, halb ertrunken ragt er am Ufer eines Sees aus der Erde. In seinem Inneren wandeln unheimliche Kreaturen und vergessene Krieger stehen auf ewiger Wacht. Kostbarkeiten und die Geheimnisse der sagenumwobenen Kibakabas warten im Dunkeln und die Zeit drängt. Denn es regnet und das Wasser steigt.


Beyond the Southern Sea lies the mysterious continent of Uthuria. A fierce people known as the Jucumaqh dwell deep in the jungle, which few Aventurians have ever visited, let alone survived. Located in the hunting grounds of the Jucumaqh Powhiri tribe is the Serpent Head Rock, a crumbling edifice that rises from the ground near the shores of an ancient lake. Beneath it runs a system of unexplored tunnels that lead to the realm of an evil god. The Powhiri live in fear of the day when the dark power that sleeps beneath the ground will rise and shatter the world above.

A young Powhiri beauty named Hokioi asks the heroes to help rescue her lover, a warrior named Whakamiharo, but they find themselves at the mercy of the tribe’s jealous, power-hungry shaman, who orders their sacrifice. Frightening creatures and forgotten warriors lurk in the Rock’s half-buried, halfdrowned passages, guarding lost treasures and the secrets of the legendary kibakabas. But time is of the essence, because the monsoons have started, and the waters are beginning to rise…

199127.name: Konvertierungsspielhilfe DSA
199127.description:
User description

Conversion guide to transfer characters from the edition of the rules to 5th edition. Free pdf.

199128.name: Marsupilami
199128.description:
User Summary

2D platformer in which you control a creature with a long tail and must guide an elephant to safety, solving puzzles, fighting enemies and avoiding danger.

199129.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.
Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.
Each aircraft is sold separately. Only pay for the ones you want, and print out as many copies as you need to create your own epic WWII air battle.
This set contains the Spitfire II, which was used in the Battle of Britain.
199129.name: Table Air Combat: Spitfire II

199131.name: Cyberdyne Warrior
199131.description:
User Summary

An action game in which you play a space marine, running and gunning your way through various screens set in some sort of underground alien labyrinth. It is possible to collect money in the game, which can then be spent on the in-game shop to acquire weapons and items.

90917.name: Monozuki Monoski (ものずきモノスキー)

199132.name: Eat or Eaten

boardgameartist.90917: Monozuki Monoski (ものずきモノスキー)

boardgameversion.310276: Japanese first edition (Spring 2015 TGM challenge edition)

199132.description:
User summary
Eat or Eaten is a two-player abstract game with a theme of hares struggling for feeding ground. On a 5x6 square grid board, players have five hare tiles each. Their goal is to capture four of their opponent's hares or to occupy their opponent's burrow for one turn. There are three types of hares, which determine their movement directions allowed, and each type has a flip side that alters its direction. You may flip your tile by consuming one turn, or moving into a special square.

This intellectual game is suitable for those who began to enjoy thinking.

There are two editions of the game. The original Version was produced for the Spring 2015 Tokyo Game Market (TGM). Each TGM, designers are invited to face a challenge, to design a game under certain conditions. This is where the ¥500 microgames came from, which included Love Letter. The Spring 2015 TGM challenge was '2種カードゲー企画' which was to bring games using only two types of cards. The first edition of Eat Or Eaten was produced to satisfy the 2種カードゲー企画 challenge. The components were only cards and the field was only 3 x 4 square. The Hares behaved differently between editions too. In the first edition, when a Hare was flipped over, it changed the power relationship with opponents' Hares, leading to a fourway stand-off. In the second edition, produced for the Autumn 2015 TGM, the Hares have equal power, but flipping a Hare changes the way it moves. In both Versions, the Hares are competing for food.

Publisher's summary
うさぎの餌場争いをテーマにした、二人用のアブストラクトゲームです。５匹のうさぎを使って争い、相手の巣穴マスに１ターン留まるか、相手のうさぎを１匹にすると勝利します。駒は裏返すことによって、動き方が変化します。頭をしっかりと使うゲームで、考えることが楽しくなってきた方におすすめです。

199133.name: Faerie Passions (5E)
199133.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroic Fantasy Where Fey and Mortals Meet!
Faerie Passions is a fantastical resource for integrating the fey into 5th Edition campaigns whether you are a player or GM! When immortal infatuation breaks forth into the world of mortals, Faerie Passions brings you advice and optional rules for GMs, exploring the otherworldly mindset of the fey and their motivations when interacting with mortals and a world that is not their own. You'll find brand-new creatures like the lurker in light and vodyanoi and detailed personalities for existing fey ready to introduce wonder and faerie glamour into any 5E campaign, but this book is not just for GMs, as players will also find new fey-themed character archetypes and sorcerous origins tied to a faerie legacy. However you want to integrate fey themes and influence into your 5th Edition game, Faerie Passions has a ton of great material to make fairy realm come alive.

Faerie Passions is the latest in our line of 5th Edition projects focused on wilderness exploration and the magic, mystery, and menace of the woodland realms.

199134.name: Into the Feyweald (5E)
199134.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Fairy Forest!

Into the Feyweald takes your 5th Edition heroes into a world of adventure in the realms of faerie! Guests at the fairiy queen Pryozha's celebration feast, the festivities are interrupted by the creepy, crawly spider-riders serving the wicked witches of the woods! You must take up the quest to find the hidden grove where Yaldira the witch works her dark magic, turning the forest sickly and rotten, battling her evil minions that menace the creatures of the wood. There, in the dark pits of her lair, you must stop her from awakening her cruel queen from her crystal tomb and save the woodland realm! This 1st-level adventure, suitable for a standard 5th Edition game or one using the 5E starter set.

The Legendary Beginnings series from Legendary Games is designed to creating exciting adventures suitable for all ages, but specially designed for those new to roleplaying and those on the younger side. The Legendary Games tradition is to combine rich story and background, innovative layout, beautiful aesthetics, and excellence in design that is second to none, allowing you to enliven and enrich your campaign in amazing and exciting ways. This product is the latest in that tradition, and we hope you enjoy using it as much as we enjoyed making it. Pick up this 38-page adventure today and Make Your Game Legendary!

199135.name: Tales from the Laughing Dragon Inn
199135.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five one-session adventures beginning at everyone's favorite location: the town inn! From tavern brawls to dangerous forays through the sewers, these scenarios are guaranteed to challenge your players as they learn about the history and denizens of Brighton's Laughing Dragon Inn.

For 4-6 players, levels 1-10.

199137.name: Tarocchi del Paese dei Balocchi
199137.description:
User summary:
Tarot card deck composed by 22 Major Arcana

199138.name: Ultimate Arena
199138.description:
User Summary

Arena combat simulation game where you can pit historical (or current) figures against each other.

199139.name: Void Invaders
199139.description:
Void Invaders is a colourful, chaotic and explosive arcade game with simplistic retro-styled graphics. Blast your way through more than 30 levels filled with enemies, huge bosses and destructive power-ups while upgrading, earning achievements and unlocking secrets.

Source: The Developer Website.

199140.name: Kensei: Sacred Fist
199140.description:
"The game is a straight-to-console release, without an arcade counterpart.

Kensei uses a button distribution style, separating them into punch, kick, throw and guard. The system provides the player with a large array of moves and combos, and multi-step throws are available, though both normal and multi-throws can be countered by pressing a button that flashes on the screen. Game speed is rather slow (one of the reasons for it not to become an arcade game), and relies more on timing, strategy and accurate knowledge of attack ranges to land successful combo strings and juggles. Button-mashing is often a bad tactical choice, since the characters remain vulnerable for long times after performing an unsuccessful combo. Jumping is realistic, albeit for some extra height. Sidestepping is allowed but is a much slower move, aside from some characters who integrate special sidesteps in their movesets.
The guard button acts rather as a "dodge" button, as the characters' animation shows them avoiding the attacks rather than taking them on their guard. Characters may assume rapidly a counter-offensive position or be "bounced back" to dodge, and the recovery time relies on the player's ability to press the guard button with sufficient time. Low attacks must be guarded by pressing Down + Guard Button, while pressing Up + Guard Button may allow the character to sidestep at the end of a combo.
The Arcade game structure of Kensei comprises 10 stages, with the first eight being made up of random opponents. The specific playing character will encounter a sub-boss in the ninth stage while the tenth one will have them facing off against the crime lord Leimeng and the eleventh (and final) one will have the playing character battle against Leimeng's bodyguard Kaiya. Along with the classical Survival, Training, and Time Attack modes, a special mini-game can be activated once all characters have been unlocked: it's a "racing" mode where the player controls a character and makes it run through a circuit, using button mashing to gain speed."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kensei%3A_Sacred_Fist Kensei: Sacred Fist]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199142.name: Rustle: the Card Game
199142.description:
Rustle: the Card Game is a card drawing farm animal themed game where the goal is to possess the most points by the end of the game. There are two decks - the Animal Deck and the Action Deck.

The Animal Deck contains only cards that give you points. The Action Deck contains cards that let you draw more Animal cards, steal Animal cards from other players or remove their Animal cards from the game.

Players start with two animal cards in their farm (in front of them) and four action cards in their hand. Each turn players draw an Animal card and an Action card. The Animal card is played in front of them straight away. Players then choose to play one of their Action cards or discard one.

Points are earned through collecting farm animals which are all worth different points. Game play ends when no more cards can be drawn from the Animal Deck.

199143.name: Motörhead (Amiga)
199143.description:
User Summary

Side scrolling beat 'em up where you play Lemmy from the band Motörhead and fight your way through various worlds based around different music genres, in order to rescue members of the band and crew.

199144.name: Superfight: Tabletop Day 2016 Promo Pack
199144.description: This mini-expansion for Superfight: The Game of Absurd Arguments features 9 characters and 9 attributes from the minds of Geek and Sundry. Shuffle these cards into your deck to destroy your friends as Felicia and Wil, or arm yourself with magic missiles and awkward silences. Huzzah!

199145.name: The Tiny Tale 2
199145.description:
User Summary

Similar to the Hercules series of games, you send out minions to collect resources and construct buildings, seeking to reach a level of income or unblocked areas in order to win the scenario. A special creature, who also narrates the game, dispels monsters and gives special magical bonuses at shrines monsters.

199146.name: White Light
199146.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game collaboratively judge a non-player character. Therefore the focus of the game is, atypically, not on the characters. Play involves various card plays from custom decks. The cards are not provided in the document; they apparently are intended to be created during play. The game uses a fairly subjective scoring system to determine which player's character "wins" the process.

199147.name: Welcome to the Eyeland
199147.description:
User summary:

This peculiar game uses a variety of types of characters, some are created and operated collaboratively, and some are created and controlled in a more traditional method. The game presents a singularly odd setting with a layered approach to witnessing or experiencing events.

The game uses several tracking sheets and character sheets; these are available as print-and-play components in the document. In addition, several status tokens are needed for play.

199148.name: Rent the Veil
199148.description:
From the game:

Dreams often feature intense emotions.
Dreams are frequently disorganized and illogical.
Strange dream content is accepted without question.
Dreamers often experience bizarre sensations.
Dreams are difficult to remember.

User summary:

One player will assume the character of the Dreamer. While a unique role in the game, this is not the equivalent of a game master. The remaining players assume the characters of Dragonflies. The game begins without the Dreamer while the Dragonflies determine game goals. After this step, the Dreamer returns and play proceeds to the next phase, where the Dragonflies try to shape and guide the Dreamer.

199149.description:
This is a deck of 50 cards that uses the Versatiletters system. Each card displays a letter, which becomes a different letter with a different point value when the card is rotated 180 degrees. The instructions include rules for:
i) The Final Word, in which two players take turns forming words from a selection of 12 cards. The player who forms the final word keeps the cards that were used to form it. Twelve more cards are drawn; the process is repeated; and the player with more cards after four rounds wins;
ii) Finders Stealers, in which 3 to 6 players each play two cards simultaneously face up onto the table. The player who is able to form the longest word within 30 seconds keeps the cards used to form that word, and the player with the most cards after three rounds wins;
iii) Word Wars I.II.III, which has its own BGG entry; and
iv) Solitaire Dare, in which each of five columns contains ten overlapping cards, with only the bottom card in each column face up. Make a word with the letters on the face-up cards, set aside the used letters, flip the uncovered cards, and repeat. Win if no unused cards remain at the end.
199149.name: Double Play

199150.name: Dragonfly Yoga Studio
199150.description:
User summary:

This game attempts to model a traditional yoga class warmup process on the tabletop. The game can be played in just a few minutes. The rules are minimalist and free-form. The game could easily be used (in fact, probably best used) as a preface to gaming with some other system, to set the tone of the player group setting.

199151.name: Dragonfly (2015)
199151.description:
From the introduction:

t is the near future and we have discovered an incredible fact about our existence: like a dragonfly nymph what we think of as dying is in fact transformation. When we "die", our material bodies stop operating in this universe but our consciousness lives on in another universe. We do not and perhaps cannot understand this other world but it is possible, when we are quiet and still, for our subconscious minds to reach across the barrier and communicate between these two realities – albeit in a limited form: through our dreams.

199152.name: Dragonfly 3RR0R: The Breakdown
199152.description:
User summary:

Characterization in the game is lightweight, and the game is as much a card game as a roleplaying game. The card game is fairly complex and enables characters to explore various planets and gather various resources. Play is competitive with victory conditions. The play is somewhat unusual in that players must construct a complex series of programmed instructions for an exploration process.

Play uses custom cards and a play surface; these are available as print-and-play components under separate download.

199153.name: Dragonfly 3RR0R: Cards
199153.description:
User summary:

Game play requires custom cards and a play surface. This document makes them available as print-and-play components. Note that the color of some of the cards is significant.

199154.description:
Replaces one of the six standard tower sections with a piece of the same size but with the Tabletop Day 2016 logo on the front side and on the back, the instructions:

"Rebuild this Tower once by returning 3 slain Trolls to the Forest"
199154.name: Castle Panic: Tower Promo 2016 Tabletop Day

199155.name: Spirit Quest
199155.description:
User summary:

Characters are defined only by narrative tags in this lightweight storytelling game. Players collaboratively create a "world in crisis" that threatens all their tribes. The game then proceeds into the next phase where play becomes competitive as players seek to advance their character's interests which are aligned to their tribe's interest. Play proceeds through four phases, based on the seasons.

199156.name: Insults & Injuries: A Pathfinder Sourcebook for Medical Maladies
199156.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You have never read a game book quite like this one! Written by a practicing medical doctor, Insults & Injuries presents real world illnesses in Pathfinder game terms. Why afflict characters with “filth fever” when you can give them rabies, the black plague, or the flu?

Within this sourcebook, you will find dozens of sicknesses that your players already know and fear in a format that allows them to be easily and realistically brought into your games. You will also find expanded rules for more effective non-magical healing.

This detailed book is divided into an introduction, 14 chapters, and six appendices and includes:


Rules for more than 50 diseases and disorders, their game effects, and how they can be treated by both mundane and magical means.
A chapter on the effects of alcohol, drugs, and poisons.
A chapter on mental illnesses and their game effects.
Rules for adjudicating surgical procedures.
Four new prestige classes dedicated to nonmagical healing, the Alienist, Apothecary, Chirurgeon, and Physician.
Special rules on the effects of illnesses upon non-Humans like Drow, Dwarves, Elves, Giants, Goblins, and Orcs.
New spells, equipment, and feats.


With this book, you and your players will never look at diseases the same way again!

199157.name: Rage, Rage (2012)
199157.description:
User summary:

The game is played in eight Chapters (phases) with different narrative events occurring in each phase. Characters are defined primarily by narrative tags; the setting assumes that some climactic event is about to happen. The nature and time of the event are determined collaboratively during play. In the game, narrative description and resolution are preferred to any mechanics, which in any event are lightweight.

199158.name: Coyote Pass
199158.description:
User summary:

Play begins with a collaborative session that establishes the setting, the goals, and the difficulties that will be experienced during play. These then are handed to the game master for implementation and player create characters. Characters are defined by Traits (narrative tags), with scores running from 0 to 12.

Characters may chose to act individually, collaboratively, or at cross purposes. Generally, the rules assume collaborative play and offer bonuses and benefits to this style. Action resolution uses a modified die roll against a target difficulty.

199161.name: Fidchell
199161.description:
User Summary

Fidchell, which is also called Feary Chess or Celtic Chess, is an ancient celtic game which was mentioned in multiple Irish epics and chronicles. Under the name of Gwyddbwyll it also appears in the Welsh Mabinogion and seems to have been held in peculiar reverence throughout the British Isles. Faery Chess is what emerged from Nigel Suckling's investigations and speculations about the lost game.

The game is played an a board consisting of circles and lines on which the game pieces are placed and can move along. Similar to games like Nine Men's Morris the pieces are first placed onto the board in turn and moved afterwards once all of them have been placed. The capturing of pieces works differently though and is alike to Tafl games: a piece gets captured if a player traps it between two of his own pieces. This even grants him another move with which he may trap another one and so on.

199162.description:
Each Expansion expands the game and focuses on a specific aspect of the war. We have designed the game from the start to include all the rules you need to use all the expansions!

Expansion box includes 56 cards.

This expansion features American hostile forces, more Action cards, more Weapons, more Equipment, more Skills, and more Mission, Objectives, and Locations!
199162.name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #1 – United States!

196496.name: Warfighter: The WWII Tactical Combat Card Game

199163.description:
Each Expansion expands the game and focuses on a specific aspect of the war. We have designed the game from the start to include all the rules you need to use all the expansions!

Expansion box includes 56 cards.

This expansion features United Kingdom Soldiers and hostile forces, and UK Weapons!
199163.name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #2 – United Kingdom!

196496.name: Warfighter: The WWII Tactical Combat Card Game

199166.name: Six up
199166.description:
Wooden game of the Maxis line, specially designed with big pieces, easy to grab, to allow kids and elderlies to play together.

Six up consists of a vertical wooden piece with six vertical tracks made of holes. Each player has six wooden tokens (red and blue). In turn, each player rolls a die and chooses a token to go up one of the tracks. If a token lands in a hole already occupied, it ejects the previous token. If a token reaches the top of its track no one can go up this track no more. Game ends when all tops are reached. In the case of a tie, count the highest positions of tokens that have not reached the top.

199167.name: The Last Battle (SNES)
199167.description:
User Summary

Traditional turn based Japanese RPG where you control a young wizard and his allies on a quest to save the world.

199168.name: Grand Theft Auto: London 1961
199168.description:
"Grand Theft Auto: London, 1961 is a freely distributed mission pack to Grand Theft Auto and Grand Theft Auto: London, 1969 released on 1 June 1999. It is the third game in the series. Like London, 1969, it uses the same game engine as Grand Theft Auto. As the name implies, the game takes place in London in 1961, eight years before the events that took place in London, 1969. The 1961 setting makes this mission pack the earliest Grand Theft Auto game chronologically."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Theft_Auto%3A_London%2C_1969%23Grand_Theft_Auto%3A_London.2C_1961 Grand Theft Auto: London, 1969]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199169.name: Second Tide
199169.description:
From the back of the book:
Gli eroi di un tempo sonodiventati scomodi. Ma il passato non può essere cancellato. Vecchi nemici creduti sconfitti tornano a gettare scompiglio negli assetti geopolitici e terrificanti aberrazioni emergono dalle acque del Giappone radendo al suolo intere città.

English translation:
Old heroes became dangerous. But the past cannot be erased. Old enemies that all believed to be defeated are back to bring havoc in the geopolitical situation and terrifying aberrations emerge from the waters of Japan razing entire cities.

199170.name: Nitro Ball
199170.description:
User Summary

Bizarre eight directional run and gun shooting game with elements of pinball, Smash T.V. and Mercs, in which you control a contestant on a futuristic gameshow attempting to win various prizes.

199171.name: Operation Body Count
199171.description:
"Operation Body Count is a 1994 first-person shooter that used the Wolfenstein 3D ray casting engine. It was developed and published by Capstone Software.
Terrorists have taken over the UN Building and have seized the government officials in the building. They are now being held as hostages in the top floor of the building by Victor, the leader of the terrorist gang.
As a member of a special Government Assault Team, it is up to the player to command their team and reach the top floor (the 40th level), rescue the hostages and eliminate the terrorist threat by killing Victor.
Using a modified Wolfenstein 3D engine, the gameplay is very similar to the majority of other "clones" of the time. The game consisted of 40 levels. The first few levels are set in the sewers, where you attempt to make your way up to the basement of the building.
Upon getting into the UNN building, you then combat the terrorists. When you make it up to level 40, you come face-to-face with Victor himself."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Body_Count Operation Body Count]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199172.name: Describe: Perspective Exploration
199172.description: The game is a deck of cards, each with an adjective and three questions related to that adjective. The instructions include i) a Headbanz-style game in which a player tries to guess the word that is pasted to his forehead as the other players act it out, ii) an Apples to Apples-style game in which a player guesses which of the other players played which adjectives that describe him, and iii) a Balderdash-style game in which the guesser guesses which players wrote which answers to one of the questions on the card.

199174.description:
Imagine a world in which our technologic enhancements yield the powerful diesel-driven machines of the early 20th century. A world in which the discovery of an alien resource has changed the industrial evolution forever. Where the military arsenals have never been used to incite a world war, but for the very survival of mankind. It is the year 1948 and the world as we know it has ceased to exist. Welcome to Xibalba, where the remains of civilization fight for their very survival in an inter-apocalyptic dieselpunk world.

In the Xibalba - Generals Expansion you got to buy a general with paragon instead of regular ressources, that gives you a unique and permanent ability to manipulate the war for the ark to your favor.

Game features:

Added four new headquarter player boards
Added a direct player-interaction with raiding
Added generals, powerfull entities bought with paragon
Added elite soldiers as a powerfull household guard of your general
199174.name: Xibalba: Generals Expansion

199175.name: Devil's Advocate
199175.description: A reader reads a statement from a card, and the remaining players have one minute to debate it. Each debater then plays a card that indicates i) whether he believes the reader will agree or disagree with the statement and ii) the number of points (1,2,or 3) that the debater is willing to risk on his guess. Each correct debater keeps his card with its points. The next player becomes the new reader. The first player to 21 points wins.

199176.name: Dungeon Master's Screen: Curse of Strahd
199176.description:
From the back of the screen:
This screen is the perfect companion for those Dungeon Masters running the Curse of Strahd adventure, or any trek through Barovia. The front includes contrasting images of Count Strahd von Zarovich while the back provides maps for Castle Ravenloft and surrounding Barovia, as well as random encounter tables for both.

199177.name: Alba di Cthulhu: Schermo del Narratore

199178.description:
A map expansion for Dorasure. This time with 2 dragons to fight, and additional terrain types.

The expansion comes with:

A large expansion map board
Rules sheet covering new additions to the game rules
Reference sheet
2 glass counters for tracking the green and black dragon meters
A punchboard of additional tiles.
199178.name: Dorasure: Gemeos Imperial Travelogue

199179.name: Caveman World: Mountains of Unga Boonga
199179.description:
User Summary

Travelling through a prehistoric world, your caveman navigates through enemies, keeping his energy up and unlocking doors.

199180.name: Caviar: The Elegant Challenge
199180.description:
Caviar is an abstract strategy game played on 8x8 grid with each of the corner spaces missing. This results in the first and last rows having only 6 spaces instead of the usual 8. Each player has 6 tiles numbered 1-6 which are placed on the first and last row in numbered order.

On a player's turn, he rolls 6 dice to determine which pieces may move and by how many spaces. To begin with, pieces may only move sideways, forward, or forward diagonally, but may not move backwards.

If a piece is adjacent to an opponent's piece, it can be jumped in a Checkers fashion and removed from the game. Once a piece reaches the opponent's starting row, it becomes a king and can now move backwards.

The first player to eliminate all of his opponent's pieces from the game is the Winner.

199181.name: Explorer
199181.description:
From the game inlay

Thirty billion light years from the nearest service station and the inertial stabilizers go. You make a somewhat generalised statement about used spaceship dealers. The guarantee falls to the floor as you hit the upper atmosphere of the Emerald planet. The last scan before systems failure revealed 40 BILLION MAPPABLE LOCATIONS. In 9 of them are vital bits of your craft. Only by finding them can you ever hope to escape.

199182.description: Commands & Colors Tricorne - The American Revolution is not overly complex. The game is based on the highly successful Commands & Colors game system, where the Command cards drive movement while creating a “fog of war” and the battle dice resolve combat quickly and efficiently. Commands & Colors Tricorne - The American Revolution, however, introduces many new game concepts, which will add historical depth and provide even the most veteran Commands & Colors player many new play experiences and challenges.
199182.name: Commands & Colors Tricorne: The American Revolution

199183.name: The Bandit's Cave (Pathfinder)
199183.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trail of the Apprentice is a 5-part mini-campaign, designed for beginners and younger players of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or 5th Edition. Each adventure takes your heroes through one character level, from 1st though 5th. Trail of the Apprentice is part of the Legendary Beginnings line, designed to create exciting adventures suitable for all ages. These modules use simplified stat blocks and other rules adjustments to keep gameplay fun for new players, and contains helpful sidebars that provide advice on how to run RPGs for younger gamers so your whole family can Make Your Game Legendary!

The people of Corbin Village are hardy folk, familiar with the dangers of the region. But when a band of orcs raids the village, Sheriff McBride realizes she has more troubles than she can handle and calls on a group of heroes to bring the orcs to justice. To complicate matters, the orcs have stolen an item of great historical value from the local sage, and he wants it back. Can the PCs survive the dangers of a nearby marsh and locate the bandits’ hidden lair? If they do, can they take down the orc raiders and recover the sage’s precious statue? The Bandit’s Cave is an adventure for 1st-level characters.

199184.name: Space Pilgrim Episode III: Delta Pavonis
199184.description:
User Summary

This installment of Space Pilgrim has Gail Pilgrim on the Planet Leto.

199185.name: Space Pilgrim Episode IV: Sol
199185.description:
User Summary

This last installment of the Space Pilgrim series has issues and characters re-surface from the other three episodes. There are more far-ranging choices (and results) for key characters.

199186.name: Strada
199186.description: The players have to move two cars from their garage at the corners of the game board around the track and back to their garage. Movement is determined by a die. Two traffic lights are operated by the roll of a 3 or a 5. Two event spaces (breakdown and restaurant/stadion) hinder the movement of the cars. The first player to return his two cars to his garage wins the game.

199187.name: Rhune: Dawn of Twilight Campaign Guide
199187.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the snowy, icy fields of the North, entire tribes of barbarians – disease-bound servants of the Thrall Lords – amass, mustering for Ragnarök. Their ears tuned to whispers sane men cannot hear, these horrid foes wait only for the guttural command of their masters. Further south, the dead gather among the ruins of pulverized cities, growing stronger in shadows of the Ghoul Stone, the necromantic bridge between Midgard and Neinferth. All the while, the good people of the South stand divided against their aggressors – the City-States of Vallinar embracing technology as a means to win Ragnarök, while the ælves and their allies battle to eradicate every trace of it. All the while, the daily tick of the Ragnarök Clock marks the passing of another season, bringing every branch of Yggdrasil closer to Ragnarök – the final battle.

The long-awaited Rhune: Dawn of Twilight Campaign Guide contains:

A detailed look at the world of Rhune, from the lands of the Middle Court to the various realms beyond, including information on:
Briglæss, the Glimmering Lands
Grimhæm, Realm of the Fel & Fallen
Nachtland, the Shadow Realm
Neinferth, the Yawning Gap
Niflæheim, the Realm of All-Winter
Sommerfæth, the Forest Unburning
Thodheim, Realm of the Dishonored Dead
Tieferhæm, the Underhall of Velash

Important information on the technology of Rhune, including details on ambient power fields, dragon towers, as well as how storm tech impacts the various people – both on Midgard and on other branches of the Great Tree.
Details on all of the races native to Rhune, including: the ælves, the aryandai, the automata, the clockwork elves, the dwarves, the glitterfane, the malaran, and the jötunfolk.
Over 90 new unique traits for PCs to choose from.
Rules for earning and spending both honor and wyrd points.
Information for any PC that wants to learn to use the runes, even if they don’t have arcane or divine abilities.
Six new classes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game including: the Blood Skald, the Clockwork Adept, the Gjallarhorn, the Gun Priest, the Juggernaut (of Blind Fury), and the Plague Bringer.
A greater look at the City-States of Vallinar and the various factions that operate within and beyond them.
A detailed look at both the Æssinyr and the Thrall Lords – the gods who ready for the final battle over Yggdrasil, the Great Tree.
New rules for extraordinary devices – items designed to merge magic and technology together.
A bestiary filled with new monsters for your heroes to fight.
New spells, incantations, gear, guns, alchemical recipes, and other options unique to the lands of Rhune.




Hi, I'm Jaye, creator of Rhune: Dawn of Twilight.

When asked to describe Rhune, I tend to call it "Stormpunk." But what is, exactly, Stormpunk?

Originally inspired by some of the greatest campaign planar and steampunk settings, Rhune: Dawn of Twilight is truly its own genre, one we affectionately call stormpunk. It is a genre inspired
by steampunk, but one that took a radically different turn, both in terms of culture and technology. While it certainly has some similarities to steampunk as a genre, stormpunk trades steampunk's monocle, Victorian sensibilities, and top hat for a drinking horn, a gear-shaped torque, and a gun-sword. It embraces electricity, but throws off the yoke of Earth's normal history and asks the question—what if Tesla had been a magician? What if magic and electricity had developed side by side? What if "steam" had lost the technological race and man learned to call power from the very sky itself? All of these questions, alongside the explorations they give birth to, are what give life to stormpunk.

Well, that's how I describe it in the book, at least. The fact is, Stormpunk for me is something intensely personal and, in its own way, an extension of my own exploration into alternate fantasy futures, a sort of "what if" that plays out in my own pet universe. Except I've invited all of you to come and play, too.

Cheers,
Jaye

(and yes, if this looks similar to what exists on the Rhune page it is, because I copied it here for consistency). ;)

199188.name: Technology Unleashed
199188.description:
From publisher blurb:

Technology Unleashed is a compilation of several technology sourcebooks published by Otherverse Games between 2013 and 2014. This massive campaign tool box includes all the content originally found in the PDF editions of The Polymer Path, The Advanced Arsenal, [rpgitem=167576 The Advanced Armory, The Advanced Edge and Advanced Tech, the Modern Grimorie and more. Within is every gun, energy blade, high tech suit of armor, gadget, sci-fantasy spell and cybernetic implant found in the original sourcebooks plus new surprises.

Technology Unleashed was designed with Otherverse Games’ signature campaign settings in mind, built around modern and futuristic settings that blend magic and technology in some unexpected ways. However, these new pieces of gear and campaign elements can be imported into any campaign world, fusing sorcery and technology in some unique new ways.

Technology Unleashed differs from Paizo Publishing’s approach to technology, as exemplified by their Ultimate Technology sourcebook in several ways. Paizo Publishing treats technology as rare artifacts from an earlier era, or exotic wonders imported into an otherwise low-tech world by a crashed starship or dimensional rift. Technology is expensive, campaign changing and fundamentally limited by rare, hard to duplicate and extremely finite power sources. This sourcebook, on the other hand, treats high tech weapons, armor, cybernetics and props as common-place and products of an evolving, present-day technology.

199189.name: Coins & Credit
199189.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within Coins and Credit (our biggest Letter, yet!), we cover the topic of money and how to make it fit in your campaign (and your bag of holding).

The first part of our 8th Letter is all about coins. We cover mundane and magical currency crafting, counterfeiting, coin size, exchange rates, and transportation of coins. Slaying the dragon is great and all, but how many coins can you fit in a leather bag? And is the party barbarian strong enough to carry the whole hoard?

Part two is on banks. Surely you don't want to lug around all that gold? Even if you got it converted to mithral pieces, tens of thousands of metal coins is a lot for our heroes! We cover the different types of banks, account types, loans, account tiers, the likelihood of finding banks in different settlements, and example banks!

Finally, part three covers credit. Don't worry if your head is still spinning from tax season. We make things simple for you and your adventuring party! We cover tabs, letters of credit, promissory notes, banknotes, and magic items to assist in the transfer of wealth!

199190.name: Kung-Fu Kuma: Races of Qui Sang
199190.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kung Fu Kuma: Races of Qiu Sang is an expansion book for the Kung Fu Kuma campaign world and the Pathfinder Game System ™. It expands the list of available PC races by 6, and it further includes 1 companion race (for use as friends, allies, loyal servants, and henchman, as well as NPCs). That's 7 new races available for Kung Fu Kuma campaigns, 6 of them directly for use as Player Characters.

One thing about all of these races, they are all Animal Folk. That is a given in the campaign world of Kung Fu Kuma. But if you purchased this book intending it for use in a different campaign world, all of these races are compatible with the general Pathfinder Game System ™, though the Gamemaster will themselves have to come up with some reason why Animal Folk exist in that campaign world.

6 New PC Races

The Empire of Qiu Sang is made up of twelve Clans who joined together in the great Clan Accord. Six of these races (and also Humans) were detailed in the Kung Fu Kuma Players Handbook - specifically, the six races that dwell in the Mang Wan Valley, the valley of Kung Fu.

Individuals of the other six races do live in the Mang Wan Valley, as well, but they are not greatly represented there. These other six Animal Folk races generally prefer to be out in the country proper, closer to politics and power, and closer to wine and wealth. The Mang Wan Valley is a beautiful place, to be sure. But it also an isolated place of meditation and quiet contemplation (and Kung Fu). Those who desire political power tend to want to live closer to the Imperial Capitol.

This divide amongst the twelve races might be best thought of as a divide between the 6 Kung Fu Races and the 6 Imperial Races. While there is no such actual divide recognized by anyone in the Empire, it is a simple, shorthand way of illustrating the difference. Now, this is not to say that no one outside of the Mang Wan Valley practices Kung Fu, nor that the Mang Wan Valley is entirely devoid of politics. Kung Fu is widely practiced everywhere within Qiu Sang, and politics is certainly practiced in the Mang Wan Valley. The above divide is a thing of emphasis, not of absolutes.

199191.name: Infinite Threats 08
199191.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a few alien critters to kill off in your Infinite Futures Games? Are your players bored with blasting droids and robots? Avalon is offering you new threats for your team to encounter, where each menace is a fully detailed creature, usable as part of the Fringe setting or in any game you are running.

Explore the danger of space with new threat expansions released for the Infinite Futures system.

199192.name: Seedfall
199192.description:
From the introduction:

Seedfall is a tabletop role playing game that focuses on the events following the landing of the first sleeper ship. Within the pages of this book you will uncover both the horrific secrets of Terra Scorpii and the rules you will need to navigate them.

User summary:

The game presents an intriguing and well developed setting. The rules favor narrative action over mechanical resolution. Characters primarily are defined with a series of narrative tags, grouped into various character elements.

199193.name: Give Me 5!
199193.description:
Similar to Rummy 500, you are trying to complete a goal and get rid of the cards in your hand to end the round. The game consists of five cards that must be completed in order.

Once you complete a goal, during the next round you work on your next goal while the other players are still trying to complete the previous one.

Goals:
1. Set of any 3 strawberries plus any 2 spinach
2. Set of any 3 tomatoes plus any 2 kiwi
3. Run of 5 in any suit (fruit or vegetable)
4. 2 runs of 3 in any 2 suits
5. Any 5 of one suit plus two 3's

Winner of the game is the first to complete all five goals in order.

199194.name: Nobles
199194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gostor is a Grumpy Old Schooler's Take On Rules. A series of product aimed at providing, simple yet robust rule additions to expand your game.

Gostor: Nobles presents a new base class, the noble. to play a noble character, along with new feats, and a new prestige class, the ambassador. Everything you need to join the ranks of the elite, whether from the start or later in your adventuring career.

199195.name: 10 Barbarian Magic Items
199195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Equipment as savage as you are!

Sometimes you want to sit down to a full meal, and sometime you just want a cheap, quick, and easy snack. To feed your craving Rite Publishing presents the “10 Series” which will presents 10 pieces for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

This time out we bring you 10 new magical items to supplement the Barbarian, without getting in the way of the weapons, armor, ring of protection, cloack of protection, amultet of natural armor and belt of strength you want to take.

Adversity's Bulwark armor and shield special ability: Use your rage to overcome detrimental effects, so you can get on with the beat down you are giving.
Felling Storm weapon special ability: If you hit an opponent while raging perform a bonus combat maneuver, because you want to do more than just exchange blows.
Boots of the Wild Rust: Be the first to reach your opponents, charge through rough terrain, or even across vast chasms.
Bracers of Epic Deeds: Perform unique combat manevuers with great alacrity to astound friend and foe alike.
Gauntlets of the Breaker: Hinder an opponents natural attacks, natural armor, and an opponents full plate, plus deal more damage to objects. Because sometimes its more fun to maim than to kill.
Helm of the Nomad: Take a 10 or sometimes even a 20 on some of the barbarians most useful class skills, even in the most dire of circumstance it my just save your (or your allies) life.
Ring of Spritual Spite: use your rage to protect you from magical damage, so you can show spellcasters the power of hate.
Baldric of Restraint: Sacrifice your rage to heal your wounds, and live to hate another day.
Mantle of Thorns: Do you like to grapple or are you tired of being grappled, swallowed or raked, then this garment is for you.
“The Fell Hammer” Legacy Item: Let your magic item level up with you, and provide you with the ultimate tool of savagery!

199196.name: Shobolan Mussman
199196.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cohorts & Companions – Shobolan Mussman provides twenty stat blocks (CR 1/2 thru 19) for a male ratfolk rogue utilizing the eldritch scoundrel archetype (included here along with a progression table). He mixes stealth and trapfinding, ranged combat skills, and arcane spellcasting in a support role. His capabilities focus on enhancing others, setting up sneak attacks, and bypassing obstacles.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

199197.name: Ultimate Runesmithing
199197.description:
From publisher blurb:

With all sorts of runemasters running around, why on earth are there no runesmiths?

Magic is difficult. Really difficult. Not only are there complicated incantations and gesticulations involved, but a wizard has to be able to draw power out of the very air while remembering to do everything just so. Failure generally means explosions. A large number of bright, if methodical, individuals who would otherwise make excellent wizards are locked out of their desired profession by these mental gymnastics that reward the quick mind rather than the contemplative mind. Luckily, there exists a path for them.

Rune magic removes the temporal connection between going through the motions of a spell and drawing energy from the air to power it. By etching, painting, or carving complicated runes ahead of time, a runesmith prepares devices that channel magical energy for him, thus rewarding the methodical over the agile. All a runesmith need do is pump the rune full of energy and aim.

This reliance on physical objects for spellcasting may be a bit of an Achilles heel, but it is also the means to a unique specialization. As the absolute masters of magic with and upon "stuff", the runesmith is an accomplished warder and manufacturer of temporary magic items. While he may not warp reality as does a wizard, a party with a runesmith will never want for constantly-shifting equipment.

Product Features

The runesmith base class, featuring a new system of magic with tiered runes in two styles of casting: equipment and projection
Three archetypes - the campaigner, the forgemaster, and the projectionist
11 feats
Nearly 200 rune variants, ranging from boots that grant bonus kick attacks to a hat that unleashes guard dogs on command

199198.name: Zarrakan: Where the Adventure Never Ends (2015)
199198.description:
Where the Adventure Never Ends

From the introduction:

Zarrakan is a diceless narrative role-playing game (RPG) with no set genre that focuses more on storytelling than detailed rules.

User summary:

This version of the game core rules document corrects several errors present in the prior version (notably, the typographical error on the cover), as well as several simplifications. Thematically, the game remains the same; mechanically, the game has been converted from dice to cards. Unlike the prior version, this edition of the complete game is available for free download.

199199.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 5 - Mar 2015)
199199.description:
From publisher blurb:

From mounted styles designed to be used in close-quarters, to ancient elven sword styles that emphasize deception and the use of a cloak as a defensive tool, this article introduces five new weapon styles, each with three weapon style feats, sure to enhance your Pathfinder game! Check out the Centaur style, practised by mounted knights, the elven Leaping Spider style, the Lion Blade style created by jaded paladins, the Garuda style, which emphasizes the buckler, and the Tempest style, a sweeping, devastating application of the quarterstaff!

199200.name: Iron Ninjas
199200.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are assumed to be young crime fighters. They may simply act as vigilantes but their crime fighting activities may be more subtle. Characters are defined by Traits (narrative tags) that may offer a bonus in some activities. Action resolution involves a variable dice pool roll compared to an action table to determine results.

By far the most unusual aspect of the game is the structure of having two game masters for the campaign - an "A Plot" game master, and a "B Plot" game master. These two players have distinct areas of responsibility but otherwise act as traditional game masters.

Several "Setting Booklets" were planned, but never produced.

199202.name: Dust Tactics: "Otto"
199202.description:
The AufklärerLäufer KV 47 (r) "Otto" is a new addition to Axis forces on the Eastern front. After the sixth liberation of Kiev, they captured a whole battalion of brand new SSU KV-47 before these could even enter battle.
The “Otto” has been refitted with latest-generation Panzerfaust and Grenade Launchers. It can now destroy soft and hard targets with ease.

The Deluxe Edition models are not just “pre-painted”. What we offer is the exact replica of Vincent Fontaine’s work, Dust Studio’s Master Painter.

199203.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 7 - Apr 2015)
199203.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantastic Tomes & Librams presents you with 1d100 mundane but exotic books and tomes to furnish a wizard's study, a library, or a treasure hoard. Each entry contains the book’s name, its author, a short description, and an optional notation indicating its rarity, relative value, and number of pages.

199204.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 8 - Apr 2015)
199204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Make the most of the Pathfinder RPG's dirty trick combat maneuver with this guide by Thomas Kyle, which also includes four new feats and two new spells designed to fool and bewilder your opponents in battle!

199205.name: Nanoświat
199205.description:
User summary:

The Polish-language version of the game retains the tone and mechanics of the English-language original. It is made available as a free download.

199206.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 9 - Apr 2015)
199206.description:
From publisher blurb:

Congratulations! Your party is dead. This is a Pathfinder RPG adventure designed for 9th-level characters. It is also a little different, as the PCs will start it dead. Fortunately for them, death is not the end. With the help of the azata Asha, they can still defeat the monstrous lich who killed them in the first place… And recover their lives in the process. By Jonathan Garret.

199207.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 10 - Apr 2015)
199207.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mighty, volcanic monster for your Pathfinder game! This menacing, CR14 giant appears to be made of magma. Its black, rocky mass radiates massive heat, while red light pours from its mouth and the cracks in its stony hide. Full stats, plus adventure seeds.

199208.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 13 - May 2015)
199208.description:
From publisher blurb:

Resource scarcity, helplessness, and personal stories are all tropes of the survival horror genre for good reason: they work!

199209.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 14 - May 2015)
199209.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enhance your Pathfinder game with plants and herbs which heal, cure poisons or diseases, provide mental cleansing, or augment the imbiber. Butterfly Weed, St. John's Wort, Dragon Flower, Rosy Periwinkle... this article contains 10 useful herbal remedies.

199210.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 15 - May 2015)
199210.description:
From publisher blurb:

Galems - not golems! - are built out of clay by the galem builders, an alternate version of the summoner. This article introduces the galem builder, along with the galem itself. Why summon an outsider when you can build your own perfect construct?

199211.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 16 - May 2015)
199211.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all healing is supernatural! Sometimes medical training takes the form of the field-surgeon, with roguish talents such as Apothecary, Bleed, Expert Surgeon, and First Aid, or even advanced talents like Cosmetic Surgery (if you'd dare to undergo medieval-style cosmetic work!) Do not try this at home!

199212.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 17 - Jun 2015)
199212.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you combine spellcasting and the martial arts, you get three new exciting fighting styles for the Pathfinder RPG. Emulate the vampire's gaseous form with the Clouded Path Style; use the graceful dance of blossoms on the wind with the Falling Blossom Style; or summon virulent toxins from your body with the Wandering Spider Style. Each style is presented with three feats ready for use.

199213.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 18 - Jun 2015)
199213.description:
From publisher blurb:

This article introduces two new NPCs designed specifically to take part in archery contests as introduced in the TRAILSeeker Archery Contests article. These NPCs are well suited to serve as rivals, spanning a number of competition sizes. Each entry details the type of contests that each NPC would find attractive, coupled with suggestions on how they would approach the contest. For players and GMs alike, each NPC also introduces a new ranged combat-themed magic item which expands the options available for both thrown weapons and traditional archery.

199214.name: Hauling Astronauts
199214.description:
There’s not much money to be made on Mars, but there’s plenty to be made getting people there.

The population of Mars is just under 2,000 people ‐ mostly scientists, some entrepreneurs, and a handful of very wealthy tourists. And this population is growing every week.

Hauling Astronauts (or Hauling A’, for short) is a game that pits two space transport companies against each other as they try to make the most money transporting astronauts to Mars.

Players roll dice with the pips representing astronauts, then place the die one by one on a shared grid. By arranging the dice in a way that matches their Transport Ships ("5 or less", "6 - 10", "even", "odd", etc.), players attempt to maximize their profits. Additional bonuses can be obtained by delivering their passengers to destination docks that also have defined ranges ("3", "4 - 7", etc.).

Hauling Astronauts was recognized with the following awards from the PnP Game Design Awards 2016:
- Runner up "Best Art & Design"
- Runner up "Best Small Build"
- Honorable Mention "Most Innovative"

199215.name: Classic Racing
199215.description:
From the inlay:

Now Amsoft brings the thrills and spills of the race course into your home on the Amstrad CPC464.
Classic Racing is a game for 0-6 players of strategy and planning. Each player is the owner of a stable of 16 horses (the computer managing the remainder of the stables when there are less than 6 players), the aim of the game being to accumulate the most money at the end of the season. As the season progresses, you must try to discover the strengths and weaknesses of your horses, trying to find the right ones to run in the eight 'Classics' at the end of the season. A season is made up of 4-16 meetings, each of which consists of 6 races. Each owner must enter a horse in each race, receiving prize money if you end in the first 3 to the line as well as any money you make on the betting.

Credits:

By Paul Neal

199216.description:
User Summary

The Palace promotional card is an alternate art card for the 8-point civilization structure in the Age III card deck. The card offers no new benefits; it is just alternate artwork. This card was one of the promotional items contained in the AsmOPlay kit and was given out as part of Tabletop Day 2016 (other items include the 7 Wonders: Art Pack, Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition): Cthulhu Promo Character, etc).
199216.name: 7 Wonders: Palace

199217.name: Raster Runner

videogameversion.309895: English/European Amstrad CPC Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition

199217.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of the light-cycle mini-game from TRON.




From the inlay:

High-speed action against the computer or a friend. Lay down your trail of Plasma on the Raster Grid, keep going at all costs and try to block your opponent's path. Only the meanest Plasma Bike rider gets to survive this split-screen, head-to-head contest.

User Summary:

Raster Runner is based on the light-cycle game from the film and subsequent arcade game Tron. There are a few innovations - it is a two player game, with each player having visibility of a small area around their 'Plasma Bike'. An overview of the match is shown on a radar which shows the entire arena.

The original light-cycle game had two speeds for the bikes, controlled by the fire button. This has been removed in this version. Instead the fire button activates an energy shield which allows the bike to pass through a plasma trail. Three energy shields are available per life.

A match consists of 10 lives per player, but when one rider loses their last life, the match is awarded based on a points system, so it is possible (though unlikely) that the player who loses their last life first, could still win the match.

Credits:

Original Game (C64 version) Designed by Hitech Studio Designs
Conversions by The Big Red Software House
Produced by Terry Haynes and Andrew Wright

199218.name: Deadbreed
199218.description:
User Summary

This arena brawler has 2 teams of three match up. While originally an early release game it became free or at least pay to play.

199219.name: Listen (2015)
199219.description:
User summary:

Play in this rules-light storytelling game involves creating shared narratives about various musical songs. Players exchange play sheets during play, ensuring that input into the narratives is collaborative. Player responses to the musical tracks entirely is free-form. Character creation, if utilized, is minimal and encapsulated in the narrative play artifacts.

199220.name: Back in 1995
199220.description:
A throwback to the survival horror and mystery games of the original Playstation, Back in 1995 faithfully re-creates everything from this forgotten era of games.

Source: The Game Website.

199221.description:
Welcome to the fastest growing suburb in the country. You and your opponents are cast as very irresponsible real-estate developers charged with the task of building houses, shops and factories to make quick money before larger interests notice the community.

New Jack City is a city-building game where players place tiles that contain residential, commercial, or industrial properties. Players must place tiles by matching the roads and construct them using workers known as builders. Builders start counting down when the property is connected to the electric grid. Constructing large properties offers bonuses which allow you to outpace all other players. To win a player must earn more money than all other players by constructing buildings before the city's’ electricity grid becomes maxed out.
199221.name: New Jack City

199222.description:
After their victory over Marshal Soult in northern Portugal, the British plan a joint campaign with their new Spanish allies to capture Madrid. The initial Allied plan is to pin the Victor corps in the Tage valley against the main Anglo-Spanish force while Vénégas, coming from Bailen, threatens the capital from the South.

Joseph did not anticipate this offensive and is surprised by the enemy attack. But he reacts promptly and, taking advantage of his central position, converges the Victor and Sebastiani corps in addition to his reserves toward Madrid and the combined forces of Wellesley and Cuesta. He completely ignores Vénégas who has the path to the capital wide open...

Les Maréchaux - The Marshals - is a generic game simulating the campaigns led by the French generals and marshals under the Consulate and the 1st Empire far from their brilliant commander Bonaparte. Joseph 1809 focuses on the Talavera and Ocaña campaigns.
199222.name: Les Maréchaux IV: Joseph 1809

199223.name: Bad Bones
199223.description:
You lead the good life at the top of your tower, contemplating your peaceful kingdom and chatting with your charming neighbors. Life is absolute happiness. Well, it was...

Terrible skeletons have arisen with a creepy clatter from their graves across the realms' ancient cemeteries. Those scouts that return report endless streams of bony hordes marching toward each kingdom, ravaging the lands as they come. Faced with this sudden threat, even your once friendly neighbors seem to have turned against you as they withdraw to their keeps to defend their own frightened kingdoms, focusing on their own villages and tower.

Your kingdom is at siege by the living dead. You raise troops, build walls, lay traps, prepare magical spells and even wake your pet dragon. Hopefully they can be slowed, or if you're devilishly crafty, they can be turned toward those traitorous adjoining kingdoms. In this battle, your best asset is your brave and proud hero, who stands ready to slay those piles of walking bones. Alas, he can't fight everywhere, so if things get truly desperate, you could offer them your treasure to get some relief.

The ivory invaders want somewhere to call their own to live out their death in peace, and they have their eye sockets on you! Will you hold out, or will your home become the retirement village of the damned...?

Bad Bones is a game in which you must survive an invasion of ever more numerous and dangerous skeletons. The invasion cannot be defeated, so you must outlast your opponents to win the day. At your disposal are a range of weapons that defeat, slow, or even deflect the skeletons towards the other players. The game ends when one player's tower or village is wiped out.

A game turn takes place in four phases:

1] Hero Movement and Combat: Move your hero and eliminate the skeletons from the destination square.
2) Trap Placement: Place or remove traps on your personal board.
3) Skeletons Move: Move the skeletons forward, damaging your tower or your village if they move far enough.
4) Skeletons Spawn: Place new skeletons among the streams and on the edges of the player boards.

Each phase happens simultaneously for all players on their own player board, which means a game with up to eight players can take only thirty minutes. Multiple copies of the game can be combined to play with as many players as you have space for, and the game can also be played solo. The rules are simple to explain and understand, with several strategic variations for experts.

199224.description: Two alternate characters (Old Master and Priestess) that were available to Kickstarter backers. Characters gameplay is identical to other characters.
199224.name: Oni: Alternate Characters

199225.name: Sultans and Kings
199225.description:
A historical military strategy game set in the era of the Crusades. 2-4 players compete to occupy and rule the cities and castles of the eastern shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
After setting up the armies, players take turns in moving their different units (infantry, cavalry, archers, sultans and kings, to name a few), on the map, across cities, castles and lands.
Battles occur when two players occupy the same area. Battle and Strategy cards help add some strategy to this dice-based game.
As they occupy and rule these castles, cities and/or lands, players collect cards and accumulate points. Points are used to purchase new units or pay ransom for captured units in battle.
The player with the most city and castle cards wins, after a predetermined number of rounds has been played.

199226.name: Legends of Atlantis: Exodus
199226.description:
Atlantis is facing its end of days. Massive tidal waves are sweeping away its coasts, earthquakes shake its mountains, its fields are in flames and its cities are falling apart. Take on the role of the champion of the last Queen of Atlantis and work to save the people of Atlantis and their kingdom in this innovative and addictive time management game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

199227.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (April 2016)
199227.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

GM Advice: Four Things Modern Dungeons Seem to Lack
Silver Bluff At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Silver Bluff)
Looting the Cleric's Body: Pouch Contents (from I Loot the Cleric's Body)
Marsh Town: Sights & Sounds (from Urban Dressing: Marsh Town)
Marsh Town: Businesses (from Urban Dressing: Marsh Town)
What's the Point (in Gaming)?

199228.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (May 2016)

rpgissuearticle.181410: 20 Bulky Treasures Difficult to Get Out of the Dungeon

199228.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

The Fallacy of the Adventurer’s Backpack
Revenge At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Revenge)
Penitent’s Rest At A Glance (from Places of Power: Penitent’s Rest)
Bag of Holding: Adventuring Gear (from I Loot the Bag of Holding)
20 Bulky Treasures Difficult to Get Out of the Dungeon

199229.name: Mutkia Matkassa
199229.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tämä on seikkailulisäosa Astraterra-seikkailuroolipeliin ja se sisältää kaikkiaan kolme pelattavaa seikkailua. Tarvitset Astraterra-seikkailuroolipelin näiden seikkailujen pelaamiseen.

Miten tätä lisäosaa käytetään?

Tässä lisäosassa esitellyt seikkailut eivät varsinaisesti liity toisiinsa, mutta halutessaan niistä voi vaikka tehdä yhden pitkän tarinan, jossa hahmot päätyvätkin kotiin pääsemisen sijaan aina uuteen seikkailuun erinäisten mutkien kautta. Voit yhtä hyvin käyttää tässä kirjassa olevia seikkailuja malleina omille seikkailuillesi.

Mitä tämä kirja pitää sisällään?

Tämä kirja pitää sisällään seuraavat seikkailut:

Lentävät rauniot: Tämä on suhteellisen lyhyt seikkailu pienillä lentävillä saarilla. Se sopii hyvin ensimmäiseksi löytöretkeksi.
Aavepuu: Tässä seikkailussa on aikoja sitten hylätty solaarien kaupunki, joka on ajatunut Myrskyyn ja sen ovat vallanneet erilaiset otukset.
Rikkoutunut linna: Tämä seikkailu haastaa pelaajia ja heidän sankareitaan monella tapaa. Heti alkuun päästään ratkomaan pientä aivopähkinää ja sen jälkeen riittääkin puljattavaa kaikenlaisten otusten kanssa.





Translated from Finnish:

This adventure supplement contains three adventures to be used with Astraterra adventure role-playing game. You need Astraterra adventure role-playing rules to use these adventures.

How is this supplement used?

Adventures in this supplement are not connected as such but option to run them as one long story is given where characters instead of getting home are taken further away by unexpected twists and turns. You can also create your own adventures using these adventures as models.

What's in this book?

This book contains the following adventures:

Floating ruins : This is a relatively short adventure with small floating islands. It is well suited to an first exploration.
Ghost Tree : This adventure is set in long since abandoned city of solars, which has drifted in to the Storm and has been taken over by many different creatures.
Broken Castle : This adventure will challenge both the players and their characters in many ways. Right from the beginning it starts with light puzzle solving and after that there more than enough interacting with all kinds of strange things.

199230.name: The Mighty Avenger (Fighter/Paladin Hybrid)
199230.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fight against evil is a gritty, dirty business. While some are called by the light to be exemplars of good, many other competent soldiers fill the gap to take up arms against those that commit the most heinous of acts. The mighty avenger combines the martial focus of the fighter with many of the divinely inspired gifts of the paladin to aid in their never-ending quest to vanquish the darkness. This supplement also includes new feats geared for the mighty avenger's special abilities.

199231.name: Four (2016)
199231.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are pre-defined. Each has unique abilities, goals, and victory conditions. No two characters are even remotely similar, yielding a very complex and rich play experience. The game is mechanically simple, using a single dreidel as a random event generator; however, the game resolution is subtle and complex. The dreidel is held ("owned") by a single character at a time, restricting its use to that character.

199232.name: Feats of Diplomacy
199232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats of Diplomacy is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the subtle arts of intrigue, from spies and saboteurs to heists, chases, mysteries, secret identities, and the fine art of conversation.
