If your character likes to delve into the diplomatic arena, she will love exploring the possibilities of 7 new mythic feats within, from Ironclad Logic and Threatening Negotiator to Entreating Critical and Call Truce!

199233.name: Feats of War
199233.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of War features ten new feats for siege engineers and vehicular pilots: Alchemical Warfare, Catapult Trajectionist, Charioteer, Evasive Driving, Mounted Evasion, Naval Warfare, Siegecraft, Steam Giant Siege, Steam Giant Stomp, and War Wagoneer!

199234.name: Enhanced Animals
199234.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take a walk on the wild side with… Enhanced Animals!

This special METAs file update features three curious entries into the Rogues, Rivals & Renegades series. Ranging from Power Level 8 to Power Level 11, each Enhanced Animal is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Maledetta, also known as Schadenfreude’s Cat, is a wickedly evil feline Rogue who loves to watch things fall apart. Cyboar, the Renegade cybernetic boar, roams the wild woods outside Beacon City trying to avoid the humans who twisted it into a living weapon. Bestia, the most heroic of the three, may Rival some heroes in her eagerness to perform good deeds. Each of these creatures is an exceptional animal with compelling backstories and strong motivations! Will your heroes realize they are potent beings in their own rights, or will they be taken by surprise by these Enhanced Animals?

199235.name: The Gulag
199235.description:
User summary:

This game requires exactly five players. Each player assumes the role of a defined prisoner at a gulag. Characters are pre-generated. Each character's build, goals, and problems must remain secret prior to play. Each character has various options and challenges. Players use bidding tokens during play; bids are kept hidden until actually played. The required secret information does require an unusual distribution format for them game, as follows:


The Gulag (introductory PDF; public knowledge)
Unclassified Information (RTF; public knowledge)
Prisoner 1 - 5 (5 RTF files; private knowledge)
Ending 1 - 5 (5 RTF files; private knowledge)

199237.description: Most Incorruptible Patriot is the sequel to Most Glorious Comrade. You are playing as notable democratic Cold War leaders vying for Voters. Whoever reaches 10 million first wins! This is an easy to pick up draw one play one style game.
199237.name: Most Incorruptible Patriot

199238.description:
Machi Koro: Diamine is a limited card that plays just like the Mine card but features the diamond-hungry monsters from Diamonsters.

Die Roll: 9
Cost: $6
Effect: "Get 5 coins from the bank, on anyone's turn."

Included in Machi Koro: Deluxe Edition, and also handed out by Barnes & Noble at their International Tabletop Day 2016 event.
199238.name: Machi Koro: Diamine

199239.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 3.05 - May 2016)
199239.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.
The Misfit Studios May 2016 Newsletter Contains Release Details on:

Metahuman Martial Arts 3e
Earl Geier Presents: Evil Imp
Eric Lofgren Presents: Dragon Attack in the Snow
Strange Brew: Warlock
Christina Stiles Presents: Silvertongued by Jacob Blackmon
Jason Moser Presents: Alien Forest Magic
Bite Me! Weretigers
Scott Harshbarger Presents: The Merchant
Fateful Lots: The Lost Water Clock of Thoth
Christina Stiles Presents: Tiger by Jacob Blackmon

199240.description:
Description from the publisher:

You're no longer looting and shooting on your own with Cash 'n Guns: Team Spirit. This expansion features rules for team play and enables a ninth player to take part in the action. It also introduces a deck of duplicitous mercenaries: twelve thugs-for-hire who can give your team a temporary advantage and who bring a deeper strategic dimension to the team game.

Seven new characters take seats at the table, including Boris, Natasha, the martini-wielding Maria, and the most awe-inspiring of all, Mama. They bring new surprises and powers with them, as well as a silencer that fits on your favorite weapon and three never-before-fired guns.
199240.name: Ca$h 'n Guns (Second Edition): Team Spirit

199241.description:
シュレディンガー勇者 (Schrödinger Hero) is a partnership game from Japan published in Japanese with English rules.

Players belong to either the Hero's side or Satan's side, and their objective is to defeat the leader of the opposite side. However, no player knows any player's identity, including themselves, and their identities often change.

Each player is dealt one identity card: Hero, Satan, Hero's friend, or Satan's servant. During your turn, you can gain a clue by looking at another player's card or by exchanging your card with other player's. When a player looks at another player's card, that player's comment or expression can also be a clue.

Only the Hero can defeat Satan, so even if you know who Satan is, you cannot defeat Satan until you have the Hero card, and vice versa. Unlike Werewolf, this game doesn't require a moderator, and players aren't eliminated during the game.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは勇者陣営か魔王陣営に所属し、勇者陣営は魔王を倒すことを、魔王陣営は勇者を倒すことを目的としています。しかし、最初は誰も自分の正体を知りません。プレイヤーは自分の手番に、他人の正体を見る、もしくは他人と正体を入れ替える事が出来るため、それらの行動を活用し自分と周囲の正体を把握していきます。正体を見た際の表情や言動もヒントになることでしょう。
夜の襲撃フェイズや人狼同士の顔合わせもないため、ゲームマスターが不要ですぐに遊ぶことが出来ます。プレイヤーの途中脱落もありません。
199241.name: Schrodinger Hero

boardgamehonor.40506: 2016 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee

199242.description:
Overview
Mini Rogue is a 9-card game in which a single player delves into a deep dungeon to get the famous ruby called The Og's Blood on the bottom floor.

The player must choose how to spend their resources in order to be powerful enough to confront ever difficult monsters. Random events and encounters make every play-through a unique experience.

As part of the 2016 9-Card Nanogame Design Contest, Mini Rogue won:

1st place - Best New Designers
2nd place - Best Overall Game
2nd place - Best Solitaire Game
2nd place - Best Artwork
3rd place - Best Thematic Game
3rd place - Best Written Rules

Components
9 cards
4 six-sided dice
8 tokens (any color)
199242.name: Mini Rogue

199243.name: Jalopy
199243.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Build, repair, refuel and drive a dilapidated old car on a grand journey through the territories of the former Eastern bloc.

Source: The Publisher Website.

199244.name: Desert Thunder: Strike Force
199244.description:
https://www.facebook.com/West-Forest-Games-485951301610161/?...

Desert Thunder : Strike Force is a small First-Person-Shooter game in the style of old, classic Delta Force games. You join 6 intense, large scale missions to prevent terrorist attacks. Customize your loadout, choose between 12 weapons and jump right into the action. Each Mission is large scale (2km²)

199245.name: Boomtown Bandits: Sneakiest Bastard Promo Card
199245.description:
Boomtown Bandits, celebrating game copies now lootable from store shelves in Spring of 2016, introduced this new bonus card, "Sneakiest Bastard", and branded shot glass promo. The bonus card provides a mid-game reward, claimed by the first player to win a shootout without a fight and call it. The card is worth $15 (points) at the end of the game.

--
The shot glass has no game effect, although filling it and emptying it repeatedly may alter dice rolling accuracy.

Inquire at Breaking Games (publisher) to get your copy, while supplies last.

199246.name: As Above, So Below (2013)
199246.description:
From the introduction:

The game itself takes the form of a collaborative storytelling experience. There are no dice, no attack rolls and no real resolution mechanic. Whatever the witch wants to occur simply does. The game is about how the petty squabbles and pains of youth are affected when the fantasy of revenge may become a reality.

User summary:

Characters have several narrative Traits and a single Attribute, Humanity, which ranges from 0 to 10 (and starts at 5). Various acts may alter a character's Humanity rating which in turn influences their probable future actions.

199247.name: Hypnose
199247.description:
In the deck-building game Hypnose, you are a hypnotist who is trying to be better than the other hypnotists. And to prove that you're the best, you want to lower your opponent's Mental Resistance to zero.
You do this by expanding your base deck with books, courses, hypnotic tools, and weakening effects you can buy.
Then challenge your opponents to a hypnotic duel and reduce their Mental Resistance.
The game is played in turns, and on your turn, you can:

1) Buy cards
2) Play a card for its ability
3) Engage in a hypnotic duel
4) Play a card for its ability
5) Fill your hand up to its limit

Keep track of your score on the board. When dropping to certain scores, you get advantages or disadvantages. The game is balanced so that players that are behind gain a bonus and the game stays balanced and interesting until the last turn.

The last man standing is the Greatest Hypnotist of all and wins the game!

199248.name: Bloody Broadsides
199248.description:
Bloody Broadsides – is a fast paced Napoleonic Naval game which allows you to Captain one or more massive ships of the line from the Age of Sail. Most games can be played in 3 hours. This game is intended to play with miniature ships on a large hex mat. These rules were written specifically for Portsmouth Miniatures and Games 1:900 scale ships but may be used with any miniatures.

Games may be as small as one on one Captain Duels, up to massive 60 ships or more historical battles like the Battle of Trafalgar. There is a point system to allow you to design your own scenarios.

Features:

Plotted Movement
Simultaneous Combat
Point System
Crew Grade
Morale Checks
Ship Classes (1st rate through 4th rate)
Critical Hits (including Ship Explodes)
Raking
Grappling
Capturing Ships
Drifting

199249.description: This upgrade kit contains all tiles from the second english edition by Capstone Games, that where not included in the first german/english edition by Spielworxx.
199249.name: Arkwright: Second edition upgrade kit

199250.description:
From the publisher:

Earthos is a strategy-based board game with features rarely, if ever seen in most board games today. Your objective in the game is to defeat your opponents by increasing technology, making strategic invasions and occupying enemy planets. Other strategic aspects of the game include rotating planets and moons, as well as random wormholes which allow units to move randomly. Politics can also play a pivotal role in match-ups with more than two players.

One last important highlight is the fact that each and every game can be a new experience. With the ability to change the shape of the board, pair up for team battles, and do much more, every game should be packed with fun.
199250.name: Earthos

199251.name: DunJon (Issue 2 - Aug 2015)
199251.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Perhaps the World's finest fantasy art magazine.

DunJon Fantasy Femme Fatale eZine as it names suggests is fantasy art magazine that primarily focuses upon femme fatales. (Beautiful, yet dangerous women.)

As a added bonus we also included a monthly dungeon map, A fantasy riddle page, and a universal magical item page.

This amazing fantasy art eZine features images of beautiful women dressed in interesting, often sexy outfits in exotic locations doing amazing things. (Think Super heroines, Steam Punk Fatales, Tomb Raiders, Zombies Killers, Chain Mail Bikini Warriors, Vampires and more!) Other fantasy style images such as dragons, monsters, male heroes/villains, and otherwise interesting images have also been included. These images are presented in variety of styles, that include pure photography, Infrared photography, Surrealistic glow, and comic style dark lined impressionism.

Each eZine contains over two-dozen printable 8.5x 11 images, plus bonus material to entertain and amaze you.

199261.name: The Wizard Universities: Heckshall, Albane, and DeathBain and The Simulator Orb
199261.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this first Setting Supplement for the StoryCube: RPG world of The Wizard Universities, learn about life-long friends Magus Heckshall the brillaint natural Wizard and Magus Albane the power-hungry Sorcerer, and Albane's grandson Magus DeathBain the world-renowned Necromancer.

Packed with 34 pages of information that you can use in SCRPG games on these men, numerous potential friends and allies, their world, the new era of magic they are working to bring about and the Great War that led to the current era, in addition to several ready-to-use Non-Characters, Villains, and Things for this or any other highly-magical StoryCube setting.

Includes The Simulator Orb, a 14-scene long adventure in which students at a Wizard University delve into the abandonded ruins of The North Siberian School of Sorcery in search of The Simulator Orb, an ancient Relik that will give future students the opportunity to practice their dangerous spells in the safety of an isolate Bubble Universe.

Throughout this Adventure, Players will meet strange individuals, face traps and puzzles, and perhaps even fight a few odd creatures they run afoul of.

199262.name: Chesscalation
199262.description:
Chesscalation is a two player strategy game based off of Chess and Shogi. It's designed to avoid analysis paralysis and avalanching by favoring the defender and easing the pressure of each move - all while still keeping the strategic depth of Chess. It also has a bunch of fun unique pieces. The main difference from Chess is that players can chose to upgrade pieces or even put new pieces on the board.

There is a risk versus reward mechanic as higher value pieces limit the player's ability to upgrade and make new units. On the flip side, losing a high value piece may actually be an opportunity in disguise. It frees up the player to be able to place new pieces, which makes recovering easy. Also since you can place pieces anywhere on your own side, you can really easily block a checkmate. The increased complexity introduced by upgrading and placing new units makes it essentially becomes impossible to predict your opponent more than a few moves in advance. Each move is important, but not crushingly so. Each player feels like they have a chance to win up until the very end.

There are two modes of play. The default mode plays the most like Chess. In it, the goal is simply to force a checkmate on the opponent. When pieces are captured, they are removed from play, so each player only has a set amount of pieces to work with. In the other mode, players earn points for each piece they capture. Captured pieces go back into the player's pool. The goal of the game is to capture 100 points worth of their opponent's pieces without losing their King.

199265.name: The Last Words of Dutch Schultz
199265.description:
From the introduction:

This scenario requires and uses the rules presented in Jenn Martin’s LARP The Last Hour. For this scenario, players will assume roles with a basis in historical events. Except as specified here, play should otherwise conform as closely as possible to the structures, questions, etc., presented in Martin’s game. The scenario can be played with some attempt to adherence to historical realism or the historical roles can be used simply as a basis for a roleplaying excursion.

199266.name: IKO
199266.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is another oldfashioned design with a modular distributed hull.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

199268.name: Sequoyah Second Edition
199268.description:
From publisher blurb:

An entire subsector at your fingertips!

The second edition of Subsector Sourcebook 4: Sequoyah details Subsector F of Clement Sector.

Sequoyah is the last of the four main subsectors to be colonized. While all of the systems have been settled, the subsector still maintains some of its former frontier feel.

Within these pages you will find the wilds of Bowemiwak, equality on Chriseda, the Igbo music of Amadioha, the optimism of Torarentsacorsus, and the strength of Boone. Each of these worlds with very different ideas on the way to proceed after the collapse of The Conduit.

Each world comes complete with detailed information concerning the system and the planet itself, yet leaves the Referee plenty of room to use these worlds as he/she sees fit. Made with the busy Referee in mind, this book can be used to expand your knowledge of Clement Sector or as a useful set of worlds to expand your current campaign.

boardgamehonor.40506: 2016 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee

199269.description:
This is a one page, ultra-portable, black and white solitaire game. You assume the role of a small party of conquistadors trying to reach the Atlantic Ocean after a failed expedition deep in the New World. This game is limited to 42 turns and each turn consists of phases such as Map Making, Exploring, and Hunting where a handful of dice are allocated in a press-your-luck fashion. For those that enjoy role-playing, there is also an optional Journaling phase where you try to tell a story about what happened on your turn. Can you reach the Atlantic Ocean before time runs out or before you lose all of your Conquistadors?

THEME
Your commander and entire company was killed after being ambushed in these mountains. The next morning, only six of you survive. Now you have to make it down the mountain and to the coastline where you can signal for help. The way is dangerous though; you’re short food and muskets. The natives will likely want you dead as offer any help.
199269.name: 1572: The Lost Expedition

199270.name: Moriturum
199270.description:
User summary:

The game setting is inspired by Terry Pratchett's "Death" series of novels. Action resolution involves dice pools of colored dice. Characters are defined with narrative tags but primarily developed during play.

The game was submitted to the Russian-language Game Chef 2015 competition.

199271.name: Through the Wire: The Great Escape
199271.description:
From the introduction:

Your name is Alistair Thompson and you are a Flight Officer in the Royal Air Force. The date is September 1940.

You have been literally living on Biggin Hill air field for the past two months, continually on standby. Every time the siren wails, at least three times a day, you leap into the cockpit of your aircraft.

The Luftwaffe, flying mostly Messerschmidts (ME109s) and Dorniers, have stepped up their attacks and, despite heavy casualties, are gradually wearing your squadron down.

Only four months ago, you were a newcomer to the squadron; in the last few months you have seen many good pilots die horribly. Now you are an expert amongst the newcomers.

User summary:

Published in Danish as Gennem Pigtråden: Flugten fra Krigsfangelejren.

This eZine contains over two-dozen printable 8.5x 11 images, plus bonus material to entertain and amaze you.

199277.name: DunJon (Issue 15 - Mar 2016)
199277.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Perhaps the World's finest fantasy art magazine.

DunJon Fantasy Femme Fatale eZine as it names suggests is fantasy art magazine that primarily focuses upon femme fatales. (Beautiful, yet dangerous women.) It is also a print collection. (All buyers of this pdf may print images for personal use.) It is also a Stock Art Catalog, all images in this and other DunJon eZines are up for sale. (Those who want to buy a professional license agreement may purchase HD images to make book/album/game covers, posters, and/or calendars see license agreement section of this eZine for pricing and options. )

This well-book marked, fantasy art eZine features images of beautiful women dressed in interesting, often sexy outfits in exotic locations doing amazing things. (Think Super heroines, Steam Punk Fatales, Tomb Raiders, Zombies Killers, Chain Mail Bikini Warriors, Vampires and more!) Other fantasy style images such as dragons, monsters, male heroes/villains, and otherwise interesting images have also been included. These images are presented in variety of styles, that include pure photography, Infrared photography, Surrealistic glow, and/or comic style dark lined impressionism.

This eZine contains over two-dozen printable 8.5x 11 images, plus bonus material to entertain and amaze you.

199284.name: The Jonny Nexus Compilation
199284.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Signs and Portents presents:

The Jonny Nexus Compilation

A compendium of articles originally written by Jonny Nexus for Signs and Portents magazine.

199285.name: Redcoats and Minutemen: The American War of Independence
199285.description:
From the introduction:

In 1775 America is a British colony, ruled over by King George III and his Government. But relations between the colonial settlers and the Government have become increasingly strained over the previous decade, since a number of laws were passed to tax the American people. The settlers thought these were unfair, as the laws were imposed by a parliament which had no American representatives in it, and they showed their disapproval by rioting, particularly in Boston.
...
By April 1775, when your adventure begins, the Americans are ready to oppose the British by force.

User summary:

Published under several titles, including Il Primo Ribelle (Italian), Pour l'Indépendance (French), and Rødfrakker og Minutmænd: Den Nordamerikanske Frihedskrig (Danish).

199286.name: The Grimoire (Issue 4 - Aug 2006)
199286.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The latest issue of The Grimoire periodical focuses on the Goblin race. In this issue, the Goblin language, culture, religion, and lifestyle are examined. Using examples from the Mhar fantasy, The Grimoire continues to be a useful source for other gaming systems. This issue provides a detailed insight into a race common in fantasy based RPG.

199287.name: The Grimoire (Issue 6 - Mar 2008)
199287.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

An in depth look at the Palliards, the Guild of beggars and thieves in the Mhar Fantasy RPG, from their humble beginnings at Martyr Field to their current status as the Guild that protects the disenfranchised. Also contains a look at the Edder race (Mhar's hallflings), and a view of the town of Lanternton. This is the last planned issue to focus solely on the Mhar Fantasy RPG. The Grimoire periodical will begin to expand its article and artwork base.

199288.name: The Fear Factor: Terrorism in the City
199288.description:
From the introduction:

England in the late 1980s. The powerful Western nations of the world, once able to do as they wished without question or complaint, are now far more aware of the political significance of their former colonies.
...
For most people in the West, however, these problems seem remote. Unemployment, drug abuse, alcoholism, and crime are more immediate concerns.

User summary:

Also published in Italian under the title Angoscia.

199289.name: The Grimoire (Issue 7 - Dec 2009)
199289.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The newest issue of The Grimoire offers a new format and new material. Besides the articles which advance the Mhar Fantasy RPG setting, there are new articles, comics and reviews. For the Mhar universe, this issue contains an indepth view of the City of Byranster and a guide to roleplaying the Edder race. There is a generalized article on the use of mirrors in magic, with a follow-up article adapting this to Mhar. We also introduce a regular feature called Down the Pipe which looks at the in development work of Fool's Moon Entertainment Inc. On top of this there are reviews and comics.

199290.name: The Grimoire (Issue 9 - Mar 2011)
199290.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This time around we present from contributing author Cyndy Cooper, a complete SF Live-Action Role-Playing Game: A Brief Journey Home. Also headlining this issue we have an artist interview with Bobbie Pentecost (who graciously supplied the cover art for this issue). Christopher LaHaise, author of the Fox Magic RPG waxes poetic about the Game Master’s lot and gives advice to those trying out the Big Chair. Mhâr Fantasy and fans of Fantasy RPGs in general will find interesting tidbits in this issue. In the first, Playing With Class Part II, Greg Older picks up where he had left off in Grimoire #7 on designing the character archetypes of Mhâr around dwarven characters. Continuing with the dwarven theme, we have a guide to the Noldar clan-holding of Vaksstead on the High Marches of Anæland. Regular features "No Subject Required", comics and reviews are also featured.

199291.name: The Grimoire (Issue 10 - Jan 2012)
199291.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

In the first article Kitprovides a useful guide to Shinto Shrines for Fox Magic and other RPGs set in Japan. This is just a hint of what is to comein the upcoming Fox Magic Companion slated for next year. Next up, Greg has a double feature: a location setting and an adventure for Mhâr Fantasy. “Cloak and Dagger” provides a Celtic murder mystery as well as a guide to the island fortress of Lyrcaidar on the coast of Gwythia. This too is a hint of things to come as The Kingdom of Gwythia Source Book goes to the editors. A new section, Variants & Scenarios, features home rules and new ideas for your favourite board games, card games, and RPGs. This issue's featured variants is a scenario for Mayfair Game’s popular Settlers of Catan, combining the Seafarers expansion with the Fishermen variant from Traders & Barbarians expansion. Plus reviews and comics.

199292.name: The Grimoire (Issue 11 - Oct 2012)
199292.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Superhero issue of The Grimoire. This issue includes a look at games featuring the heroes of the comic rack. In the first article “Super Law!” covers an aspect that many comic supers take for granted when they go out to uphold it: the law itself. Some thoughts and ideas are given to GMs to add a new dimension to their Supers RPG. Continuing with the theme, we have an article on adding the world of the Extinctioners comic to your Supers game. With permission granted from the artist himself, your supers may have an encounter of the “fuzzy” kind. On top of this, The Grimoire 11 includes regular features like a look into the Mhar universe with Calisburough and Goblins; a chapter from the graphic novel DragonQuest; and reviews.

199293.name: The Grimoire (Issue 12 - Apr 2014)
199293.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This issue of The Grimoire introduces some NPC characters for Fox Magic and the undead for the Mhâr Fantasy. Issue 12 also looks at the genre and use of Science Fiction in RPG. We also have a description and overview of one of Hungary's earliest original RPGs, M.A.G.U.S.

199294.name: Thunder in the Glens: The Jacobite Rebellion
199294.description:
From the introduction:

Thunder in the Glens takes you back to the time of the Jacobite Rebellion, when the Scots followed Bonnie Prince Charlie in his battle for the British throne. You must tread carefully in these troubled times, for your decisions will determine your fate - whether you survive the horrors of war, or whether you die defeated on the battlefield.

199295.name: The Grimoire (Issue 1 - Feb 2004)
199295.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This premier issue has articles on peasanty and serfdom in a Medieval/European style Fantasy world setting. Peasants and Serfs covers issues from the POV of the lower end of the social spectrum as well as character ideas and contacts for PCs rising from the ranks of the common clay. Village Generation covers the design and mapping out of medieval villages including building generation tables and do-it-your-self map tiles. Finally the Town of Alendun describes an entire town with its major sites, shops, politics, and comes with maps of the town and a mage chantry. 32 pages.

199296.name: The Grimoire (Issue 2 - Nov 2005)
199296.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The second issue of the Grimoire gives the reader information on minstrels and harpers, the gypsies of the Mhar world, and the perfect setting to bring all this information to bear in a location called the Crossroads Inn, which includes a number of adventure ideas.

The Grimoire is a quarterly magazine that has just begun, with information which can be used in any fantasy / medieval campaign, and gives readers background information for the upcoming Mhar Fantasy campaign setting.

199297.name: The Grimoire (Issue 3 - Oct 2005)
199297.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The third of the Grimoire series, this issue details life in the big city, as well as in the small towns of the middle ages. It includes ways to map out and breath life into your cities, and has rules for the Courtesan's Guild, using Durine's Guild as an example. Finally, there is Salsbridge Castle, a haunted castle within the setting of Anaeland. The largest of the Grimoire books so far, at 64 pages.

199298.name: The Grimoire (Issue 5 - Mar 2007)
199298.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

A look at the nobility class and knighthood as they apply to Durine, as well as an examination of the heraldry and its prestigious colleges found throughout Durine. Also includes background and options for creating noble, knightly and herald characters. This issue also takes a look at Listerham, a modest keep known for its great fair and tournament as much as for it's inn built in the branches of a gigantic oak.

199299.name: The Last Invasion: 1066
199299.description:
From the introduction:

The Last Invasion takes you back to the time of the Battle of Hastings, when William of Normandy and his army crossed the Channel and faced the English army led by King Harold. You may choose which side to support, whether to stand by King Harold or to throw your lot in with the Norman invaders. Your decisions will determine your fate - whether you succeed in your chosen course, or whether you die defeated on the battlefield.

User summary:

Also published as La Dernière Invasion (French), Invasion der Normannen (German), Den Sidste Invasion 1066 (Danish), and L'Ultima Invasione: 1066 (Italian).

199300.name: Space Miners
199300.description:
This is a Micro-game with 18 cards some cubes and some dices!

In the game each player control their pack of robotic miners and send them to planet to work and back with resources ( The Victory Points ).

This game is a simple and eficient Area Control, Action Select and Dice Selection in a small package.

Each round consists of two phases. The first is to roll and select, the first in turn rolls the dice and select 3 of them for you and passes the rest to the next player. In the second phase the players used the dice selected to prepare actions in the mother ship and / or send your miners to planets paying the landing value so that the miner can land on the planet that will mining until there is the scoring event that calls the miners back to the player.


Game Components


18 Cards
13 six-faced dices
24 cubes ( 6 of each color )

199301.name: Reiner Knizia's The Confrontation
199301.description:
A turn-based strategy game pitting two players of Light and Shadow against each other with asymmetric forces and hidden units.

For Light to be victorious, the player must sneak the Prince to the Shadow Stronghold. Shadow, on the other hand, is tasked with finding and defeating the Prince (Or moving 3 characters into the Light Capital).

Like many of Reiner’s designs, The Confrontation can be played casually between beginners or as deeply as master level chess: it’s up to you and your opponents!

GAME FEATURES

- Solo play versus multiple AI opponents.
- Realtime online multiplayer.

Source: the Publisher; offworldgames

199302.name: OfficeDungeon: The Quest for Promotion
199302.description:
OfficeDungeon is a card RPG for 2 to 4 players taking a humorous poke at the stereotypical office environment. Choose one of four Heroes and collect Promotion Points to crawl your way to the promotion you've always wanted. But be careful! Your co-workers and Bosses will want to knock you down a peg.

The main goal of the game is to have the most Promotion Points (PP) after either the defeat of the required number of Bosses or when the deck has been played through once. PP has another purpose, however: it is also player's currency, allowing them to purchase equipment, items, and companion creatures to boost their stats and stand a chance against whatever stands in their way.

Players choose their Hero Card at the beginning of the game, each representing an entry level position in the Office. From there, they encounter creatures, loot, and the dreaded Instant cards as they work their way through the 90-card deck. A simple, stat-based combat system and the ability to make your own shady backroom deals between players facilitate quick, competitive play.

199303.name: Los caminos de Alicia
199303.description:
Inspired on Lewis Carrol's 'Alice in Wonderland'.

Players have to build roads using hexagonal tiles, move their figures across them and interact with the scenes and characters from the book in order to complete their goals.

199304.name: Tailslap (Issue 1 - May 2010)
199304.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Tailslap is a new 4th edition magazine of articles detailing new characters, creatures, magic items, encounters, spells, powers, rituals, plot hooks, adventure seeds, playable classes, races, campaign settings and area descriptions for use in your games. We also like to mix in cool little details and intriguing features that will enrich your game world.

These features are intended to be ready for you, be you player or gamemaster, to drop into your games as you see fit. In addition, many of these articles will combine to form complete adventures and campaigns that you can play. We work hard to make this material as easy to use as it is fantastic, and we hope that you enjoy using it in your games. To this end Tailslap is formatted in landscape for easy online reading.

The inaugural issue of Tailslap contains the following articles:

Vault of the Clay Medusa - a trap-filled encounter by Save Versus Death's Scott A Murray
Player's Corner - new feats and a new playable race
Wizard Paths and Powers - two new paragon paths for arcane casters
The Lair of Jurgen the Learned - an encounter where solving puzzles gives access to a knowledgeable sage
The Lands of Soralia - geography and history of a large region for use in your campaigns
People of Soralia - NPCs with stats, backgrounds and suggestions for use in your games
Leviathans & Other Aquatic Terrors - new aquatic monsters for players to conquer
All That Glitters - powerful magical treasure for your hordes
Mundane Equipment - new equipment for players to wield against their foes

199305.name: LARP World Magazine (Vol 2, Issue 1 - Winter 2016)
199305.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

LARP WORLD MAGAZINE - Volume 2, Issue 1 2016

Information, tips, tricks, interviews, and in-depth coverage of many different aspects of live action role playing around the world (in English).

199306.name: Tales From The Table Top (Issue 1 - Jan 2007)
199306.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

TALES FROM THE TABLE TOP
Volume One: Goblins

Tales from the Table Top is a monthly ezine from members of the Table Top Community Website. The focus of this issue is goblins, inside this 20 page book you will find;

A new tribe of goblins called the Goblins of Walkin Grove.
A clerical domain for goblins.
New goblin artifacts
Goblin feats
A new prestige class called the Pyrotechnician
Loot from the Table Top, a section filled with new equipment, spells, and monsters

199307.name: Birds of a Feather: Undomesticated Owl Bear Promo
199307.description:
Promo card from 2016 Table Top Day.

The Undomesticated Owl Bear has an appetite for eggs, but is easily confused. Try to spot this mysterious creature!

Setup: Place this card to the side. Right now, no one controls the Owl Bear.

Each Round: After revealing cards, count the egg cards played this round. If zero or two or more players played an egg card, the Owl Bear is confused and doesn't move.
If one player played an egg card, and she didn't already control the Owl Bear, she gains control of it! She can immediately mark one uncommon spot from any habitat. Place this card in front of her.

199309.description:
Pathogenesis is a deck building game in which players take the role of bacterial pathogens attacking the human body. 

The game was developed in partnership with scientific illustrator somersault1824. The game is based on 100% real science and the mechanics were created to mimic how real biology works.

Avid deck builder players will feel at home playing the game as the mechanic foundation was based on several popular deck builders. The mechanics have evolved and mutated during the creation into a game that is quite its own.

The game offers several modes of play including solo play, cooperative, competitive, and team play.

No knowledge of science is required to play but it was developed to enhance the learning of the immune system at the college level.
199309.name: Pathogenesis

199310.description:
Naqala is now a prosperous place. Gaining the favors of the different tribes was not easy, and your rivals have not been discouraged by your success. In fact, some tribes have now abandoned your cause and rallied to your rivals instead, and you'll soon discover that these tribes follow influential leaders that your rivals hired against you. Every man has his price, though, so perhaps you can return the favor to your rivals — should you have what it takes to recruit the thieves of Naqala.

Five Tribes: The Thieves of Naqala is a mini-expansion of six thief cards and one new djinn for Five Tribes that introduces a new element to the base game to create a real thorn in your opponents' sides. The djinn is shuffled into the deck with the other djinns and protects you from the effects of thieves. One thief card is revealed at random at the start of the game, and whenever someone would buy a djinn, they can purchase the thief card for the same price as the djinn. Each thief is associated with one of the tribes, and whenever you take an action with that tribe, you can choose to activate and discard the thief. If you do, everyone else must get rid of something — two resource cards, one tile they control, even a djinn or palace — after which you get to choose to keep something from all the discarded things.
199310.name: Five Tribes: The Thieves of Naqala

199311.name: Truth and Lies (Second Edition)
199311.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sharpest Blades...

Only a thin line exists between truth and lies, both powerful weapons if wielded with finesse and fearlessness. We cut our enemies down with our words, our ideals and our finely sharpened weapons. Never look back and stay true to your creed, no matter the evil you may bring upon others.

Cut as Deep As the Soul

Truth and Lies 2nd Edition is the second clan sourcebook for The Ninja Crusade 2nd Edition. Learn more about the unforgiving Metal-Aspected clans: The Will of Iron, who travel the world enacting true justice, and the Hidden Strands of Fate, mysterious betrayers with a strange hold on noble ninja. Few dare to peek behind the veil to these clans’ true natures. Will you take that challenge?

This Book Includes:

In-depth look at the territory, training methods and mysteries behind the Sheriffs and Strands
Brand new jutsu, Fighting Styles (Deer and Silkworm)and even Celestial Animals to bring into your game
Two new clans ready to face the Ninja Crusade
New Adventure included
7 new Pregenerated characters ready to jump into the action!

199312.name: Croak Hollow
199312.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Horrific Adventure for a Party of four to six characters of 4th-6th Level for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons.

The once cheery rustic village of Stilt has fallen into a pall of gloom and only a brave band of adventurers can try to set things right, though they might find not all horrors can be undone.
The players will battle the mad forces of the Cult of Byatis and be confronted by a horrible plague they themselves may be corrupted with!

199313.name: Maze of Mandoon
199313.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maze of Mandoon is an otherwordly old school adventure for 4-6 players levels 3rd-5th. 1-2 sessions worth of old school rpg entertaiment. Includes new magic items and monsters. Learn about Baphomet's minions the Beast Folk or a creation of his priests the Animated Altar. Also we've added glow stones, Great Club of Bloody Brambles, and the Ring of Hork.

199314.name: Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever

videogameversion.310058: North American Game Boy Advance edition

199314.description:
"Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever is the second video game based on the film Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever. Like its predecessor, Ecks vs. Sever, it is a first-person shooter on the Game Boy Advance.

The sequel was considered better than Ecks vs. Sever, but received lower reviews because it was released later in the Game Boy Advance life cycle."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballistic%3A_Ecks_vs._Sever_%28video_game%29 Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199315.name: Vampires
199315.description:
From publisher blurb:

"THE BLOOD IS LIFE... AND IT SHALL BE MINE!"

Monster, Monster is a series of releases from NUELOW Games presenting monsters for the Fifth Edition of the world's best-known roleplaying game, together with comics and adventure seeds. In this volume, game designer Andrew Pavlides (with an assist from Steve Miller) brings us varations on vampires, while artist Pablo Macros illustrates two bizarre tales from scripts by Ed Fedory.

In addition to the comics, vampire variations, and adventure seed, Monster, Monster: Vampires offers a table for randomizing certain vampire abilities, so DMs can make thse challenging foes even more unpredictable.

199316.name: Tower of Skulls (DCC)

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

199316.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dangerous cancer lurks in the shadowy crevasses of the land, spreading death and misery like a weed chokes the life out of a garden. Its foul presence spoils the natural order, creating pestilent beasts that stalk the unwary and grim hauntings to terrify the brave. It is known as the Tower of Skulls, an unholy site that rises from pitch-black soil, and it always hungers for fresh life.

BF1 Tower of Skulls is a Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module filled with horror, darkness, undead, and nightmarish plants. It has been designed for a party of four to six level 6 or 7 characters. This adventure presents a twisted, evil dungeon for a party of adventurer’s to explore and hopefully destroy, though in doing so they unwittingly release an imprisoned evil back to the world.

Inside this insidious site are the pits and perils of the imprisoned Demon Lord of Graveyards, where you will find among its rooms and levels ...

... a frost giant zombie covered in brown mold ready to strike down intruders ...
... bone golems ready to tip hanging cauldrons of dangerous liquid onto opponents ...
... a domed chamber filled with blowing snow, yetis, and an undead druid ...
... a garden of unusually magical and potent berries guarded by shambling graveyards ...
... a titanic mushroom beneath which dance demonic mushroom men spreading their vile disease ...
... new magic items tied to the Demon Lord of Graveyards ...
... and so much more!

199317.name: System Shock Behir
199317.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Mindblast! Villains Augmented. This is a series of psionic supplements de-signed to help you run games using the rules from Psionics Unleashed by Dreamscarred Press.

This product aims to give you a monsters with a psionic flair with a single, detailed nemesis for cheap. Everything you need to use these monsters is included here.

Presented here is the monstrous creature: The System Shock Behir!

199318.name: 17 Ghosts

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

199318.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: 17 Ghosts

Hey, when you're adventuring in a magical realm, you're going to kill people, or at least people will be killed. That will probably mean they'll come back as ghosts. Rather than make up some stats yourself, take this deck and grab one for easy GMing!

199319.name: Playable Monsters for Fifth Edition
199319.description:
From publisher blurb:

16 new monstrous races for Fifth Edition!

Have you ever wanted to try your hand at a more exotic option than dwarf or halfling? Have you ever gotten your wish to play as a monster, only for their society to be lacking interesting cultural details beyond the familiar “kill or be killed” write-up? Have you ever worried that a monstrous PC would end up overshadowing the other players with abilities far too powerful for standard adventuring parties?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then Playable Monsters is the answer to your prayers!

Play as a Giant, a mighty descendant of a fallen empire!
Be a Medusa, a transformed humanoid whose gaze can cause deadly petrification!
Try your hand as a Naga, a spirit guardian of ley lines and extraplanar prisons
Take the role of a Vampire, a powerful yet cursed undead being with peerless predatory abilities




And much, much more!

You've GMed them, you fought them, now it's time to play as them in the Fifth Edition of the world's oldest tabletop role-playing game! Grab Playable Monsters if you want fun, versatile options your gaming group is sure to enjoy!

199320.name: Quantum Collapse
199320.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if there were parallel universes endlessly stacked upon each other like pages in a book? What if there were millions of versions of you, spread out through the multiverse? What if someone figured out how to make you more powerful... by eliminating those parallel “yous”? Welcome to QUANTUM COLLAPSE, a new table-top roleplaying setting built on the Mutants & Masterminds 3rd Edition rules system. In QUANTUM COLLAPSE players will be portraying super-powered heroes in a world just discovering the ability to explore and manipulate the power of the multiverse. QUANTUM COLLAPSE brings the power of the multiverse to your gaming table, but be careful! Somwhere in the multiverse, your hero is on someone's hit list... maybe even his own!

199321.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 19 - Jun 2015)
199321.description:
From publisher blurb:

This brand new Chimeric Variant system allows you to create chimeras beyond the Greek archetypal dragon, lion, and goat, and adds nearly 20 new aspects including the yeti, aboleth, spider, golem, and cobra. Additionally, two new spells allow casters to engage in the practice of chimeric fusion.

199322.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 20 - Jul 2015)
199322.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this article, find rules for harvesting ingredients, ranging from the organs of defeated creatures to the essence of elementals; and details on trading exotic ingredients with essence vials. Plus six sample ingredients, from dragon bone and ifrit blood to phoenix ashes and salamander horn.

199323.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 22 - Jul 2015)
199323.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet the Oracles of Industry and of Lost Omens in this Pathfinder RPG article by Carl Cramér. These new mysteries add new slants to the Oracle. The mystery of Industry is one of fire and iron; a vision of a mechanical world. The mystery of Lost Omens deals with an age without prophecy where Oracles defy fate at every turn.

199324.name: Deadline (1996)
199324.description:
User Summary

Real time strategy game in which you control a counter terrorist squad attempting to rescue hostages and neutralise various threats in different missions. You can research each situation or the bad guys involved, or even negotiate with the terrorists to try and reach a more peaceful conclusion. There's also a time limit associated with each mission, so you'll need to act quickly.

199325.name: Hybrid (1997)
199325.description:
User Summary

First person shooter set in a post-apocalyptic world overseen by corrupt governmental forces and aliens. You play as one of four selectable characters, each with their own agenda, fighting various enemies to accomplish their goals.

199326.name: Big Time Tennis
199326.description:
Introduction



It’s the Wimbledon finals, and you’re facing off against an opponent that’s every bit your equal. Will you play your best, smartest game? Know when to play aggressively? Keep momentum and use your entire bag of tricks to win the match? Big Time Tennis is the only board game that plays like real tennis. You’ll experience long volleys, dribblers off the net, service aces, fatigue-- and hit great lobs and other strokes. You’ll even be able to challenge the referee’s calls!

Object of the Game

======

Use your skills, wits and a little luck to win the match and become the champion of Wimbledon!

Components



1 Game Board
1 7-Point Tiebreaker board
1 Scoreboard
1 10-sided Die
16 Action cards (2 sets)
48 Momentum cards
8 Player markers (4 gold, 4 silver)
1 Tennis Ball token
1 Momentum marker (double-sided)
1 Advantage marker
1 At-the-Net token

(I only rate my own games so they'll appear in user searches.)

199327.name: A Letter from Yuggoth (Issue 1 - Mar 2016)
199327.description:
A Letter from Yuggoth
Issue 1
March 2016

Lovecraftian Role-Playing 'Zine

"A Song for the Devil"

199328.name: A Letter from Yuggoth (Issue 2 - May 2016)
199328.description:
A Letter from Yuggoth
Issue 2
May 2016

Lovecraftian Role-Playing 'zine

"The Drifting House"

199329.description:
This is the first expansion for the game Xia: Legends of a Drift System.

In its meandering across the galaxy, the drift system of Xia has come into orbit with a dying star. Once habitable worlds now sit desolate waiting to be ransacked by opportunists, and an unknown cold fills the void. New dangers, hidden treasure, and adventure await in this abandoned system. Uncover the mystery in: Embers of a Forsaken Star

This expansion adds:

New Sector tiles
New Mission cards
New Ships
A solo campaign
And much more!
199329.name: Xia: Embers of a Forsaken Star

82222.name: Xia: Legends of a Drift System

199330.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 23 - Jul 2015)
199330.description:
From publisher blurb:

From Daniel Marshall come Pathfinder RPG spells, magic items, hazards, a new monster, and an undersea encounter table. Cast steamspray, use the ring of the triton, fight a Sahuagin Lieutenant, or navigate steam vents and coral reefs.

199331.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 24 - Aug 2015)
199331.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expand Pathfinder's Handle Animal rules! This article presents racial affinities for different animals, and the ways in which different types of creature respond to domestication. Additionally, author Carl Cramér includes a new regional trait and the Expert Trainer feat to round out any animal trainer's resume!

199332.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 26 - Aug 2015)
199332.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Order of the Wolf, and the Circle of the Whistling Oak are two brand new druidic circles for your Pathfinder game. Complete with alternate class abilities and six new druidic spells, these player options focus on animals and on woodland battle, respectively.

199333.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 28 - Sep 2015)
199333.description:
From publisher blurb:

12 new divination spells for your Pathfinder game designed to address practical problems - from magic mapping to incidental armor, animal spy to trial by fire, and more!

199334.name: A Still Moment in Nature
199334.description:
From the introduction:

Each player takes turns choosing one character and describing a short scene, or exchange, and developing the story. Either player can take control of either character on their turn regardless of previous events.

User summary:

The game was designed to be simple enough for an entirely inexperienced player to successfully complete the scenario. There are few definitive rules. When the narrative reaches a critical point, resolution options are selected by a simple die roll.

199335.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 29 - Sep 2015)
199335.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the second article on the galem builder archetype for the summoner class (originally introduced in TRAILseeker #14), Carl Cramér brings us brass, flesh, ice, iron, stone, and wood galems for your Pathfinder game.

199336.name: Onechanbara Z2 Chaos
199336.description:
OneeChanbara Z2 is a 2014 Action–Hack and slash video game developed by Tamsoft, as part of the OneeChanbara series. It is the sequel to the Japan-exclusive Xbox 360 title OneeChanbara Z ~ Kagura ~ (which was later re-released for Playstation 3 in 2013), and the first game in the series to be localized since OneChanbara: Bikini Zombie Slayers and Onechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad in 2009.

Source: Wikipedia, "Onechanbara Z2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199337.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 31 - Sep 2015)
199337.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ki isn't just for monks - these new Pathfinder Roleplaying Game archetypes allow swashbucklers, rangers, paladins, and fighters access their inner ki in the form of the dojo slayer, mystic weaponsmith, spirit hunter, and youxia, along with four new feats and a selection of new ki powers.

199338.name: After These Messages (Issue 1 - Jul 2003)

rpg.714: Cartoon Action Hour (Season One & Two Editions)

199338.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This is the premiere issue of the official Cartoon Action Hour e-magazine. This double-sized, 45-page blockbuster features loads of material for players and GMs alike.


A complete series called "Galactic Heroes" -- including full stats for Kargorr himself!
Making more dynamic heroes!
Translating your favorite cartoon characters to CAH!
Space Combat rules!
A sneak peek at the CAH hardcopy edition!
Much, much more!

199339.name: After These Messages (Issue 2 - Feb 2004)

rpg.714: Cartoon Action Hour (Season One & Two Editions)

199339.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The second power-packed issue of the official Cartoon Action Hour e-magazine provides players and GMs with a lot of new material.

1) A full-blown treatment for The Outlaws of Skull Gulch, a sci-fi western series that was briefly covered in the CAH rulebook!

2) An optional character creation system primarily for the Outlaws of Skull Gulch, though it can be tweaked for use with other series as well!

3) Remember all the Transformers knock-off toys from the '80s? Well, guess what? The Transbots spawned imitators too... and we've gathered a handful of them in this issue!

4) A massive collection of stats for typical ground vehicles! From sleek sportscars to hulking 18-wheelers, this article has it all!

5) The second installment of Eddy Webb's "Behind the Screen" column for Game Masters. This time out, Eddy discusses the Three-Act model used by most of the cartoons of the '80s and gives ideas for incorporating it into your episode design!

199340.name: Dream (2015)
199340.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light, free-form game play characters in another game, playing characters in another game, and so forth. The level of meta-nesting utilized is not specified - like most other aspects of the game, the intentional vagueness yields the dreamlike, fuzzy narrative the game intends to produce.

Most of the game discussion apparently is intended to focus on the game rules for the various games-within-games.

199342.name: Autopsy (Issue 1 - Apr 2005)
199342.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The first issue of an every-so-oftenly PDF magazine examining controversial topics. This issue, sex and RPGs are explored in a variety of articles.

199343.name: Autopsy (Issue 2 - Oct 2005)
199343.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Issue 2 of Postmortem Studios' every-so-oftenly magazine. This issue tackles drugs, both in and out of play. This issue also includes coupons for money off Postmortem Studios products! (Valid until December 31st 2005).

199344.name: Autopsy (Issue 3 - Jul 2011)
199344.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The third themed Autopsy magazine, this one on violence in RPGs. This is the last themed format and from now on Autopsy will change into more of a general support magazine for the games that we support and all at the new price.

This issue also contains vouchers for $3 off Agents of SWING and Tough Justice valid until 7th August 2011.

199345.name: Autopsy (Issue 4 - Jan 2012)
199345.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The New-Look Autopsy. Cleaned up and expanded blog articles, support and other material for a variety of games in a more screen/tablet friendly format.

This issue:

Shadow World: Cantrip Comprehensive, The Ourobowrong,
'45: Psychobilly Retropocalypse: The Pukes of Dannger
4E: Groin Weasels
Blood!: Tips/errata
Pathfinder: Flenser Swarm
Invaderz!
Grim's Tales
'Beta Planet' *Nudge, wink*

199346.name: WereDragon Magazine (Issue 1 - Oct 2008)
199346.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This, the inaugural issue of WereDragon Magazine, promises to be chock full of useful articles and fun adventures. We have an adventure with a mad wizard named Mog. A super adventure involving creepy puppets, and more. There is also a wonderful article that any player having trouble with character backgrounds will find extremely useful and those that don't might get a few new ideas. Our pages are also graced with wonderful art and some great comics. We also have a Gen Con and a virtual gaming table review for you as well. All of these, plus some things you might not expect to see in a gaming magazine are waiting for you in this issue!

199347.name: A Traveler's Handbook
199347.description:
From the introduction:

This game is about telling the story together [and does not use] a traditional game master. A scene is like a part of a movie - sometimes they are long, sometimes they are short. Setting up and cutting scenes keeps [the game focused], and allows the players to skip parts that they find boring to play.

User summary:

All setup for the game is performed collaboratively. After setup, play rotates through the players with each player gaining narrative focus when they are the "scene owner". The game does not provide any rules for determining outcomes should a narrative impasse develop.

199348.name: Word of Hashut (Issue 1 - Summer 2008)
199348.description:
From the introduction:

Hello all and welcome to the inaugural issue of Chaos Dwarf online’s “The Word of Hashut”, our very own, quarterly webzine focusing on all aspects of the hobby as it relates to Chaos Dwarfs.
If you feel as I do that Chaos Dwarf Online is one of the best (if not the best) Warhammer site on the web today, then this is just another expression of that fact. However, his webzine will not go very far if it is not populated with great articles, awesome artwork, and other contributions from you ,the members of CDO. So get busy and start sending in those submissions!

199349.name: HyperScan Cards
199349.description:
User Summary

Each game requires cards to work, which much be purchased separately for $14.99 per booster pack of 6 cards. Games retailed for $24.99 and included the game disc, a manual, and a booster pack. Seven titles were planned but only five were ever released. Avatar: The Last Airbender and Nickelodeon Sports were the two that never made it.

It used radio frequency identification (RFID) along with traditional video game technology. The RFID scanner reads and writes to the "cards" which, in turn, activate features in and save data from the game. The RFID tag silicon for the contactless game cards, and the RFID tag and reader designs were provided by Innovision Research and Technology.

199350.name: The Colonies Second Edition
199350.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Clement Sector Colonies are located on the cutting edge of civilization in Clement Sector. These worlds are the most recently settled systems and offer a wealth of adventuring possibilities for your characters. Subsector Sourcebook 5: The Colonies compiles all the action and excitement of our Colonies PDF series including Dade Colonies, Peel Colonies, Superior Colonies and Dawn Colonies.

Visit such worlds as:

Superior - Home to an outcast genetic scientist and his followers. A colony dedicated to creating better humans at any cost!

Sarawak - A religious separatist colony with a strong desire to be left alone. Was this desire so strong that they violated their morals and killed hundreds to maintain their privacy?

Peel - An unstable military dictatorship that is inching toward chaos!

Argos Prime - A world with underground seas and oceans in a maze of caverns where corporate interests and new settlers are clashing with the established colonists. Whose side will your characters take?

Adventure awaits in the new colonies!

199351.name: Connect 4 Twist & Turn
199351.description: Just like the classic game play of Connect 4, but instead of a flat game grid, it is a 5 layer tower - and each layer twists. Players take turns dropping a piece in the tower and then MAY twist any layer exactly one space. By doing so, at least 1 piece typically drops to a different layer adding an extra level of skill to the game. First player to get 4-in-a-row wins.

199352.name: Arcadia Quest: Hoshi
199352.description: Hoshi is a playable hero with a miniature and card for Arcadia Quest and Arcadia Quest: Inferno. She is a kick-starter exclusive character gotten by having backed Arcadia Quest: Inferno and additionally having made the optional purchase for the Arcadia Quest: Fire Dragon expansion.

199353.name: Blacksad: Juego de Rol
199353.description:
La aclamada serie de cómics Blacksad, de Juan Díaz Canales y Juanjo Guarnido, se convierte en juego de rol en este completo manual. Profusamente ilustrado con imágenes de los cómics y escrito por el equipo de Nosolorol Ediciones, Blacksad: Juego de Rol combina un cuidado diseño y un contenido que rebosa información y jugabilidad.

En sus páginas encontrarás todo lo necesario para recrear el universo noir del cómic ganador de un premio Eisner, incluyendo:

Reglas completas, rápidas y sencillas que permiten crear personajes complejos y profundos en cinco minutos y que cubren las trepidantes situaciones que llenan los cómics de Blacksad: acción, persecuciones, seducción y moralidad se recrean en la mecánica de juego llenando tu mesa de emoción y momentos dramáticos.
Valores de juego y biografías de los personajes principales de los cómics para que formen parte de tus historias: conviértete en Blacksad o en el comisario Smirnov y enfréntate a Hans Karup, Ribs y a los agentes Cougar y Coyote.
Abundantes consejos para diseñar y ambientar tus historias de género noir, así como escenarios y personajes secundarios listos para incluir en tus partidas.
Una aventura completa lista para jugar y cuatro más en formato breve que el director de juego puede desarrollar fácilmente, así como diversas semillas de aventura para que nunca te falten ideas.

199354.name: Dragonfly Wings and Starship Engines
199354.description:
User summary:

This unusual and flexible system provides two basic play styles - play with a traditional game master, or play without a game master. In addition, the document provides optional "complication cards" as a print-and-play component that can be integrated into play.

Characters play collaboratively through an iteration of dream stages. During play, the notion of "character" becomes quite fluid. The game proceeds in stages with mechanical changes between each stage. All players either "win" or "lose" together.

199356.name: The King's Curse (Pathfinder)
199356.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trail of the Apprentice is a 5-part mini-campaign, designed for beginners and younger players of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or 5th Edition. Each adventure takes your heroes through one character level, from 1st though 5th. Trail of the Apprentice is part of the Legendary Beginnings line, designed to create exciting adventures suitable for all ages. These modules use simplified stat blocks and other rules adjustments to keep gameplay fun for new players, and contains helpful sidebars that provide advice on how to run RPGs for younger gamers so your whole family can Make Your Game Legendary!

A local sage, Ithamar Ruggles, has asked the PCs to visit the Lord Mayor of Port Fairglade and warn him that someone might try to rob him of a statue, which he calls the White Serpent. Ithamar recently lost the statue’s twin, the Green Serpent, to bandits and believes there is a deeper plot involved. The PCs arrive to find that thieves have already taken the White Serpent from the Lord Mayor’s private family museum. He tasks the PCs with discretely investigating the robbery. But when the nobleman’s museum is robbed a second time, the loss of the statues becomes the least of their worries. The King’s Curse is an adventure for 2nd-level characters.

231770.name: By Order of the Queen: Mini Expansion

199357.description:
By Order of the Queen is a cooperative 2–4 player game with a fantasy role-playing game theme. Players take on the role of one of the Guilds of Tessandor, working together to dispatch Heroes to important quests, to combat monsters and to complete the Queen's Orders themselves.

By Order of the Queen is designed to give players a full fantasy campaign in one 90-120 minute game, by giving players just the highlights of a role-playing adventure.

Players must work together to keep the kingdom from falling apart while trying to complete three Queen's Orders to win the game.
199357.name: By Order of the Queen

199358.name: Switch Galaxy Ultra
199358.description:
Weave your way across the galaxy in story mode, avoiding enemies and obstacles. Collect credits and look out for pickups on the track to obtain the best times. For higher stakes, choose survival mode and see how long you can last with just one life and an infinite track.

Source: The Developer Website.

199359.name: Incursion II: Canadians Against The Galactic Empire
199359.description:
An accident at sea transports the Canadian Research Submarine HMCS Chalk River into intersteller space.

Earth has its first Starship and you are part of that Crew – lost amidst the Million Worlds of a crumbling Galactic Empire.

Both Heroes and Outlaws, the crew must survive across these Strange New Worlds and hope they can find home again.
Canadians Against the Galactic Empire!
INCURSION II is a Role Playing Adventure Module complete in 100 pages. Core Rule System and Polyhedral Dice are not included.

These adventures are compatible with any Modern Science Fiction or Horror Style RPG’s with minor modification.

199360.name: Virtual Dream Era: How the Story Went

rpg.35430: Virtual Dream Era: How the Story Went

199360.description:
From the introduction:

Follow the story of the 4 players, that will be taken down roads and paths that bring an element of chaos and intrigue all at once. As the mysteries unravel, each player will discover their own role in this world, and just what exactly the story has to offer!

User summary:

This game places characters into established positions (who goes where is random) and then uses a series of "Paths" to generate cohesive scenes. All resolution is accomplished through narrative development.

199361.name: Swords & Soldiers II
199361.description:
Swords & Soldiers II is a 2D sidescrolling strategy game exclusively available on the eShop for Nintendo Wii U.

Follow Viking Chieftain Redbeard in an adventure that takes him across the globe (from the snowy peaks of Redbeard’s homeland to the Netherworld and the even more demonic party island Barbeardos), and pits him against the all-new Demon Horde and Persian Army factions.

The world needs some serious savin’, and it looks like the meatloving Redbeard and his local Kebab salesman Al’Yucaneet have an important part to play in events to come.

With Swords & Soldiers II, Ronimo Games seeks to create a serious strategy title in a not-so-serious setting. Don't let the cartoony visuals fool you - this is a challenging game, and playing it against other players in the local multiplayer mode will result in some serious competition. For younger players and users looking for a more casual experience, the game comes with an optional 'Easy Mode'.

Source: The Developer Website.

199363.name: Gravity Den
199363.description:
User Summary

This platformer lets you switch the gravity to any of the four sides of the screen so you can navigate around traps and score stars.

199365.name: Bible Battles
199365.description:
Conquer one Enemy card held by another player before someone conquers yours (2-4 players).

1)Shuffle 9 Enemy cards and give two to each player (3 if a two player game). Each player places his enemy cards face up in front of him. Remove leftover Enemy cards from the game. Shuffle the rest of the cards and deal 5 to each player. The rest become the draw pile.

2) A player begins his turn by discarding as many cards from his hand as he wishes and places them face down near the draw pile in a discard pile. He takes the same number of cards from the draw pile, always having 5 cards.

3) In time the player tries to collect any 5 that form a set listed on the Enemy cards. Divine Intervention is wild but can only be used once and never on Satan.

4) A soon as a player discards and draws, the next player takes his turn. If a player assembles a victory combination, he places those on the proper Enemy card (owned by an opponent) and declares "The battle is the Lord's" and is the winner.

199366.name: World of Aldrazar
199366.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, friend! Since you're looking at this particular installment for the multiple award-winning HackMaster™ 4th edition roleplaying game, that means you already know the difference between ordinary and epic. You're not ordinary; you're extraordinary. You just need somewhere to prove it. You need a world where men are real men, women are real women, and magic and monsters are as real as your current routine of breakfast cereal and ham sandwiches. Yes, for those of us that slave each day in our cubicle working for the Man; those who would be heroes if it were not for the constraints of reality, we present... World of Aldrazar!

Whether you need to plan your journey to a distant city, map out the most direct path to your enemy's stronghold, or simply want to settle down in your lair and immerse yourself in a study of king and country, this is the book for you! This 86-page codex will guide your quest for ultimate power like a brilliant beacon amidst a coastal storm, and assist your rise above the petty rabble of thieves, quacks and thugs - otherwise known as everyone you've ever met. Yes, this thoroughly researched and finely detailed reference work includes everything you ever wanted to know about the Aldrazar campaign setting (colloquially known as Garweeze Wurld). Here's just a sampling of the inventory of secrets revealed herein:

Detailed information on 33 empires, kingdoms, city-states, and other realms.
Country data for climates, natural resources and hazards, racial and ethnic groups, religions, social alignment, government types, political factions and pressures, and more!
40 pages of detailed atlas maps, with random encounter matrixes and political boundaries.
Gobs of detail on language skill rules, including 45 modern dialects and 14 ancient languages.
Guidelines for tracking the lunar cycles for any of Aldrazar's three moons.
A listing of major holidays your characters might celebrate.
A place name index for easy cross-referencing.
And much, much more!

199367.name: Word of Hashut (Issue 2 - Autumn 2008)
199367.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome my brethren, my fellow Sons of Darkness (and in some cases Daughters), to the second issue of the Word of Hashut. May all the feeble slave races fear our presence and tremble at our dreaded approach. It is I, dread overlord Willmark, (Sometimes known as the Dark Lord of the Sith on the forums). I return to bring tidings of our second issue of the Word of Hashut, the quarterly webzine of CDO.

199368.name: Word of Hashut (Issue 3 - Winter 2009)
199368.description:
From the introduction:

CountArach of the Herdstone forum wrote: “I have to commend you guys for your work. You have no army and no institutional support from GW and yet you consistently prove to be one of the most active and dedicated forums out there”.
2 simple sentences packing in so much of what makes us unique. That, I believe sums up just who and what we are: quite simply one of the most dedicated sites on the web, and perhaps the most dedicated Warhammer site. And there it is, with no help from Games-Workshop, no support from White Dwarf, no support in the way or miniatures, fluff or any
official support of any kind, barring the inclusion of the Hellcannon into the Chaos Mortals list we have managed to create a living, breathing community. Take a bow each and every one of you.

199369.name: Word of Hashut (Issue 4 - Spring 2009)
199369.description:
From the editorial:

Golden Hat VIII... are you kidding me? 28 entries! We blew past the record that Golden Hat V had established. And the winner… it doesn’t get any better than that: STOMP!

199370.name: Word of Hashut (Issue 5 - Summer 2009)
199370.description:
From the editorial:

Word of Hashut Issue #1, one year ago. Where did they time go? It seems like it was just yesterday that I was struggling along trying to get the very first issue off the ground. Back in the first issue the webzine staff consisted of Sojourn and I… and that was it.

199372.name: Retro Rocket Rally
199372.description:
Players race their vintage rocket ships through a random and mostly unexplored galaxy, encountering asteroids, UFOs, wormholes and more as they collect Star bucks to buy fuel and rocket parts. The first one to collect 3 Flags is the winner.

A deck of space cards is drawn dealt out in a conveyor belt system that creates the board as you play. Players must ration their money and fuel cards to avoid calamity. Ship upgrades can be purchased to give them an edge over their opponents. The game is random enough to be challenging without being dependent on the whim of dice.

A light racing and hand management game intended to fill a sweet spot between Sorry! and Merchants of Venus.

199373.name: Word of Hashut (Issue 6 - Autumn 2009)
199373.description:
From the editorial:

Hello again everyone and welcome back to the Word of Hashut, and the sixth issue of our magazine!

It’s been a fun couple of months here at the stronghold of the ezine buried deep in the heart of Zharr Naggrund, but never fear. Although this issue was late (yet again) the slaves have been working hard to make up lost ground. I have been getting buried at both my jobs so trying to find time to work on this has been a challenge.
You’ll notice we took a bit different tact with this issue and went with a more black and white feel, which believe it or not is more difficult to do then previous issues. Its part of what I hinted at last time in terms of trying new design stuff. My thought is why not try out different layouts and see how it looks, there is no harm in it as far as I’m concerned. You the reader may think differently let me know.

199374.description:
I See What You Did There is a game about convincing your friends that you're clever. Convince them by relating the cards using any means of interpretation necessary.

Every card has a word on the top half and a game instruction on the bottom half. Players either use the abilities detailed on the bottom half card (ex: While this card is in play, players must repeat the last word of their sentence sentence) or try to connect 3 of their cards together (ex: Penis, Kindness, STD). Successfully convincing your fellow players that 3 of your cards are connected earns you a stack; first player to 3 stacks wins.

I See What You Did There is NOT responsible for any shenanigans you and your friends get into. (Including prank calls or murder)
199374.name: I See What You Did There

199375.name: Variety!
199375.description:
User summary:

All characters in the game are performers of some sort. Characters have two Attributes, Abandon and Stillness, which provide a potential bonus to action resolution die rolls. Abandon represents raw, creative energy. Stillness represents control and measured focus. During play, characters also track two additional traits - Dream and Nightmare - that reflect their metaphysical progress as a performer.

The game is played in phases called, appropriately, Acts. Additionally, the game document is formatted somewhat like a playbill or script, which is a nice presentation touch.

199376.name: Rally On
199376.description:
Rally On is a rally racing tabletop game that uses a risk and reward dice system to play out events during each rally stage.

Rally On has been a dream of mine for the last five years. I have always been an avid rally and all around race fan. I started to design a game based on what I wanted a table racing game to be and something that I had never played before. Once, I got together with Ben M, the game really started to pick up steam. He brought the same passion I had for making a fun and exciting table top rally game. When we decided to bring on randomly laid out stages every time you play, dice driven events and a driver confidence system really brought the project to life.

Playing a different track varies the game dramatically. Never again will you have to have to play the same board over and over again or are you forced to spend money to buy a new track, just to add variety.
