The confidence system allows the player to push their luck with a smaller risk of an event happening, but the catch is that you only have a limited number of confidence points to start the entire rally with. The points are also carried over stage to stage, so you have to be careful not to use all yours up at the beginning or you won't have any left for later stages. This really helps to determine how hard you want to attack a turn or how fast you want to push your driver. You also get penalties for running out of confidence, so that is always on your mind. There are various ways to regain confidence points and also many ways to lose them. During Event rolls you might gain more back by taking a turn perfectly or lose a point for botching it. At the end of each Stage the players each get four driver points to spend to repair drivetrain or add confidence points. You can also use those to buy more Pace cards. Pace cards are various cards that the players can use to benefit themselves or play against their opponents. There are six, six sided dice that the players use to play out events throughout Rally On. Each die side has a unique symbol that corresponds to an event that could happen to player. Some are good and some are bad. Depending on how hard you are pushing your driver determines how many dice you will be rolling for the event. You could come out a head and gain a few extra movement spaces, shave some time off your current run, damage your car, lose time or wreck. Don't forget you always can use your precious confidence points to re-roll an event die if needed.

The goal of Rally On is to complete each stage of the rally with the least amount of time ticks. It is meant to be played as a three stage rally, but you can do less. At the start of each turn the player decides if they will up shift or downshift their gear. Once that is determined they roll the corresponding gear die. They then move that number of spaces on the stage. Each time the player comes up to a turn tile they have to decide which lane to take the turn in. Each lane has a maximum gear the player can enter in. The player has the option to attack the turn in the inside lane or outside lane. The inside lane is usually safer, but slower. The outside lane will be faster but adds a higher chance of rolling a bad event, due to rolling a higher number of event dice. This makes the outside lane a higher risk and you could potentially take damage, slide, spin off track, lose time or even gain confidence for a perfect turn. At the end of each stage the players tally their time. The player with the least amount of time wins that current stage.

199377.name: Binding Arbitration
199377.description:
Can't we all just get along?

From the introduction:

Two wizards are engaged in a long-running feud. When the player characters rescue one of the spell hurlers, he asks them to help him finish the conflict once and for all. But do the player characters really want to get in the middle of two very angry wizards?

User summary:

An adventure for a party of four characters of 4th level.

199378.name: Spectrubes
199378.description:
User Summary

Move squares onto targets with the caveat that both squares move using the same control but in simultaneous opposite directions. The graphics are retro to the 1970s.

199379.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War III

videogamehonor.36755: 2016 Game Critics Best PC Game of the Year Nominee

199379.description: In a return to the massive battles from Dawn of War I, DoWIII takes the series back to its roots with a base-building RTS that now adds gigantic war machines like the Imperial Knights to the battlefield. New features include DLC and collectible, customizable elite units. In addition to multiplayer and coop modes, players will play a three faction campaign that alternates missions between the player controlling the Space Marines, Orks and Eldar. (Source: User Summary)

199381.name: Jungle Traveller
199381.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jungle Traveller is the first of a trilogy of adventures that will form the West African Campaign for Road to Armageddon.

And like all good Trilogies it may well end up being more than three books … stay tuned for more information!

The three Campaign Books will take the PCs from the period before the outbreak of the Three Way War, possibly continuing on from the Introductory Adventure (Last Light), through the outbreak of major fighting in far away Europe, the Middle East and Asia, and right into the 30 Minute War (the massive Nuclear exchange) and its immediate aftermath.

Jungle Traveller deals with the final preparations for the staging of a second Biafran rebellion, this time with the support of the US and the Western Alliance, in their belief that the Nigerian state is either going to devolve into a failed state or, more likely, break apart and most of it fall under the control of Boko Haram and their Caliphate puppetmasters.

199382.name: Kingsport Festival: The Card Game
199382.description:
Description from the publisher:

"That flaming column was spouting volcanically. The combustion does not lay warmth, but only the clamminess of death and corruption." –"The Festival", H.P. Lovecraft, 1923

In the unimaginable darkness of Kingsport, silent wanderers are called to a profane celebration. Their goal: to invoke unthinkable horrors! A dread terror that is not of this world or any other — but rather from the spaces between the stars — demands your submission. Meanwhile, unwary investigators vainly attempt to halt this appalling chapter in the dark history of Arkham.

As the high priest of one of these shadowy cults in Kingsport Festival: The Card Game, you must dominate the city. You will invoke cosmic creatures and unholy gods to receive their "gifts", but you must take care to preserve your sanity and thwart the investigators who seek to stop you. This time, you are the bad guys. Why settle for the lesser evil?

199383.description:
The "Arte di Calimala" — the guild of cloth finishers and merchants in foreign cloth — was one of the greater guilds of Florence, who arrogated to themselves the civic power of the Republic of Florence during the Late Middle Ages. The woolen cloth trade was the engine that drove the city’s economy and the members of the Calimala were the elite of Florence.

Throughout its long history, the Arte di Calimala supervised the execution of artistic and architectural works. Most Florentine guilds performed such activities, but the Calimala distinguished itself from other guilds through the number and prestige of the projects and the sites administered, including the construction and decoration of some of the major churches of the city.

Players of Calimala are cloth merchants in medieval Florence, with a number of trusted employees that they assign to various streets within the city to carry out actions. (Each street connects two places where particular actions can be taken.) While taking these actions, players produce and deliver cloth and contribute to the construction and decoration of various buildings across the city. Employees stay on their assigned places for a while, carrying out their actions whenever the street is activated, and eventually are promoted into the city council, triggering a scoring phase.

Depending on the number of players, each player has a number of action discs. In turn order, they can put one on a space between two actions, performing both actions and activating all other discs on the same space. When the fourth disc is placed on an action space, the lowest one is promoted to the city council, which triggers a scoring. After the last action disc is placed or the last scoring phase in the council is triggered, the game ends. The positions of the action spaces and sequence of scoring phases vary from game to game, making each game very different. Secret scoring objectives and action cards add uncertainty.
199383.name: Calimala

199384.name: War Torn
199384.description:
In a war torn land, you find yourself trying to start over, but war seems to follow you.

The world has been all but destroyed by war. You are the leader of your people, looking for untouched land that hasn't been destroyed by war. After a long journey you find this new land and you start to build a new home for your people. Other Leaders have the same idea, and the new land breaks out in war.

War Torn is a resource management game with Drafting and Building of your new city. Each player starts with a limited amount of resources to start their new home. Craft your City to match your play style, and be the first player to gain enough Victory Points to claim the land as your own.

Play as unique characters like a Lava Ape - The Fire King, or a Necromancer Crow that raises the dead. In this 2-4 player game you will find yourself building, fighting and deceiving other players to claim the victory.

199385.name: Carrots and Broccoli
199385.description:
Billy and Mandy really want to set up a garden in their backyard. The problem is Billy wants a garden of carrots and Mandy wants a garden of Broccoli. The only way a garden can grow is if all of the plants group together. Otherwise, the weather, animals and other gardeners can destroy the garden. In this war over the garden, there is no compromise, no surrender. You either win or become rabbit food.

This game uses the Looney Pyramids, some dice and a checkerboard to recreate the sense of total victory of your crop surviving while others fail.

Included with the Kickstarter shipment of Pyramid Arcade as one of the twelve bonus Looney Pyramid cards created for $333 level backers.

Number of Players: 2 or 4

Equipment: Timer (optional), 8x8 board, a rainbow stash per player (up to four), a Pyramid die and a Color die

Who Starts: The player who has spent the most time in a garden goes first. If it is a tie, rock-paper-scissors to see who goes first.

Setup: For a two player game, set up the a chessboard with one red trio and one yellow trio on one corner of the board just off the side of the board (they represent the carrots) & one green trio and one blue trio on the opposite corner of the board just off the side of the board (they represent the broccoli). Place the remaining red, yellow, green, and blue pyramids off the board at a neutral corner.

On the diagonal of the board in between the two players, form a line of random black pyramids. One pyramid per space. There should be an empty square at the corners of the board. The black pyramids represent the garden wall. For a four player game, set up the chessboard with each color at a corner just off the board. Form an x of black pyramids in the middle of the board. One pyramid per space. There should be an empty square at the corners of the board.

Each of the open spaces represents a part of the backyard. Place two of the same color trios off each side of the board near the opening of each of the x sections, touching the edge. The remaining trios should be accessible to the other players off the side of the board.

Gameplay: The first player rolls the Color and the Pyramid die. The player selects the pyramid based on the color and size rolled on the dice. If the dice roll shows two pieces, select one of the two pieces. If the dice roll shows the atom (*), select any color. You may place that pyramid any square on the board that does not have a pyramid already. This represents planting the seed in the garden.

If you roll black, you may move one of the black pyramids from the wall that matches the pyramid from the other dice. The black pyramid can only be moved one orthogonal space and must be no more than two squares away from the other black pyramids.

If your roll matches a combination that is already on the board, you may move one of the pyramids one square orthogonally on the board. If there is already a pyramid on that square, a player can not move into that square. If the pyramid was moved by the previous player, it can not be moved this turn.

Winning: During a two player game, the player wins when they have ten of their pyramids in their corner of the chessboard. All of the pieces must be orthogonally touching with one of the pieces in the corner of the board. In addition, all of the pieces must be on the same side of the wall. If a piece in on the wall line, it does not count as being on your side of the wall.

During a four player game, the player wins when they have ten of their pyramids in their side of the yard. All of the pieces must be orthogonally touching. In addition, all of the pieces must be on the same side of the wall. If a piece in on the wall line, it does not count as being on your side of the wall.

199386.name: Princess Sthenia
199386.description:
From publisher blurb:

You Know NOTHING of My Power

An Inphinite, born on a Dynasty Citadel, and sent to Earth as an infant, Princess Sthenia (PL 13) was raised as a child of the gods. She led her people to many victories, but was confronted by Omega, who fought her to a stand-still. Her followers placed her in a sarcophagus in a temple. Unable to use her powers of energy vampirism, Sthenia languished in her tomb for thousands of years.
The Nazi villain, Hauptman Arysh, found her and brought her back to fight with the German Afrika Corps against General Patton’s forces. Opposed by Sea Devil and the American hero, Victory, Sthenia was eventually sealed back into her tomb for good. Or was she ...

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

199387.name: Yet More Horrifically Overpowered Feats
199387.description:
From publisher blurb:

Overpowered is the New Black!

We didn’t want to do this. We ASKED you not to use the Overpowered Feats. We already have FOUR books worth! But did you listen?

No.

So here it is, the FIFTH book in the Horrifically Overpowered line of feat books. You SHOULD NOT use the feats herein. Just the NAME of Cleaving Sneak Attack should convince you not to add it to a campaign. Critical Skull Rupture is just as bad as it sounds. For Pete’s sake Hybrid is like Gestalt, but for races. And DEFINITELY don’t use the new Metagaming category of Horrifically Overpowered feats! PCs are bad enough without receiving help *directly* from their players.

Seriously.

Don’t make us put out a SIXTH book next year!

199388.name: SCRATCH: a flea-bitten game
199388.description:
Scratch is a dexterity/skill game with a hint of strategy, for 1 to 5 players.

The aim of the game is to score points by getting your fleas to jump onto Scratch the dog. You do this by skimming cards through the air to try to land on Scratch's card.

The fleas each have different abilities which can affect the points scored and there are other card types which also effect the game.

All the rules are on the cards themselves.

199389.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 32 - Oct 2015)
199389.description:
From publisher blurb:

John Lynch brings us a new fighter archetype for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Strength and skill at arms are only half the battle; precise and clever tactics and techniques elevate the fighter to new heights. The tactician is a versatile combatant, able to inspire and rally her allies, and use a range of specialized fighting techniques.

199390.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 33 - Oct 2015)
199390.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do Choreomania, Disbelieved, Forthright, Grotesque, Healing Icon, Leper, and Stigmata have in common? They're all new horrific oracle curses for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, just in time for Halloween!

199391.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 36 - Nov 2015)
199391.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flinging a flurry of blades doesn't need to be a sub-optimal Pathfinder RPG character design! Thomas Kyle show you how to make the most out of thrown weapon masters with 7 new feats and a pile of great advice.

199392.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 38 - Nov 2015)
199392.description:
From publisher blurb:

Robert Montano brings us a brand new class for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game which fuses druidic tradition and mechanical artifice. Also introducing the three schools of botanical clockwork - Mechanobiology, Morphic Botanical Clockwork (the "Gearshifters", as they are known), and Verdant Engineering.

199393.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 41 - Dec 2015)
199393.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dark reaches of the world, there are barbarians who channel the dead. Vampire Blood Barbarians feast upon the blood of their foes; Mummy Wraps Barbarians inspire despair; Ghost Soul Barbarians are impossible to pin down; and Zombie Flesh Barbarians don't even notice when you cleave off half their head.

199394.name: Marooned! A solo game of survival
199394.description:
The year is 1743. The sole survivor of a shipwreck, you find yourself washed up on the sands of a small island (a 4 x 4 grid of cards). You set off to explore, hoping to find whatever you need to survive and give yourself the best chance of being rescued should a ship pass by.

Marooned! is a solo PnP game where both sides of the cards are used.

The island is gradually revealed as you explore it by placing the cards. You'll need to combine the different resources you discover to help you survive and hopefully attract the attention of the ships which periodically sail by. The map of the island, the location of items and when events occur will be different each time you play.

199395.name: The King is Dead: Vargr
199395.description:
From the introduction:

In an 18th century that never was, revolution rocks the nation of Malleus! Secret societies of rebels strike to unseat the vampire aristocracy with pen and sword, inciting long-dormant dreams of freedom in their fellow humans while driving stakes through the hearts of their oppressors. Frontiersmen, highlanders, mad scientists, occultists, slaves, and more unite to overthrow the immortal regime!

In Vargr, the heroes join the hunt for a mad killer, only to find he holds the secrets to defeat the vampires. Can they save him from the assassins hunting him? Can they save him from himself? Can they save themselves from the wrath of the vampire overlords?

User summary:

For 4 to 6 seasoned heroes

199396.name: U.S.S. Dragonfly
199396.description:
User summary:

Players in this charming game are divided into two groups. One group has human characters who control an interplanetary spaceship. The rules suggest pairing the most experienced and the least experienced players in this group to allow for a type of game education experience. The remaining players are alien life forms. During play, the spaceship visits two planets and delivers a sort of "sales pitch" to the aliens.

The game uses a large number of simple custom cards, provided as print-and-play components in the game document.

199397.name: Dying Light World Wiki
199397.description:
User summary:

The Dying Light LARP is set on a well-developed world called Nexxus (variably spelled Nexus). The major LARP activities are set in a town called Oasis. This online Wiki contains setting information on several major races and a handful of locales.

199398.name: Dying Light LARP Rulebook
199398.description:
From the introduction:

Live Action Role Play is an immersive and interactive role playing experience. Each person who comes to an event has created a character using the system inside this rulebook. Characteristics like race, skills, and magical abilities are all chosen and put into a character sheet. This is your character on paper, but when you get to game and put on your costume, you take on the role of that character adding flesh and bones to the paper skeleton you have made. Plot is a group of people who are in charge of bringing out extras and opponents called non-player characters. These along with the other people playing characters will advance stories, create intrigue, and of course provide opportunities for combat.

boardgameimplementation.140525: Cards Against Humanity: PAX East 2013 Promo Packs

199399.description:
From the Cards Against Humanity Website:

There's nothing nerds love more than branded references that they can consume. Remember Batman? What about Firefly? Bazinga!

24 white & 6 black cards about video games, D&D, Game of Thrones, and all the other bullshit you like.

Previously released at PAX East & PAX Prime in 2013 & 2014.

Artist's Edition wrapper by Jessica Paoli.
199399.name: Cards Against Humanity: Geek Pack

199401.description:
To replace their deceased lion that reigned supreme in the animal world, the creatures from around the world are organizing a big tournament of gladiators. Who will be the last to stand on its feet? Who will have strong enough shoulders to carry the crown? You? Get your claws ready ... charge!

In Kingz, players battle by playing cards.
199401.name: Kingz

199402.name: Alliance Rulebook (v1.2)
199402.description:
From the introduction:

In Alliance games, a cast of non-player characters are used to set the tone and provide background for the player characters. They often serve important town functions (such as guild leaders or nobility) and otherwise help to propel the plot and action. Much of what happens at an event, however, is completely
decided by the PCs and the actions they take.

We use padded weapons to simulate actual combat, and a magic system that uses "packets" made of fabric and bird seed to represent the hurling of spells. Medieval costuming and armor enhance the atmosphere.

User summary:

Provided revised and incrementally improved rules for the game. This edition also includes a tabletop version of the game which can be played in a traditional tabletop experience.

199403.description: Draw Blood: Remix is exactly that - a remix of the Original Draw Blood, which was a Rummy-style card game. This revisit to the Draw Blood concept, brings back discarded elements from the earlier versions of the game, while also creating a completely new game with cards already familiar to Draw Blood fans. The result is a fast-paced game where players draw and discard their way to an empty hand, laying down a variety of Monsters that can hinder your opponent’s progress. Strategic hand management, card awareness and fun ways to stop Monsters (and your opponent) are the essence of Draw Blood: Remix.
199403.name: Draw Blood: Remix

199404.name: Living Adventures: Casting and Rituals
199404.description:
From the introduction:

There are four primary elements, and an all-consuming force known simply as magic which is associated simply with power, the four primary elements can be combined to create more elements, known as secondary and Tertiary elements.

User summary:

Presents the theory of magic and various spells and rituals usable in the game. This source book also is referred to as the Book of Magic.

199405.name: Living Adventures: Crafting
199405.description:
User summary:

Presents the rules for crafting in-game items, including weapons and magic items. This is not a "how to" makers guide, but enumerates resource in-game costs, durability, and abilities of various ranked items.

For example, Leather Armor requires a certain amount of animal hide as a resource, and a certain amount of in-game time to produce, as well as being available in various ranks.

Includes equipment lists for both mundane and magical items.

199406.name: Living Adventures: Faiwerth
199406.description:
User summary:

Faiwerth is the major setting of the Living Adventures game. It is a "dyson sphere" surrounding a solar and lunar body of uncertain origin. There are universal circadian cycles and universal seasons, generated by the solar body. Both the solar and lunar body shed fragments that are magical in nature.

The calendar, day/night cycles, and seasons all are based on earth's similar properties.

The document provides an overview of the history, economy, and demographic elements of the setting.

199407.name: Living Adventures: Fantasy Rules
199407.description:
From the introduction:

The intent of these rules is to allow structure to a game involving imagination. It should be kept in mind that all players participating are players just like yourself and should be treated with respect and curtesy. Out of game strife should be left out of game and in game strife should remain in game. These rules have been created for a Live Action Role Play game with a focus on Role Play. The goal of the game played by these rules should not be to harm anyone or to become better than, or beat the other players.

199408.name: Living Adventures: Potions and Poisons
199408.description:
User summary:

Presents a color-coded enumeration of potions and poisons available for players in the game world. Potions and poisons are assigned a "Level", with greater effects occurring at higher levels. Vials hold 1/4 to 1 ounce. Potions must be manufactured in-game with an economic cost and time to produce.

Note that poisons are made (in the "real world") with saltwater, giving a rather obvious sign to the imbiber that they've just been poisoned.

199409.name: Living Adventures: Traps
199409.description:
User summary:

Provides a list of traps available for in-game use. Each enumerated trap has a "Level" (higher level traps are more dangerous), a description, an energy and resource cost, and a time to produce. Several traps have distinctive material components. Many of the non-magical traps are focused on tracking or marking the character that sets off the trap. Most of the magical traps cause an in-game effect, such as "Rage" or "Knockout".

199410.description:
From the publisher:

The Hunt for the Golem is a mini-campaign for Frostgrave: Fantasy Wargames in the Frozen City.

Over the course of three scenarios, the wizards and their warbands will learn about the Granite Golem, a unique monster rampaging through the ruins. They will then go on the hunt for the Golem, first to study it, then in an effort to capture or destroy it.

They will also have a chance to find some unique new treasures.
199410.name: Frostgrave: The Hunt for the Golem

199411.description:
From the publisher:

Sellsword is a digital-only mini-expansion for Frostgrave: Fantasy Wargames in the Frozen City. This expansion gives wizards the option to hire a captain, a special type of soldier, to help lead their warbands. Unlike other soldiers in the game, captains may choose their own weapons, have a few special abilities known as 'tricks of the trade', and gain experience. Of course, such experience and versatility comes at a price, so captains are going to want more than the retainer given to most soldiers – they want a cut of the treasure! Also included in this expansion are three new scenarios designed to give soldiers more of a chance to shine. All feature some type of limitation or obstacle to spellcasting that will force wizards to think a bit more about how much they rely on their magic.
199411.name: Frostgrave: Sellsword

199412.description:
From the publisher:

Dark Alchemy is an ebook only mini-expansion for Frostgrave that includes a three-scenario campaign which can be played by either solo by one player or by two players working co-operatively. It also includes an expanded potions table, with numerous new magical elixirs, as well as new rules for the buying, selling, and creation of potions.
199412.name: Frostgrave: Dark Alchemy

199413.description:
From the publisher:

Poor Bloody Infantry: Campaign Expansion provides more scenarios, more rules, more counters, and more ways to enjoy the standard PBI system. Fully compatible with PBI: Somme. In fact, you must own PBI: Somme to use this expansion. Here's what's included...

You get an eight-page illustrated rule booklet that contains seven additional historical scenarios; two new counter sheets with more men, more markers, and two new counter types (Captains and Shell Holes); a Reference Card; and additional optional rules (such as Heavy Mud, Variable Reshuffling, and new rules for shell holes, among others). There is also a grand campaign game, utilizing 14 of the scenarios linked together, as well as a Company Game (play a single scenario four times, one per platoon in your company). There are enough individual soldiers--using men from this expansion, along with those from PBI: Somme--to form an entire company of 180 individual soldiers (with men left to spare). Finally, notes about British Army organization in 1916, and a section devoted to Battle Plans and Combat Details provide you with background information to help bring the game (and history) alive.

With this expansion, you will have scenarios covering each of the fourteen British divisions involved on the first day of the Big Push. To quote from the Designer's Notes: "After years of contemplating this offensive, I still cannot come to grips with this, largely, citizen army making such a frontal assault into the face of an entrenched defender possessing modern weaponry. If PBI helps bring the magnitude of the staggering losses of July 1st home to you, it will have achieved one of my design goals."
199413.name: Poor Bloody Infantry: Somme – Campaign Expansion

199414.name: X-Card
199414.description:
Author summary
The X-Card is an optional tool that allows anyone in your game (including you) to edit out any content anyone is uncomfortable with as you play.
Since most RPGs are improvisational and we won't know what will happen till it happens, it's possible the game will go in a direction people don't want. An X-Card is a simple tool to fix problems as they arise.

"X-Card" tags on RPGGeek

199416.name: Treehouse Dreams
199416.description:
Designer Summary

Treehouse Dreams is a card game about imagining a giant, impossible treehouse built together by the people playing the game. Each card represents a room or feature in this treehouse, and they all contain elements of who you are and the connections between you and the other players. The game is designed to ask simple questions that can reveal the deeper (or sometimes funnier) elements of who we are.

Play with people you already know, but want to know better.

User summary of play
Depending on the length of game desired, 10-20 cards are dealt among the players and everyone arranges them into a central 'tree' shape.

Taking turns, players flip cards - revealing new rooms in the treehouse and questions for the current player or all to answer. This is a storytelling game without objective win conditions.; play continues until all the players agree that the treehouse is done or all cards on the table have been revealed and answered.

199418.name: Skeptics
199418.description:
Ghost hunting game where one to four paranormal investigators try to convince and prove to the town SKEPTICS that a ghost haunts a specific Environment.

Roll dice to unlock doors and match symbols on the game board, which if successful, reveals clue cards. Each Clue card has to be solved which will lead one step closer to revealing the Ghost.

Investigators have 6 hours to prove the Ghost exists and claim their evidence. Environment Cards are drawn every hour which may have hazards and conditions that will try to impede the players progress.

199419.name: Mage: The Awakening Second Edition
199419.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is a Lie.

Humanity is cursed into a prison of Sleep, ignorant of the wonder and danger all around them. Ground down into slavery to masters they’ll never see, beset by a plague of cares to distract them from the Truth.

Magic.

You were like them, once, but now you are Awakened. You see the world beneath the Lie’s skin, and the Mysteries beckoning you into the shadows. Every day of your life, you hear the call of the supernatural, from the least ghost to the deepest cosmic enigmas.

You are a mage, one of the Wise. You see, know, and explore what others can’t imagine, from the depths of the human soul to the hidden corners of reality. Armed with your spells, driven by an addiction to Mysteries, you delve into the secrets of the world. Knowledge has a price, and the dangers are many.

This book contains:

The complete guide to playing a mage in the Chronicles of Darkness.
Reimagined Paths, Orders, and powers to create your Awakened characters and their allies, including an updated version of the most comprehensive free-form magic system in gaming.
Five example settings across the world, from Los Angeles to Salamanca, each with a central Mystery.
A brand-new look at all the strange places of the Fallen World, from the Lower Depths to the Emanation Realms, and what mages might find within.

199420.name: Vietnam ‘65
199420.description:
As a US Army commander, you will need to wage a counter-insurgency war to secure the la Drang valley which borders Cambodia.

Win the Hearts and Minds of the local population by locating and destroying the Vietcong insurgents who infiltrate the Ho Chi Minh trail with the aim to destabilise the province through intimidation of the locals, laying of mines and military ambushes.

The well trained North Vietnamese Army, operating from across the border, are also aiming to take control of the valley and will support the insurgency and launch an offensive when the time is right.

In order to carry out your mission, coordination of your ground troops, special forces, artillery, mechanised units, training of local forces, and air-mobile assets is essential however the war cannot be won without the support of the local population as well as the American people.

This is a game that captures the true essence of the Vietnam War, where airmobile operations are paramount, fire support bases play a critical role and air strikes can save the day.

Rise through the ranks and watch your personalized uniform transform from a junior Lieutenant to General as you relive the Vietnam War.

Source: The Developer Website.

199421.name: Legions of Steel
199421.description:
The Empire of the Machines is threatening the entire universe.
The League of Aliens and the U.N.E. (United Nations of Earth) have banded together to defend the galaxy from the invaders. Battles are raging everywhere, but it is inside the twisting corridors of the Machines' underground production facilities that the tactical upper hand is seized and the war is won.

Originally designed by Clark Browning, Marco Pecota and Derrick Villeneuve, Legions of Steel is a tactical board game where players fight battles in a dark and dangerous environment. French Developer Studio Nyx have managed to re-create the deep and challenging set of rules, while adding slick 3D models, a clever and accessible UI and a lot of new features.

Source: The Publisher Website.

199422.name: Meeple Monthly (Issue 39 - Mar 2016)
199422.description:
Meeple Monthly
Issue 39
March 2016


Renegade's Secret Potion Society
The Rise of New Armies in War of the Ring
Fireside's Here, Kitty, Kitty
Level 7 [Omega Protocol]: Extreme Prejudice
Happy Pigs!

199425.name: Meeple Monthly (Issue 40 - Apr 2016)

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

199425.description:
Meeple Monthly
Issue 40
April 2016


The Creation of Yashima
Designing Mad Libs: The Game
The Story of WarQuest
Eminent Domain: Battlecruisers

199426.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 195 - May 2016)

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

199426.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 195
May 2016


Agricola
Forge a legacy in ancient Egypt in Asmodee's Ra
Get list in River Horse's board game adaptation of Jim Henson's Labyrinth

199427.name: Takotsubo!!

boardgameversion.310230: Japanese 2016 "Reprint" edition (タコツボ 復刻版)

199427.description:
User summary
タコツボ (Takotsubo!!), themed on sea creatures, is an abstract game similar to Chess, Checkers and Shogi. You win the game by catching your opponent's Octopus piece or moving your Octopus into the trap pot (Takotsubo). Like checkers, catch your opponent's pieces by jumping over them. Try to come up with a clever tactic to lure and catch your opponent's Octopus.

This game was originally designed with its illustration in 1996 by Kohei Higashi, a former Japanese Chess champion and Shogi journalist, when he was 60. After twenty years, in 2016, it was reissued with the artwork by Maiko Fujita. The re-issue is called タコツボ 復刻版, meaning "Takotsubo!! Reprint".

Publisher's summary
海の生き物たちによる、チェス・チェッカー・将棋に似たアブストラクトゲーム。相手のタコをつかまえるか、自分のタコがタコツボに入れば勝ち。生き物はチェッカーのように飛び越せるときは必ず相手を飛び越してつかまえなくてはいけない。うまくおびきよせて、タコをつかまえるには？
1996年、チェス元日本代表で、将棋記者の東公平が日本に将棋やチェスの楽しさを伝えられるように60歳のときに考案・イラストデザインしたゲーム。20年後の2016年に、ふじたまいこのアートワークでリニューアル出版した。"

199428.name: The Wastelands Rulebook and Spellbook
199428.description:
User summary:

The Wastelands rules are detailed in this comprehensive document. The document is available as a single (traditional) file called "The Monstrosity" or as scores of smaller files with single topics (e.g., single spells, etc.). While the contents of the two versions are identical, formatting issues make the multiple document version have a much higher page count. All documents are provided in DOC format.

The game usually is referred to as The Wastelands but occasionally is called The Wastelands LARP Utah to note the live-action play style and location. Early implementation of the rules system were referred to as Jhakarovah.

199429.name: The Plot
199429.description:
From the inlay:

Gadzooks! Make sure November 5th goes with a bang!!!

THE GAME

The day: November 5th 1605.
The place: The Houses of Parliament.
The plot: The destruction of the King and his Parliament.
You must help Guy Fawkes rewrite history and be successful in his attempts to get rid of King and Parliament. Like the original attempt it is fraught with danger, with bats, devils and beasties to hamper your fiendish attempt to fulfil your dastardly plot.

OBJECTIVE

To succeed you must blow up the Houses of Parliament. To accomplish this you must collect the special firework hidden in one of the rooms and take it to the room where all the barrels are stored. When the firework is lit, the game is completed. Guy will need his sticks of dynamite to blow up the building, but can use them to kill the creatures that roam around. There are more sticks lying around, but Guy runs the risk of losing lives collecting them.

FIREWORKS

The fireworks strewn around are for Guy's use, but there are not man and some perform special effects. Indiscriminate use of fireworks can make it impossible to get to the outer reaches of the building, thus completing the game.

199430.name: Castle Conqueror
199430.description:
Castle Conqueror EX is a real-time strategy game for casual gamers.

Commander! Are you ready to lead your people against The Empire!?

Castle Conqueror EX is a real-time strategy game for casual gamers. Players can play as 1 of 4 heroes in the EX version of the DSiWare hit Castle Conqueror. Your mission is to lead your soldiers into battle, seize the enemy’s castle, and gain victories until The Empire is banished from your land.

Other features:

Play through 50 levels with 4 unique heroes that have their own advantages in battle.
The EX version features AI and levels that have been redone.
Enemies are more intelligent and the levels are more challenging.
All items and hero abilities have been redesigned.
A play coins feature that can be used to boost battle effects in-game.
Intended for both casual gamers and hardcore gamers.




Source: The Publisher Website.

199431.name: Artificial Defense
199431.description:
Artificial Defense is a one man made, real time strategy game combining orbital shooter and tower defense components within an electrifying, virtual reality setting. You are the machine, a mighty computer-system defending its servers against swarms of intruding creeps.

Source: The Game Website.

199432.name: LOUD on Planet X

videogamehonor.39170: 2016 CVA Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

199432.description:
Defend your stage with music in this new indie rhythm game featuring Tegan and Sara, CHVRCHES, Lights, Metric, METZ, F*cked Up, HEALTH, Purity Ring, Little Dragon, Austra, Shad, Cadence Weapon, July Talk, Monomyth and more!

Source: The Game Website.

199433.name: Masquerade: The Baubles of Doom
199433.description:
Masquerade is an action-adventure set in the fantasy world of The Realm, centered around a battle for the mythical Druid Orbs, the most powerful pair of balls in all the land. For it was said that whomever possessed the Orbs, possessed the power to rule all.

Source: The Game Website.

199434.name: Save the Dodos
199434.description:
Save the Dodos! We’re all familiar with the sad tale of the charming, yet unintelligent Dodo. But now you can prevent their heart-breaking tale of extinction! Guide the dodos through 100 challenging levels and save our avian dullards from extinction.

Source: The Publisher Website.

199435.name: Demon King Box
199435.description:
Demon King Box mixes real-time strategy with classic RPG gameplay. Gather demons and heroes to join and aid your quest. Multiple types of minions can be gathered not only by conquering, but also by researching minions. The demon heroes can enhance the demon legion with their unique skills. Demons level up and get stronger not only by victory, but also by feeding them with their favourite food.

Other features:

Intense battles that can only be won through strength and skill.
Expansive demon world with diverse locales to be explored
Various demon heroes reveal their personality through captivating voice-over work.
A gripping storyline.
Gallery and achievements offer additional content for the dedicated gamer.




Source: The Publisher Website.

199436.name: Uncle Web Knows Best
199436.description:
Are you ready for a pop-culture trivia game where you have to think up the questions, your opponent provides the answer, and we rely on the Internet to settle the bet?

The handheld 69-card deck features the question prompts from popular categories like movies, TV, sports, corporations, famous people, places, and things.

You versus me, let's go.

If I played the card "US Politicians, current age," and said to you, "Donald Trump, 67 and a half," would you say "Over" or "Under"? Once answered, use your phone to look it up and settle the bet.

Switch roles, play to 9. That simple!

199437.name: The World Library
199437.description:
User summary:

The World Library of Mythic Realms is an online HTML document divided into four major portions:


Terath, a gazetteer and information about the realm of Terath, a primary setting for the game
Lairroth, a gazetteer and information about the realm of Lairroth, a primary setting of the game
People of the World, a series of scores of articles about notable individuals.
Historic World Library, a series of articles about the history of the worlds of the game setting

199438.name: Mythic Realms: Book of Heroes
199438.description:
User summary:

This rules book includes game information about player classes, item manufacture, and ritual magic. Principle rule components include character advancement, allowable classes, extensive rules on in-game "artificing" of magical items, and ritual spell use. Examples of ritual spell development are included.

Within the game rules, the document is considered supplemental.

199439.name: Mythic Realms: Official Rulebook
199439.description:
From the introduction:

Mythic Realms [is] Utah’s largest, finest and longest running Live Action Role-playing organization. When you join in our grand adventure the only limit is your imagination. Create your own fantastic persona and role-play as a unique character in a dynamic world. Your character will grow and experience exciting melee combat, fantastic magic spells, and curious intrigue. You will meet many other real people who are also role-playing their own characters. You can form alliances, join guilds or make enemies; it’s all up to you.

199440.name: Mythic Realms: The Book of Secrets
199440.description:
From the introduction:

The Ritual Magic Skill and the seven different Artifice Skills are advanced paths which allow highly experienced characters to continue to develop new abilities long into their adventuring career. While Artifice and Ritual Magic are vastly different in many ways, they share a fundamental set of rules for how these new abilities are learned. The Ritual Magic Skill allows a character to become proficient in the casting of truly awe-inspiring magic, known as Ritual Spells. The seven different Artifice Skills allow a character to craft advanced equipment by learning new Formulas, and also allow a character to perform Infusions, harnessing and shaping the power of catalyst ingredients within consumable production items.

199441.name: Utah Larp: Rexerit
199441.description:
From the introduction:

The world of Rexerit plays host to over thirty different races and nationalities. The majority of the sentient inhabitants of the world are human, or at least appear human. However that is not the case for all souled creatures who call Rexerit home.

User summary:

Rexerit is one of the main campaign settings for Utah Larp and is detailed in an online HTML document. The document is divided into three major portions:


Glossary of Larp and campaign terms
History of Rexerit
Races and Societies of Rexerit

199443.name: Sooty & Sweep

videogameversion.310259: English/European Amstrad CPC Cassette (EDOS Re-release) edition

199443.description:
From the inlay:

"Izzy Wizzy lets get Bizzy!"

There's always trouble when Matthew goes out. This time he has left Sooty in charge until he returns. Unfortunately Sweep has been up to his old tricks and not only left his dirty old bones all over the house but has left the door to the garden open and all the creepy crawlies have got into the house.

Sooty and Sweep will be in big trouble if they don't clear up all the bones by the time Matthew gets back.

Luckily Sooty has his magic wand out and Sweep his water pistol, (in the two player game). They decide to find all the old bones and ask Soo to help to collect them. As Sooty and Sweep collect the bones they give them to Soo who puts them in the basket. Some of the bones have been left in the most awkward places and Sooty must be very careful when he tries to get them.

The creepy crawlies that are in the house will try to catch Sooty and Sweep. They can be avoided by jumping over them or stunning them with either Sooty's magic wand or Sweep's water pistol.

User Summary

Sooty was a children's TV character first created in 1948. He is a hand puppet of a small yellow bear with black ears, originally operated by Harry Corbett and later by his son Matthew. He was joined by Sweep the dog and Soo, a panda. The Sooty Show first appeared on British television in 1952 and ran for 43 series.

In the mid 1980s, Sooty was still highly popular, hence the video-game tie-in. It is aimed at younger players with both an easy and hard version and was released at a budget price-point. Two players can play simultaneously and semi-cooperatively. Both players are cooperating to collect the bones, but custard pies can be thrown to cause the other player to drop what they are carrying!

199444.name: Utah Larp: Rules
199444.description:
User summary:

The Utah Larp Rules document presents the live-actin roleplaying processes used in the game. By design, the game is a lightweight implementation that always prefers immersive play to mechanics. Few values are tracked, and these generally are tracked only by the player. Players are granted some game bonuses during evaluation periods. One unique aspect of the rules implementation focuses on correct appearance - for example, armor that does not pass cultural and appearance standards is not considered as beneficial as armor that does.

199445.name: Langrisser Re:Incarnation -TENSEI-
199445.description:
The game takes place in a flooded world and the story's protagonist is a man with the Sacred Sword Excalibur, looking to reunite himself with a childhood friend, while fighting the empire's army. The battle system is the same as known from other Langrisser titles, but with 10-on-10 battles fought by super-deformed 3D characters serving as units. The units consist of Infantry, Cavalry, and Archers.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Langrisser_Re%3AIncarnation_Tensei Langrisser Re:Incarnation Tensei]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199446.name: Immolation Nation (LARP)
199446.description:
Publisher blurb:

Immolation Nation is a live action role play that focuses on survival and discovery. In a post apocalyptic world, after nine years of war, players have to find out what caused the nuclear launch shutdown, as well as the loss of all electricity, and vanishing of all other species on Earth.

User summary:

The rules for Immolation Nation are somewhat difficult to access; they are spread over a variety of media formats and there is no central single repository. In addition to numerous "inspirational" videos and photographs, the rules are presented in these core artifacts:


Lox's introduction to Immolation Nation (video)
Character Development (two-page PDF)
Extra Credit Character Development (three-page PDF)
What you'll need for the first game (one-page PDF)
Core Rules (four-page PDF)
Classes and Skills (five-page PDF)
Currency and Equipment (three-page PDF)


Note the setting for the game largely is developed during play for the play site. The rules do not provide an extensive setting description, other than the obvious focus on "Mad Max" style post-apocalyptic gaming.

199447.name: First Contact
199447.description:
What a tangled web we weave

From the introduction:

The PCs have come to the City of Pelarth seeking a contact named Jaressa. They find her missing and must pursue various clues to locate her and rescue her from the clutches of a longtime rival.

User summary:

For a party of four 4th level characters. Note the title of the scenario on the graphic cover is erroneous - the product is First Contact.

199449.name: Table Top Racing: World Tour
199449.description:
Get behind the wheel of 12 ultra-cool, fully tuneable miniaturised racing cars and take on 20 race tracks and some devious opponents through a comprehensive 'Championship Mode' and a multitude of 'Special Events'. Get online for an 8 player battle and become the ultimate Table Top racer! Crush your enemies using cunning 'Power-ups' and unique 'Wheel Weapons' and blast your way to victory! Micro-car, combat racing has never looked so good or been so much fun.

Source: The Game Website.

199450.name: Lucidity, Inc.
199450.description:
From the introduction:

Lucidity, Inc. was formed with the purpose of helping patients resolve severe mental health issues through subconscious intervention. We’re often hired by the friends and loved ones of our patients, either to perform interventions or to help bring someone back from a comatose state.

We operate by sending agents into the dreams of our patients to help them work through their issues subconsciously. When the patient awakens, they feel like they’ve had an epiphany that helps them turn their life around. Our goal is to ensure our patients make changes for the better, although occasional failed missions wind up doing more harm than good.

199451.description:
Description from the publisher:

Rey, Finn, Poe Dameron, and the heroes of The Force Awakens fight for freedom with the Heroes of the Resistance Expansion Pack for Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game. Featuring new sculpts for the Millennium Falcon and Poe Dameron’s black-and-orange T-70 X-wing, Heroes of the Resistance also expands your fleet with three unique X-wing pilots, as well as new versions of Han Solo and Chewbacca. Meanwhile, the pack’s eighteen upgrades introduce new elite pilot talents, Tech upgrades, and unique Title upgrades for both the Millennium Falcon and Black One.
199451.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Heroes of the Resistance Expansion Pack

199452.name: Full Moon Circus
199452.description:
The circus world is full of glamour, magic, and... intrigue. Who is the best, who is the most talented?

Each player gets pair of performers and must bring both of them performers into the circus tent, avoiding the
wicked magician, so they can perform first.

Player in his turn rolls die and move accordingly avoiding the magician. Sometimes He may choose paths - shorter or longer but with ability to find useful items against magician.

The first player who reaches into the circus tent is the winner

199453.name: Charm
199453.description:
Players are princesses who want to charm the Prince.
For this they must create the perfect love potion by collecting the most secret ingredients with the same color in the player's cauldron, while spoiling the potions of the other players with differently colored ingredients.

Players roll die and may choose and put ingredient with the same color to the cauldron with the same color so that other players can´t see the color of this ingredient. If someone thinks the ingredient is incorrect She may cry out: Charming. If You were correct You may put any of Your ingredient to the cauldron of this player. If You lied She may put any of Her ingredient to Your cauldron.

Player who runs out of ingredients may announce that the love potion is ready. The player with the most ingredients matching the color of her cauldron wins.

199454.name: Who am I in Wonderland?
199454.description:
From the publisher´s website:

Which fairy tale hero would you like to be? The Dragon or the Princess? Lets make it a surprise instead!
Pick a card and let the magic begin! Only the others can see who you have become, don't even try to look into the mirror! Your task is to ask clever questions and guess who you are based on the answers of the other players.

In order to guess who or what he/she turned into (what creature the card depicts) the first player has to ask questions from the other players but they can only answer with “Yes” or “No”.
For example:
- Am I human? Boy? Girl? Etc... The well known fairy tales can help you in coming up with the questions. If the first player successfully guesses who or what he/she has been turned into, he/she can look at the card and keep it and it is the next players turn. If the first player is unable to guess the card, you should set it aside. Before you start the game you should agree upon how many times you want to change (how many cards one player can pick during the game) and the player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!

199455.name: The Lost Necklace
199455.description:
From the publisher:

Once upon a time in a far away kingdom, there lived a beautiful princess. One day an evil witch, out of shear jealousy, bewitched her with a deep and empty slumber. The witch ripped apart the princess' magical necklace and scattered its forty pearls in the garden.
You have to gather the forty pearls of the necklace before the last grain of sand falls in hourglass.

Player rolls die in Her turn and either pick a rolled color and place to the necklace or pick a hourglass card if die shows the hourglass.
Players win if they find all 40 pearls.
Players lose if the all the hourglass cards are drawn.

199457.name: Splash
199457.description:
Be a fan of one of the colored contestants on the game board! You can also guess who will be the first to swim across the pool first!

On your turn, roll the color die and move the swimmer with the same color one step further. If one of the contestants acrosses the pool the game ends. Who guesses the winner wins also the game.

199458.name: Bird Catcher
199458.description:
Pick three birds of the same color and place them on the game board! We marked their places with three colored tiles for each
color. That is where you start!

The player who can get all three of his birds to the princess by rolling die and moving before the other players, wins the game. The remaining players continue until all the birds reached the goal.

199459.name: Drip Drop
199459.description:
It´s raining and players race to home and can only move on from hideout to hideout so they don’t get soaked.
The youngest player goes first, then take turns clockwise! When
it’s your turn, throw the die and step forward onto the colored field shown on the die. If you threw pink, then step on the next field with a pink mushroom, if you threw green, step on the next field with a leaf, if you threw blue, go to the next field with a rock! These little drawings show where you’ve hidden from the rain. If you’ve reached the tree stump cottage at the end of the path first You win the game.

199460.name: Airline Director 2
199460.description:
Be the CEO in this Airline manager tycoon game!

Lead the airline with your management skills to global domination in the airline business. It is your job to buy aircraft, open routes, set up maintenance and airline service. You have to overcome challenges such as ageing fleet, volatile economies, rising fuel prices...

Can you make it as an airline manager?

Source: The Game Website.

199461.name: Astral Domine
199461.description:
After crash landing on a mysterious planet, you must explore the ruins of an ancient alien kingdom to retrieve the energy sphere that can restore power to your spaceship. A single player, interactive VR adventure designed for the HTC Vive.

Source: The Developer Website.

199462.name: Fragments of Him

videogamehonor.36078: 2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee

199462.description:
When a young man dies suddenly, his friends and family are left to pick up the pieces. What were his last thoughts, what were the moments in which he changed their lives, and how will their lives be without him?

Fragments of Him is an interactive narrative experience. Follow the story of Will as you see how he influenced the lives of many people.

Source: The Game Website.

199463.name: Adversaries for Advanced Heroes
199463.description:
From publisher blurb:

As characters become more powerful, so must their adversaries. Thus, Villain Codex II: Adversaries for Advanced Heroes is full of new foes for GMs to pit against their PCs.

As in Villain Codex I: Foes for Fledgling Heroes, Villain Codex II: Adversaries for Advanced Heroes presents 12 exciting, memorable NPCs for players, complete with stat blocks across a range of challenge ratings (9-14) to provide GMs with combat challenges their players won’t see coming.

199464.name: Tome of Ethical Necromancy!
199464.description:
From publisher blurb:

Why Does Necromancy Get Such a Bad Rap?

Sure they can call forth dark powers to suck your soul out but they also make one hell of a doctor when you run out of other options! We present ways for you to play a good aligned necromnacer, explain som ways you can use them for good (rather than evil), give you some new spells to help out with that, and toss in the necroknight base class (which uses necromancy to more agreeable ends).

Included:

A 3 page guide on playing good aligned undead and necromancers!
10 new necromancy spells
The necroknight base class: A martial / magical character with the power of the underworld at his fingertips!
The deathly doctor wizard archetype! Play a helpful, healing, necromancer!
The phantom knight archetype for the necroknight which allows you to play as a living (sort of) ghost!
6 new necrotic feats!

199465.name: Young Minds
199465.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game designed for four to five 8th level PCs

Teaching is a noble profession, and one that’s made more difficult by the unwelcome presence of an intellect devourer. Happily, no one but Dean Derthag Dwarfhewer knows about this uninvited guest, and the learned half-orc would like to keep it that way. That’s why he’s turned to the PCs for help. They must enter the grounds of Leverinac Metropolitan University, locate the body-snatching aberration, and dispose of it without any unnecessary violence.

In order to keep a low profile on the investigation, Dwarfhewer plans to enroll the PCs into Leverinac as students. And since seven-foot-tall barbarians and bearded wizards are a dead giveaway, he will provide some youthening magic to do it. Trading in their arms and armor for textbooks and backpacks, the party will have to live through their first day at school, not to mention the depredations of a murderous intellect devourer.

To unravel this whodunit, players must choose whether to ally themselves with the school’s Delinquents or its Honors Society. They will face the perils of curfew, overzealous hall monitors, some very big bullies, and one extremely competitive game of dodgeball. At Leverinac U, it pays to keep your wits about you, especially when the faculty wants to eat your brain.

Also included in “Young Minds”:

A uniquely variable villain whose true identity will change depending on the course of the players’ investigation.
Sandbox gameplay designed to reward quick thinking over brute force.
Witlings, creatures that give a whole new meaning to the phrase “learning through osmosis.”
Hurly, a magical sport pioneered by stone giants, perfected by wizards, and enjoyed by students of all sizes.
Art by White Wolf alumna Laurel Shelley-Reuss.
Designed as a sequel to “For Rent, Lease, or Conquest,” this module also works perfectly as a stand alone adventure.

199466.name: Forest Bunker M-81
199466.description:
From publisher blurb:

Somewhere deep on a forested moon, the heavily fortified bunker M-81 was under the command of Lieutenant Ahernon. Tasked with protecting the western flank, and offering weapon tracking assistance to other nearby fortifications, the bunker was set to withstand an attack by the largest of armies. What Lt Ahernon was not expecting was to be attacked by a small team of commandos..

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a futuristic concrete bunker set within a forested area. The forest is dense, although there is simple undergrowth near the bunker. The walls of the bunker are thick concrete, but inside the floor is plate-steel, with rooms for storage, sleeping, weapons and computers. Ideal for W40K, Firefly and Star Wars games.

199467.name: Everglow Bestiary
199467.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every brave warrior needs an adversary. Every spell-wielding wizard must have an opponent worthy of their skill. Here you will find more than a dozen creatures native to the region of Everglow to fill these very roles in your Ponyfinder game!

Unique and incredible challenges await within, lurking in the shadows until those daring enough to face them come forth!

199468.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 43 - Dec 2015)
199468.description:
From publisher blurb:

End the year with a touch of evil as Carl Cramer presents us with a pair of dark fairytale inspired archetypes for your Pathfinder game. The Stew Witch and the Hash Slinger allow the witch and the ranger to indulge in cooking magic, gaining abilities from the victims they consume. These archetypes are best suited for evil antagonists.

199469.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 44 - Jan 2016)
199469.description:
From publisher blurb:

James Wylie takes a close look at the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's flame blade spell, with new archetypes and feats designed to enhance or complement the flaming sword. The Oasis Guardian is a druid who calls on the burning blade; the Burning Wanderer is a ranger who gains the flame blade in his repertoire; and feats like Divine Flames, Elven Fire Duelist, Lingering Flames, and Soul of Fire extend the flame blade's abilities.

199470.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 47 - Jan 2016)
199470.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Expanded Skills series continues with a detailed look at Disable Device and Linguistics for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Whether you are using Disable Device for demolition, firefighting, or intruder alerts, or Linguistics for research, code, map reading, or riddles, these new uses expand old skills in new and inventive ways and help you make the most out of your character.

199471.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 48 - Feb 2016)
199471.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enhance your Pathfinder game with these three archetypes for those who hide their identity, from the Hidden Master for summoners to the Laughing Avenger for mesmerists to the Masked Rider for cavaliers.

199472.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 50 - Feb 2016)
199472.description:
From publisher blurb:

We've reached our 50th article, in which Carl Cramér introduces a new fighter archetype for the Pathfinder RPG - the fighting familiar! The fighting familiar is a bodyguard and partner to a spellcaster with a magical life-long bond, and the ability to deliver his partner's spells via melee attacks.

199473.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 51 - Feb 2016)
199473.description:
From publisher blurb:

Following up from last week's Fighting Familiar article, the Singing Sword is a new Pathfinder RPG archetype for bards, clerics, oracles, and skalds - a character which assumes the shape of a weapon. While not designed as a long-term character option, it can be used as an NPC, a support character or cohort, adopted for short periods, or even used as a way to handle the absence of players who can only make the game occasionally.

199474.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 53 - Mar 2016)
199474.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our Expanded Skill series continues with a detailed look at Pathfinder's Appraise and Craft skills. Accounting, managing a (fantasy) business, crime, trade, and a whole range of crafts enable characters to engage in a range of business and trade related activities.

199475.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 54 - Mar 2016)
199475.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jonathan Palmer takes a look at the ways a fantasy society would regulate and legislate the use of magic. From registration to mandatory service to guild enforcement, these ideas can help add verisimilitude to your game and create new plot ideas.

199476.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 56 - Apr 2016)
199476.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this discussive article, Carl Cramér takes a look at the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's balance in power between spell casters and non-magical characters, taking into account issues like the 15-minute adventuring day, power level, wands of cure light wounds, buffs and sell selection, magical freebies, combat manoeuvres and edition wars, and fighter or caster friendly rules.

199477.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 57 - Apr 2016)
199477.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three new sorcerer bloodlines for the Pathfinder RPG. The Angelic have the blood of angels running through their veins; the Cursed live with a lingering ancestral enchantment; and the Risen return from the grave to hunt the undead.

boardgamehonor.40226: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee

199478.description:
The excitement in the air is electric as the leaders round the last corner and head for the finish line. Each team has used cunning and skill to position their sprinter for this moment, but only one has done enough to pull off the win!

Will your team lead from the front and risk exhaustion? Should you play it safe in the middle of the pack? Could you surprise everyone by striking from the back? Can you time your move perfectly?

Anyone can race, few become champions!

Flamme Rouge is a fast-paced, tactical bicycle racing game where each player controls a team of two riders: a Rouleur and a Sprinteur. The players’ goal is to be the first to cross the finish line with one of their riders. Players move their riders forward by drawing and playing cards from that riders specific deck, depleting it as they go. Use slipstreams to avoid exhaustion and position your team for a well timed sprint for the win.
199478.name: Flamme Rouge

199479.name: They Came From The Moon
199479.description:
User Summary

A simple puzzle game to heard aliens to a vortex. There are blocks and bouncing mechanisms to add to get aliens to different levels.

199480.name: TRAILseeker (Issue 58 - Apr 2016)
199480.description:
From publisher blurb:

Festivals are staple of the fantasy genre, and this article from Jeff Gomez presents over a dozen festival games to spice up your Pathfinder game world. With festival sizes ranging from a village to a worldwide event, and contests including Bop the Rat, Coal Holder, Shot for Shot, and Ring the Bell, your PCs will easily spend an hour or two exploring the show!

199481.name: En5ider (Issue 51 - Dec 2015)
199481.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet the Planar Explorer and the Way of Infinite Worlds, two brand new archetypes for adventurers who seek to cross the boundaries between worlds. Whether your preferred destination is the Inner or Outer Planes, a lesser-known demiplane, or somewhere even more unusual, these character options are perfect for those who want just little more than the Prime Material can offer.

199482.name: En5ider (Issue 52 - Dec 2015)

rpgissuearticle.198702: Over the Next Hill: Springs of Hverfell

199482.description:
From publisher blurb:

The latest in our Over The Next Hill series of settlements which can be dropped into any campaign brings you Hverfell, located in a hidden verdant valley in the midst of unforgiving tundra. Investigate the Spitz Bathhouse, the Elemental observatory, or the Aviary. Meet the conjurer Leogard Brix or Mistress Ashley Leon of the Ochre Springs Bathworks. As always, the article presents significant NPCs, locations, plus plot hooks and rumors.

199483.name: Fantasy Tales Online
199483.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

A retro-style, top down fantasy-based MMO.

http://www.fantasytalesonline.com/

199484.name: En5ider (Issue 55 - Jan 2016)
199484.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the second in our Epic Threats series, James Introcaso brings us a range of goblinoids and orcs designed to challenge high level adventurers. Meet the brutish Bugbear Savage (CR 18), the depraved Goblin Creeper (CR 16), the battle-hardened Hobgoblin Monarch (CR 14), the devoted Orc Godspeaker (CR 14), and the mighty Orog Devastator (CR 20).

199485.name: Kathy Rain
199485.description:
Set in the 90's, Kathy Rain tells the story of a strong-willed journalism major who has to come to terms with her own troubled past as she investigates the mysterious death of her recently deceased grandfather. Armed with her motorcycle, a pack of cigs, and a notepad, Kathy begins to delve into a local mystery surrounding her hometown that will take her on a harrowing journey full of emotional and personal turmoil.

As she follows a trail of clues he left behind, questions emerge… What was Joseph Rain really looking for that night all those years ago? What turned him into a mere shell of a man, confined to a wheelchair? What secret did a suicidal young artist take with her to the grave, and why are so many people in Conwell Springs going mad? The truth is dark and sinister…

Source: The Game Website.

199487.name: En5ider (Issue 56 - Jan 2016)
199487.description:
From publisher blurb:

Today marks the start of a new series called 'The Holdenshire Chronicles'. A 5E adaption of Russ Morrissey's TO SLAY A DRAGON, the PCs will start their adventuring careers in the sandbox village of Hengistbury, in the county of Holdenshire, before embarking on a quest to travel across the land and slay a dragon. But first, before the adventuring can begin, we launch with this 23-page Holdenshire Primer which introduces you to the county, its peoples, and locations of note.

199488.name: En5ider (Issue 57 - Jan 2016)
199488.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's time to delve into alchemy in your 5th Edition games! This article by Matt Roth presents a new Alchemist's Apprentice background (and it variant, the unorthodox Self-Made Master), a bunch of new alchemical items, and three new feats designed especially for alchemists - Alchemical Artillerist, Expeditious Alchemy, and Pernicious Poisoner.

199489.name: En5ider (Issue 58 - Jan 2016)

rpgissuearticle.198708: It's Never Over: Plot Seeds for the End of the World

199489.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dion Fernandez discusses campaigns which continue... after the end of the world! Using the Survivor background, along with discussion of omnipotent tyrants, world destabilization, and unknown powers, this article contains suggestions and plot seeds for a different kind of campaign.

199490.name: En5ider (Issue 59 - Jan 2016)
199490.description:
From publisher blurb:

As we round off the first month of 2016, we'd like to thank you all for helping us reach that 1,000 patron target! And we hope that every one of you enjoys this instalment of our Epic Threats series from EN5ider veteran James Introcaso in which we bring you - in standard 5E stat-clock format! - the Magma Elemental (CR 16), Mud Elemental (CR 14), Sand Elemental (CR 13), Smoke Elemental (CR 12), Steam Elemental (CR 11), and the mighty Storm Elemental (CR 15).

199491.name: En5ider (Issue 60 - Feb 2016)
199491.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brandes Stoddard describes six sinister spellbooks, along with each's properties and associated plot hooks. Be careful how you handle the Codex of Khiruzam or the Libram of the Crimson Wasting; benefit from the illusion properties of the Green Book of Ka-Jorra or the stormy properties of Herim's Final Manuscript; read from the Prophecies of Ni-Shaan or the Fragments of the Luminous World. Each of these six spellbooks can be used to inscribe or alter your spells.

199492.name: Earn to Die 2
199492.description:
Earn to Die 2 sees a departure from the familiar desert setting of the original game, and delves into the depths of cities overrun by zombies. Prepare for more destruction and more mayhem as you drive your way through hordes of zombies in order to escape... alive!

Source: The Publisher Website.

199493.description:
What are “Escape the Room” games?

Escape the Room games began as digital adventures and quickly turned into real-life events all around the world where players are locked in a room and must uncover clues and hidden objects to escape. ThinkFun’s version of Escape the Room allows you to bring all the excitement of these experiences into your very own home!

The Mystery:
The year is 1913 and you are the lucky winner of a free stay at Foxcrest Retreat, where the famed Dr. Gravely has improved upon the latest in spa treatments and relaxation for those of high social standing. You take a long all-expense-paid train ride to the retreat. Upon your arrival, however, you and your fellow guests may find the "health retreat" is not what it seems...

The Objective:
Work with your guests to discover the dark secret of Dr. Gravely's retreat by finding clues and solving puzzles. But be careful...in the story, the doors have shut and locked behind you. Will you and your guests discover the secret and escape the room before time runs out?
199493.name: Escape the Room: Secret of Dr. Gravely's Retreat

199494.name: Tale of Wuxia
199494.description:
Tale of Wuxia has been dedicated to providing gameplayers with a player-defined platform, where they can customize their own Wuxia. Instead of being restricted to characters’ basic properties and martial arts.

Source: The Game Website.

199495.name: N.E.R.O.: Nothing Ever Remains Obscure
199495.description:
N.E.R.O.: Nothing Ever Remains Obscure is a first person adventure game based on puzzle solving and exploration. NERO is a wonderful journey in an magic world where a kid is the key to all locks and the nights is not as frightening as you could think.

Source: The Publisher Website.

199497.description:
SQUIRMISH™ is the card game of brawling beasties!

Clash crazy card combatants against each other in the massive mad melee known as The Squirmish! KO 3 of your opponent’s cards to win!

You’ll need plenty of luck, strategy, and silly scrappers to knock out three of your opponents’ goofy goons. The rules are simple… draw, place, move or fight, and resolve special abilities… but the unique cards provide infinite variety (and hilarity) to the gameplay.

Squirmish is a fun alternative to mainstream character-battling card games designed to make kids buy packs and packs of cards to get the cards they want. The Squirmish deck includes all the cards you need to play and have fun… no buying endless packs of random cards necessary.

The game include a box of 108 unique cards, each with a different ridiculous rowdy, and the rules. (Note: this description is of the prototype edition. The published game will only include 54 cards unless it reaches its first stretch goal).

Dice and counters are not be included (note: in the prototype edition... again, these may be added if the Kickstarter stretch goals are acheived). Most people already have these things, and it is fun and delicious to play with cereal for damage counters, anyhow.

To begin, you deal 5 cards to each player. The remaining cards become the deck, and you flip a card over to start the discard pile.

Each turn:

You can have up to five cards in your hand at a time. If you have more than that you place or draw a card immediately.

You can have up to five cards in the Squirmish (the mass of cards in the middle of the table) at a time. You can also place by replacing cards you placed earlier that have no damage on them.

Cards can generally only attack cards that are adjacent to them (to the top, bottom, left or right). When an attack is successful, you mark damage on the cards using damage counters. When a card has no hit points left, it is knocked out.

Special abilities are what gives this simple game its strategic complexity. These abilities can effect attacks, defense, healing and other elements of the game. There are also group abilities, which become active when more than one card belonging to a particular group is in play.
199497.name: Squirmish: The Card Game of Brawling Beasties

199498.name: Meltdown and Fallout
199498.description:
Atomic Power, Epic Danger!

Radiation can be scary. You can't see it, smell it, or fight it by any conventional means, but it can be deadly just the same. GURPS Disasters: Meltdown and Fallout helps you bring this invisible threat to your gaming table, and gives adventurers the tools they need to deal with it. Inside this volume, you'll discover:

The most common types of modern nuclear reactors, plus a few theoretical ones. Learn about reactors' core functionality, fuel sources, durability, security measures, and more.

A primer on radiation, including sources and ways to measure it, game effects, updated Protection Factors for various materials, equipment for dealing with radioactive issues (with revised GURPS game mechanics), and a few crazy ways people have used radiation.

What happens during, immediately after, and long after a meltdown, both in terms of scene-setting descriptions and nitty-gritty game mechanics.

Perks, quirks, disadvantages, and skills that normal humans might have, plus radiation-related advantages for exotic beings. Use the provided suggestions to atomically alter people for cinematic action.

Ways to use nuclear power in modern, historical, magical, and futuristic campaigns, plus suggested power-plant complications, adventure seeds, and campaign ideas.

A bibliography of books, films, and GURPS supplements to inspire you, from factual accounts to wild speculations.

Whether you're looking for realistic dangers for near-modern adventurers, cinematic set pieces for modern-day GURPS Action heroes, or apocalyptic possibilities to kickstart a GURPS After the End campaign, Disasters: Meltdown and Fallout is an inexhaustible radioactive sourcebook!

- Publisher's description

199499.name: Goodbye, Mister Dragonfly
199499.description:
User summary:

This delightful game has a vaguely "fairytale" quality in the rules and examples, but the engine is generic and can be used with any type of genre or setting. The design is intended for younger children with limited game experience.

Characters in the game all start with a secret "magical word". The words should be unique (though, being secret, duplicates are possible if unlikely) and must all be the same length, from 4 to 10 letters. Characterization otherwise is created entirely through narrative play.

During opposed actions, the player selects one letter from their magical word, crosses out that letter, and then explains how they are going to resolve the situation - but their resolution must utilize (usually, start with) the letter they have crossed off.

199500.name: Show Offs
199500.description:
From the introduction:

Some heroes are quiet loners who act only for their ideals. To them, the only thing that matters is that the job gets done. They don’t need any credit. Show Offs is not a game about those kind of heroes. The heroes in this game are showboats. They have the opposite of performance anxiety. They love the spotlight, and the bigger the audience the better they perform. Give them an audience big enough and they could accomplish almost anything. Their anxieties occur when they don’t have an audience.

Leave them to do a job alone, and they will most likely fail.
